question.title: Will Coca-Cola recall any products due to metal contamination by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Coca-Cola announces a recall of any of its products due to metal contamination. The recall must be officially confirmed by Coca-Cola or a relevant food safety authority (such as the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service) and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, New York Times). The contamination must specifically involve metal materials found in the food products. If no such recall occurs within the specified timeframe, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Coca-Cola pull back any items due to the presence of metal contamination by the end of August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, Coca-Cola makes a public statement regarding the withdrawal of any of its items due to metal contamination. The recall has to be officially acknowledged by Coca-Cola or an appropriate food safety authority (such as the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service) and covered by at least two credible news outlets (for example, Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, New York Times). The contamination must specifically relate to metal substances found within the food products. If no such withdrawal happens within the designated period, the inquiry will be deemed negative.

question.title: Will Danone recall any products due to metal contamination and Coca-Cola not recall any products due to metal contamination by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: (a) Danone announces a recall of any of its products due to metal contamination. The recall must be officially confirmed by Danone or a relevant food safety authority (such as the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service) and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, New York Times). The contamination must specifically involve metal materials found in the food products. (b) Coca-Cola does not announce a recall of any of its products due to metal contamination. If no recall by Coca-Cola occurs within the specified timeframe, this condition is satisfied. If both conditions are met, the question resolves as YES; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Danone issue a recall for any items because of metal contamination while Coca-Cola refrains from recalling any items due to metal contamination by August 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be considered TRUE if both of the following criteria are fulfilled by August 31, 2024: (a) Danone makes an official announcement regarding the recall of any of its products due to metal contamination. This recall must be confirmed by Danone or a relevant food safety authority (such as the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service) and must be reported by at least two credible news outlets (for example, Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, New York Times). The contamination must specifically involve metal substances found in the food items. (b) Coca-Cola does not make any announcement about recalling its products due to metal contamination. If Coca-Cola does not issue any recall within the specified period, this condition is satisfied. If both criteria are met, the question will be considered TRUE; otherwise, it will be considered FALSE.

question.title: Will either Coca-Cola or Danone recall any products due to metal contamination by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, either Coca-Cola or Danone announces a recall of any of their products due to metal contamination. The recall must be officially confirmed by the respective company (Coca-Cola or Danone) or a relevant food safety authority (such as the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service) and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, New York Times). The contamination must specifically involve metal materials found in the food products. If no such recall occurs for either company within the specified timeframe, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Coca-Cola or Danone will issue a product recall because of metal contamination before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, either Coca-Cola or Danone makes a public announcement regarding a recall of any of their products due to metal contamination. The recall must be officially validated by the respective company (Coca-Cola or Danone) or an appropriate food safety authority (such as the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service) and must be covered by at least two credible news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, New York Times). The contamination must specifically relate to metal substances detected in the food items. If no such recall is issued by either company within the designated timeframe, the answer will be negative.

question.title: Will Union Pacific implement a new scheduling system for freight train operations by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Union Pacific Railroad announces and implements a new scheduling system aimed at making schedules more predictable for freight train operations. The implementation must be confirmed through official company statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The new system must be specifically designed to address the quality of life concerns related to schedule predictability for freight train operations. If no such system is implemented and confirmed by the resolution date, or if the implemented system does not specifically target schedule predictability for freight train operations, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will Union Pacific roll out a new scheduling framework for freight train services by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, Union Pacific Railroad announces and puts into effect a new scheduling framework intended to enhance the predictability of schedules for freight train services. The execution must be validated through official company announcements or reported by at least two credible news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The new framework must be specifically aimed at addressing quality of life issues related to schedule predictability for freight train services. If no such framework is initiated and confirmed by the resolution date, or if the implemented framework does not specifically focus on schedule predictability for freight train services, the inquiry will be considered negative.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Union Pacific reaches a new agreement with the conductors' union addressing work schedule predictability, and (b) Union Pacific fails to implement a new scheduling system for freight train operations?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, both of the following conditions are met: (a) Union Pacific and the union representing train conductors publicly announce a new agreement that specifically addresses work schedule predictability for conductors. This agreement must be officially confirmed by both Union Pacific and the union, and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The agreement should directly address the issue of making schedules more predictable for train conductors. (b) Union Pacific does not announce or implement a new scheduling system aimed at making schedules more predictable for freight train operations. The lack of implementation must be confirmed through the absence of official company statements or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). Alternatively, if a new system is implemented but it does not specifically target schedule predictability for freight train operations, the question will also resolve as YES. If either condition (a) or (b) is not met by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will both of the following take place: (a) Union Pacific successfully negotiates a new contract with the conductors' union regarding the predictability of work schedules, and (b) Union Pacific does not roll out a new scheduling framework for freight train operations?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed TRUE if, by August 31, 2024, both of the following criteria are satisfied: (a) Union Pacific and the union that represents train conductors publicly declare a new contract that specifically deals with the predictability of work schedules for conductors. This contract must be officially validated by both Union Pacific and the union, and covered by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, or prominent national newspapers). The contract should directly tackle the issue of enhancing schedule predictability for train conductors. (b) Union Pacific does not announce or initiate a new scheduling framework intended to improve schedule predictability for freight train operations. The absence of implementation must be corroborated by the lack of official statements from the company or reports from at least two credible news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). Alternatively, if a new framework is introduced but it does not specifically aim at improving schedule predictability for freight train operations, the inquiry will also be considered TRUE. If either condition (a) or (b) is not fulfilled by the resolution date, the inquiry will be deemed FALSE.

question.title: Will Union Pacific implement a new scheduling system for freight train operations or reach a new agreement with the conductors' union addressing work schedule predictability by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs by August 31, 2024: (a) Union Pacific Railroad announces and implements a new scheduling system aimed at making schedules more predictable for freight train operations. The implementation must be confirmed through official company statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The new system must be specifically designed to address the quality of life concerns related to schedule predictability for freight train operations. (b) Union Pacific and the union representing train conductors publicly announce a new agreement that specifically addresses work schedule predictability for conductors. The agreement must be officially confirmed by both Union Pacific and the union, and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The agreement should directly address the issue of making schedules more predictable for train conductors, as mentioned in the ongoing dispute. If neither (a) nor (b) occurs by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will Union Pacific either introduce a new scheduling system for freight train operations or establish a new agreement with the conductors' union that ensures predictability in work schedules?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if one of the following takes place by August 31, 2024: (a) Union Pacific Railroad reveals and puts into effect a new scheduling system intended to enhance the predictability of schedules for freight train operations. This implementation must be validated through official company announcements or reported by at least two credible news organizations (like Associated Press, Reuters, or prominent national newspapers). The new system must specifically target the quality of life issues associated with schedule predictability for freight train operations. (b) Union Pacific and the union that represents train conductors publicly declare a new agreement that directly addresses the predictability of work schedules for conductors. This agreement must be officially acknowledged by both Union Pacific and the union, and covered by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The agreement should focus on enhancing the predictability of schedules for train conductors, as highlighted in the ongoing dispute. If neither (a) nor (b) occurs by the resolution date, the inquiry will be resolved as NO.

question.title: Will Pennsylvania conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Is there a plan for Pennsylvania to hold a vote on abortion rights before August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania holds a public vote aimed specifically at securing protections for abortion rights within the state. For a YES outcome, the following conditions must be satisfied:

1. The vote must be officially declared and carried out by the state of Pennsylvania.
2. The main objective of the vote must center on the protection of abortion rights.
3. The results of the vote must be publicly disclosed through official state channels or widely recognized news outlets.

If no such vote that fulfills these criteria takes place by August 31, 2024, the inquiry will be answered with a NO. It is important to note that simply suggesting or planning a vote without actually executing it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES outcome.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Tennessee enacts new abortion regulations stricter than those for other healthcare providers by July 2024 (b) Pennsylvania does not conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: 

(a) Tennessee enacts new laws or regulations by July 31, 2024, that impose stricter requirements on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers. The enactment must be confirmed by official state legislative documentation or reported by at least two reputable news sources. Stricter requirements may include additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards specific to abortion providers. If no such laws or regulations are enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted laws or regulations apply equally to all healthcare providers, this part will resolve as NO.

(b) Pennsylvania does not conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights by August 31, 2024. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met: No referendum officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania by the specified date, no referendum with the primary focus on abortion rights protection occurs by the specified date, and no referendum results are publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources by the specified date. If such a referendum meeting these criteria does occur by August 31, 2024, this part will resolve as NO.

The overall question will resolve as YES only if both (a) and (b) resolve as YES.

para_P.title: Are the following two events going to take place: (a) By July 2024, Tennessee will implement new abortion regulations that are more stringent than those for other healthcare providers, and (b) Pennsylvania will refrain from holding a referendum on abortion rights before August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with YES if both of the subsequent conditions are satisfied: 

(a) By July 31, 2024, Tennessee introduces new laws or regulations that establish more rigorous standards for abortion providers in comparison to those applicable to other healthcare providers. The implementation must be verified through official state legislative records or reported by a minimum of two credible news outlets. More stringent standards may involve additional licensing, reporting, or facility requirements specifically for abortion providers. If no such laws or regulations are enacted by the deadline, or if any laws or regulations enacted apply uniformly to all healthcare providers, this component will be answered as NO.

(b) Pennsylvania does not hold a public referendum aimed specifically at securing abortion rights protection by August 31, 2024. For a YES resolution, the following conditions must be fulfilled: No referendum officially announced and executed by the state of Pennsylvania by the designated date, no referendum primarily addressing abortion rights protection takes place by the specified date, and no results from a referendum are made public through official state channels or widely recognized news outlets by the due date. If a referendum that meets these conditions does occur by August 31, 2024, this component will resolve as NO.

The complete question will resolve as YES only if both (a) and (b) are answered with YES.

question.title: Will either Pennsylvania conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024, or Tennessee enact stricter abortion regulations by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs:

(a) By August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. The criteria for a YES resolution include:
   1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania.
   2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
   3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.
   If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO for this part.

(b) By July 31, 2024, Tennessee enacts new laws or regulations that impose stricter requirements on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers. The enactment must be confirmed by official state legislative documentation or reported by at least two reputable news sources. Stricter requirements may include, but are not limited to, additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards specific to abortion providers. If no such laws or regulations are enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted laws or regulations apply equally to all healthcare providers, the question will resolve as NO for this part.

The overall question resolves as YES if either (a) or (b) occurs by their respective deadlines.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Pennsylvania to hold a vote on abortion rights by August 2024, or for Tennessee to implement more stringent abortion laws by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a YES if one of the following takes place:

(a) By August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania holds a public vote specifically aimed at establishing protections for abortion rights within the state. The conditions for a YES conclusion include:
   1. The vote must be formally declared and executed by the state of Pennsylvania.
   2. The main emphasis of the vote must be on safeguarding abortion rights.
   3. The outcomes of the vote must be publicly disclosed by official state channels or widely acknowledged news outlets.
   If no such vote that meets these conditions occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will conclude as NO for this segment.

(b) By July 31, 2024, Tennessee enacts new statutes or regulations that impose more rigorous standards on abortion providers in comparison to other healthcare providers. The enactment must be validated by official state legislative records or reported by at least two credible news organizations. More rigorous standards may encompass, but are not limited to, additional licensing, reporting, or facility requirements specific to abortion providers. If no such statutes or regulations are enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted statutes or regulations apply uniformly to all healthcare providers, the question will conclude as NO for this segment.

The overall inquiry resolves as YES if either (a) or (b) occurs by their respective deadlines.

question.title: Will Google's AI assistant be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Google's AI assistant is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the AI assistant and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will there be credible allegations against Google's AI assistant regarding the dissemination of election misinformation?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are trustworthy allegations or official alerts from election officials, governmental bodies, or respected news outlets indicating that Google's AI assistant is disseminating election misinformation. For the context of this inquiry, 'election misinformation' pertains to incorrect or deceptive information concerning election procedures, candidates, or outcomes. Trustworthy allegations should originate from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, prominent news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed research published in credible journals. The allegations or alerts must explicitly reference the AI assistant and its involvement in spreading election misinformation. If no such allegations or alerts are made by the resolution date, the inquiry will conclude as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) The CMA announces completion of a major digital advertising practices investigation by July 2024, and (2) Google's AI assistant is not reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body:
This combined question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

1. By July 31, 2024, the Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) of the UK officially announces the completion of its investigation into digital advertising practices involving at least five major companies. Completion must be confirmed through an official CMA announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the CMA does not announce the completion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation is still ongoing, this part resolves as NO.

2. By August 31, 2024, there are no credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Google's AI assistant is spreading election misinformation. 'Election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the AI assistant and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, this part resolves as YES.

The overall question resolves as YES if both conditions are satisfied.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (1) The CMA will declare the conclusion of a significant investigation into digital advertising practices by July 2024, and (2) There will be no reports of Google's AI assistant disseminating election misinformation by August 2024?
para_P.body:
This combined inquiry results in a YES if both of the subsequent criteria are fulfilled:

1. 2. 'Election misinformation' refers to incorrect or misleading information regarding election procedures, candidates, or outcomes. Trustworthy reports should originate from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or leading US networks), or peer-reviewed research published in reputable journals. The reports or alerts must specifically refer to the AI assistant and its involvement in the dissemination of election misinformation. If no such reports or alerts are issued by the resolution date, this part will resolve as YES.

The overall inquiry will resolve as YES if both conditions are met.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following will happen by the specified deadlines: (a) reports emerge about Google's AI assistant disseminating misinformation regarding elections, or (b) the CMA will declare the conclusion of a significant investigation into digital advertising practices?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with YES if at least one of the following takes place:

(a) By August 31, 2024, credible accounts or formal alerts from election officials, governmental bodies, or trustworthy news organizations indicate that Google's AI assistant is involved in spreading false information about elections. For this question, 'election misinformation' pertains to inaccurate or misleading details concerning electoral processes, candidates, or outcomes. If neither of these occurrences takes place by their designated dates, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Colorado enacts a new law modifying restrictions on medical care for transgender youth by July 2024, and (b) Indiana refrains from conducting a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:

The enactment must be confirmed through official state legislative records and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or local Colorado news stations). The new law must specifically address and alter the existing restrictions on medical care for transgender youth in Colorado. If no such law is enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted law does not modify the current restrictions, this part resolves as NO.

(b) By August 31, 2024, Indiana does not conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. There is no public referendum with the primary focus on abortion rights protection. 3. There are no publicly reported results of such a referendum by official state channels or widely recognized news sources. If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, this part will resolve as YES. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date qualifies for a YES resolution.

The overall question resolves as YES only if both (a) and (b) are satisfied by their respective deadlines. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Land O'Frost issue a recall of deli meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Land O'Frost officially announces a recall of any of its deli meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Land O'Frost's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Land O'Frost
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Land O'Frost recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Land O'Frost will recall its deli meat products because of a listeria outbreak before August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered TRUE if, on or before August 31, 2024, Land O'Frost makes an official statement regarding the recall of any of its deli meat items due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be validated through at least one of the following channels:

1. An official communication on Land O'Frost's website or social media platforms
2. A press statement issued by Land O'Frost
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) that specifically refers to a Land O'Frost recall
4. Coverage from a minimum of three major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) that cite official sources

The recall must clearly state listeria as the cause for the product withdrawal. If no such recall that meets these conditions is announced by the given date, the inquiry will be deemed FALSE.

question.title: Will Boar's Head issue a recall of deli meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024 and will Land O'Frost not issue such a recall by the same date?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024:

1. Boar's Head officially announces a recall of any of its deli meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:
   - An official announcement on Boar's Head's website or social media channels
   - A press release from Boar's Head
   - An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Boar's Head recall
   - Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources
   The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal.

2. Land O'Frost does not officially announce a recall of any of its deli meat products due to a listeria outbreak. This means there should be no recall confirmed through any of the following sources:
   - An official announcement on Land O'Frost's website or social media channels
   - A press release from Land O'Frost
   - An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Land O'Frost recall
   - Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources
   If no recall explicitly mentioning listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal is announced by the specified date, this condition is met.

If both conditions are satisfied by the specified date, the question will resolve as YES. If either condition is not met, the question will resolve as NO.

   If no recall explicitly stating listeria as the reason for the withdrawal of the products is announced by the specified date, this condition will be considered met.

If both criteria are satisfied by the given date, the resolution will be YES. If either criterion is not satisfied, the resolution will be NO.

question.title: Will another U.S. state adopt a Medicaid plan with a community engagement requirement by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes a community engagement requirement for beneficiaries. The community engagement requirement must be a key component of the plan. For a positive resolution, there must be an official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The plan must be officially adopted, not merely proposed or under consideration. If no other state adopts such a plan by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for another U.S. state to implement a Medicaid plan that incorporates a community engagement requirement by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state aside from Georgia formally implements a Medicaid plan that features a community engagement requirement for beneficiaries. The community engagement requirement must be an essential part of the plan. For a positive outcome, there must be an official declaration from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent coverage from a minimum of two credible national news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The plan must be officially enacted, not just suggested or under deliberation. If no other state enacts such a plan by July 31, 2024, the inquiry will be resolved as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 275,000 for four consecutive weeks by August 2024, and (b) no other U.S. state adopts a Medicaid plan with a community engagement requirement by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 275,000 for four consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if this condition is not met within the specified timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered. (b) By July 31, 2024, no U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes a community engagement requirement for beneficiaries. For a positive resolution of this condition, there must be no official announcement from any state government or state's Medicaid agency, and no consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post) about the adoption of such a plan. The plan must be officially adopted, not merely proposed or under consideration. If at least one other state adopts such a plan by July 31, 2024, this condition will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Illinois hold a referendum on healthcare reform by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the state of Illinois officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enacting healthcare reform in the state. The referendum must be officially announced by the Illinois Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, and must be scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must directly address the issue of healthcare reform. This question will resolve as NO if no such referendum is officially announced or conducted by the specified date. Note that merely gathering signatures for a potential referendum does not qualify for a YES resolution; the actual referendum must be scheduled or held within the specified timeframe.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Illinois will conduct a public vote on healthcare reform before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, the state of Illinois officially carries out a public vote aimed at implementing healthcare reform within the state. The public vote must be officially declared by the Illinois Secretary of State or another relevant state election authority, and it must be set to occur on or before August 31, 2024. The question posed in the public vote must explicitly pertain to healthcare reform. This inquiry will result in a NO if no such public vote is officially declared or executed by the specified date. It is important to note that simply collecting signatures for a potential public vote does not meet the criteria for a YES resolution; the actual public vote must be planned or conducted within the designated timeframe.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Pennsylvania holds a referendum on renewable energy initiatives and (b) Illinois does not hold a referendum on healthcare reform?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024:

1. Pennsylvania conducts an official public referendum specifically focused on implementing renewable energy initiatives. For this condition to be met:
   - The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania.
   - The primary focus of the referendum must be on renewable energy initiatives.
   - The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

2. Illinois does not conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enacting healthcare reform. For this condition to be met:
   - No referendum on healthcare reform is officially announced by the Illinois Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority.
   - No such referendum is scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024.
   - The referendum question must not directly address the issue of healthcare reform.

If both conditions are met, the question resolves as YES. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

   - The referendum question must not directly pertain to healthcare reform.

Should both criteria be fulfilled, the inquiry will resolve as YES. If either criterion is unmet, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris announce her running mate at a rally in New York City by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris publicly announces her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in New York City, New York. The announcement must be made by Harris herself during the rally and must clearly identify the individual chosen as her running mate. The event and announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally. If Harris does not make such an announcement at a New York City rally by the end of August 2024, or if the announcement is made through other means or at a different location, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will Kamala Harris reveal her choice for a running mate at a gathering in New York City before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if, by August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris makes a public declaration of her running mate for the forthcoming election at a gathering taking place in New York City, New York. The declaration must be made by Harris herself during the gathering and must explicitly name the person selected as her running mate. The event and declaration must be corroborated by at least two credible national news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the gathering. If Harris fails to make such a declaration at a New York City gathering by the end of August 2024, or if the declaration is communicated through other channels or at a different venue, the inquiry will be deemed NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) California holds a referendum on gun control measures and (b) Kamala Harris does not announce her running mate at a rally in New York City?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: (a) California officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on gun control measures. The referendum must be a statewide vote, officially organized by the state government, and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. The referendum topic must directly address gun control, either proposing to introduce new regulations or to relax existing ones. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on gun control does not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue. If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond August 31, 2024, this part resolves as NO. (b) Vice President Kamala Harris does not publicly announce her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in New York City, New York, or if the announcement is made through other means or at a different location. The announcement must not be made by Harris herself during the rally, or it must fail to clearly identify the individual chosen as her running mate. If Harris makes such an announcement at a New York City rally by the end of August 2024, and the event and announcement are confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally, this part resolves as NO. The overall question resolves as YES only if both (a) and (b) occur as described.

The overall question will resolve as YES only if both (a) and (b) occur as outlined.

question.title: Will the headquarters of a major cybersecurity company be fully relocated to Austin, Texas by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, a major cybersecurity company has fully relocated its headquarters from its original location to Austin, Texas. For the resolution to be affirmative:

1. The relocation must be officially announced by the company or its leadership.
2. The announcement must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times).
3. The new headquarters must be operational in Austin, Texas, with key executive functions transferred.

Partial relocations or plans still in progress by July 31, 2024, will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If the move is not completed and operational by this date, or if the company decides against the move, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will a prominent cybersecurity firm's main office be entirely moved to Austin, Texas?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, a prominent cybersecurity firm has completely shifted its main office from its previous site to Austin, Texas. For the outcome to be affirmative:

1. The move must be officially declared by the firm or its executives.
2. The declaration must be covered by at least two major, credible news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times).
3. The new main office must be functioning in Austin, Texas, with essential executive roles transferred.

Incomplete relocations or plans that are still underway by July 31, 2024, will not suffice for a YES outcome. If the relocation is not finalized and operational by this deadline, or if the firm opts against the relocation, the inquiry resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Google will face additional legal actions from the U.S. government by August 2024, and (b) No major cybersecurity company will fully relocate its headquarters to Austin, Texas by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) By August 31, 2024, Google becomes subject to new legal actions initiated by any U.S. government entity. These legal actions may include, but are not limited to, lawsuits or regulatory actions. To qualify, the legal actions must be officially announced and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). The legal actions must be distinct from any ongoing cases or settlements as of October 1, 2023. If no such new actions are initiated by the resolution date, this condition is not met.

(b) By July 31, 2024, no major cybersecurity company has fully relocated its headquarters from its original location to Austin, Texas. For this condition to be met:
1. No official announcement of a completed relocation by any major cybersecurity company or its leadership is made.
2. Such an announcement is not reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times).
3. The new headquarters is not operational in Austin, Texas, with key executive functions not transferred.
Partial relocations or plans still in progress by July 31, 2024, will be sufficient for this condition to be met. If the move is completed and operational by this date, this condition is not met.

If both conditions (a) and (b) are satisfied, the question resolves as YES. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) by August 2024, Google will encounter further legal challenges from the U.S. government, and (b) no significant cybersecurity firm will have completely moved its headquarters to Austin, Texas by July 2024?

(b) By July 31, 2024, no significant cybersecurity firm has entirely moved its headquarters from its original site to Austin, Texas. For this criterion to be satisfied:
1. No formal declaration of a completed relocation by any major cybersecurity company or its leadership is made.
2. Such a declaration is not reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times).
3. The new headquarters is not operational in Austin, Texas, with essential executive functions not transferred.
Partial relocations or plans still underway by July 31, 2024, will suffice for this criterion to be met. If the relocation is finalized and operational by this date, this criterion is not fulfilled.

If both criteria (a) and (b) are met, the question resolves as YES. If either criterion is not met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either a major cybersecurity company relocate its headquarters to Austin by July 2024, or will Google face new U.S. government legal actions by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs:

1. A major cybersecurity company fully relocates its headquarters to Austin, Texas by July 31, 2024. For this to resolve as YES, the relocation must be officially announced by the company or its leadership, reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times), and the new headquarters must be operational in Austin with key executive functions transferred. Partial relocations or plans still in progress by July 31, 2024, will not be sufficient for a YES resolution.

2. Google becomes subject to new legal actions initiated by any U.S. government entity by August 31, 2024. These legal actions may include lawsuits or regulatory actions and must be officially announced and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). The legal actions must be distinct from any ongoing cases or settlements as of October 1, 2023.

para_P.title: Is it possible that a prominent cybersecurity firm will move its headquarters to Austin by July 2024, or that Google will encounter new legal challenges from the U.S. government by August 2024?
para_P.body:

question.title: Will Apple's Siri be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Apple's Siri is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention Siri and its role in spreading election misinformation.
