para_P.title: Will Alibaba implement strategies to lower electricity use associated with AI by July 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with YES if, by July 31, 2024, Alibaba officially reveals particular strategies intended to lower electricity consumption linked to its AI functions. The disclosure must occur through official company communications (like press releases, blog entries, or annual reports) or be covered by at least two prominent news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The strategies disclosed should consist of tangible actions or initiatives aimed at reducing the energy consumption of Alibaba's AI technologies. If no such disclosure occurs by the stated date, or if the disclosed strategies do not specifically focus on AI-related electricity consumption, the question will be answered with NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) New York holds a referendum on climate change policies by August 2024, and (b) Alibaba does not announce measures to reduce AI-related electricity consumption by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) By August 31, 2024, the state of New York officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on implementing climate change policies in the state. The referendum must be officially announced by the New York Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, and must be scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must directly address the issue of climate change policies. This condition will resolve as NO if no such referendum is officially announced or conducted by the specified date. Note that merely gathering signatures for a potential referendum does not qualify for a YES resolution; the actual referendum must be scheduled or held within the specified timeframe. (2) By July 31, 2024, Alibaba does not officially announce specific measures aimed at reducing electricity consumption attributed to its AI operations. If no announcement is made through official company channels (such as press releases, blog posts, or annual reports) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, New York Times) by the specified date, or if the announced measures do not specifically target AI-related electricity consumption, this condition resolves as YES. The overall question resolves as YES only if both conditions (1) and (2) are satisfied.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) New York will conduct a public vote regarding climate change policies by August 2024, and (b) Alibaba will refrain from announcing steps to cut down AI-related energy use by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (1) By August 31, 2024, the state of New York officially carries out a public vote that specifically focuses on the implementation of climate change policies within the state. The vote must be officially declared by the New York Secretary of State or another relevant state election authority, and it must be scheduled to occur on or before August 31, 2024. The question posed in the vote must directly pertain to climate change policies. This criterion will be resolved as NO if such a vote is not officially announced or executed by the given date. It is important to note that simply collecting signatures for a potential vote does not meet the requirements for a YES resolution; the actual vote must be scheduled or conducted within the specified timeframe. (2) By July 31, 2024, Alibaba does not make an official announcement regarding specific actions aimed at reducing the electricity consumption associated with its AI operations. If no such announcement is made through official company channels (like press releases, blog posts, or annual reports) or reported by at least two major news organizations (for example, Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, New York Times) by the specified date, or if the announced actions do not specifically address AI-related electricity consumption, this condition resolves as YES. The overall question will resolve as YES only if both conditions (1) and (2) are met.

question.title: Will either Alibaba announce measures to reduce AI-related electricity consumption by July 2024, or New York hold a referendum on climate change policies by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if at least one of the following occurs: (a) By July 31, 2024, Alibaba officially announces specific measures aimed at reducing electricity consumption attributed to its AI operations. The announcement must be made through official company channels (such as press releases, blog posts, or annual reports) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The measures announced should be concrete steps or initiatives designed to decrease the energy usage of Alibaba's AI systems. (b) By August 31, 2024, the state of New York officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on implementing climate change policies in the state. The referendum must be officially announced by the New York Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, and must be scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must directly address the issue of climate change policies. This question resolves as NO if neither of these events occur by their respective dates.

para_P.title: Will either Alibaba disclose initiatives to cut down on electricity used for AI by July 2024, or will New York carry out a vote on climate change policies by August 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be considered YES if at least one of the following takes place: (a) By July 31, 2024, Alibaba makes a formal announcement regarding specific initiatives aimed at lowering the electricity consumption linked to its AI operations. This announcement must be communicated through official channels of the company (such as press releases, blog entries, or annual reports) or reported by a minimum of two major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The initiatives disclosed should be tangible actions or programs designed to reduce the energy consumption of Alibaba's AI systems. (b) By August 31, 2024, the state of New York officially holds a public vote specifically aimed at establishing climate change policies within the state. This vote must be officially announced by the New York Secretary of State or another relevant state election authority and must be set to occur on or before August 31, 2024. The question posed in the referendum must directly pertain to climate change policies. This question will be deemed NO if neither of these events occurs by their respective deadlines.

question.title: Will Google announce additional layoffs beyond the initially reported 8% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Google officially announces further layoffs beyond the initially reported 8% of its workforce by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official company statements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The additional layoffs must be clearly separate from and in addition to the initially reported 8% workforce reduction. If no such additional layoffs are announced by the specified date, or if Google only provides updates or clarifications about the initially reported 8% reduction without announcing new cuts, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will Google make a declaration regarding further job cuts exceeding the initially stated 8% by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as YES if Google issues an official statement regarding additional job cuts that go beyond the initially reported 8% of its staff by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be validated through official company communications or reports from at least two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The new layoffs must be distinctly separate from and in addition to the previously reported 8% workforce reduction. If no such further layoffs are declared by the given date, or if Google only shares updates or clarifications about the initially reported 8% reduction without announcing new layoffs, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (1) A major South Korean battery company begins construction of a factory in Michigan, and (2) Google does not announce additional layoffs beyond the initially reported 8%?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: (1) Construction on a large-scale lithium-ion battery factory in Michigan, owned by a South Korean company, has officially commenced. Confirmation must come from at least two of the following sources: official company announcements, statements from the Michigan state government, or reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal). The commencement of construction should involve significant on-site activities such as groundbreaking, foundation work, or major earthmoving operations. Mere preparatory activities like site clearing or permitting processes do not qualify as construction commencement. If no such construction has begun by the specified date, or if the project is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed, the condition is not met. (2) Google does not officially announce further layoffs beyond the initially reported 8% of its workforce. If Google only provides updates or clarifications about the initially reported 8% reduction without announcing new cuts, or if no such additional layoffs are announced by the specified date, this condition is met. The announcement must be confirmed through official company statements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). If both conditions are satisfied, the question resolves as YES. Otherwise, it resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will the following two events take place: (1) A prominent battery manufacturer from South Korea initiates the building of a factory in Michigan, and (2) Google refrains from declaring any further layoffs beyond the previously mentioned 8%?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of the subsequent criteria are fulfilled by August 31, 2024: (1) The construction of a large lithium-ion battery factory in Michigan, owned by a South Korean firm, has officially started. Verification must be obtained from at least two of the following sources: official announcements from the company, statements from the state government of Michigan, or reports from a minimum of three major news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal). The beginning of construction should include significant on-site activities such as groundbreaking, laying foundations, or extensive earthmoving work. Simple preparatory tasks like clearing the site or obtaining permits do not qualify as the start of construction. If no such construction has commenced by the given date, or if the project is officially cancelled or postponed indefinitely, this criterion is not satisfied. (2) Google does not make any formal announcements regarding additional layoffs beyond the initially stated 8% of its workforce. If Google only provides updates or clarifications concerning the initially reported 8% reduction without announcing new layoffs, or if no further layoffs are declared by the specified date, this criterion is fulfilled. The announcement must be validated through official statements from the company or reports from at least two credible news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). If both criteria are met, the inquiry will resolve as YES. If not, it will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will either Google announce additional layoffs beyond the initially reported 8% or a major South Korean battery company begin construction of a factory in Michigan by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs by August 31, 2024: (a) Google officially announces further layoffs beyond the initially reported 8% of its workforce. The announcement must be confirmed through official company statements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The additional layoffs must be clearly separate from and in addition to the initially reported 8% workforce reduction. If no such additional layoffs are announced by the specified date, or if Google only provides updates or clarifications about the initially reported 8% reduction without announcing new cuts, this part resolves as NO. (b) Construction on a large-scale lithium-ion battery factory in Michigan, owned by a South Korean company, has officially commenced. Confirmation must come from at least two of the following sources: official company announcements, statements from the Michigan state government, or reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal). The commencement of construction should involve significant on-site activities such as groundbreaking, foundation work, or major earthmoving operations. Mere preparatory activities like site clearing or permitting processes do not qualify as construction commencement. If no such construction has begun by the specified date, or if the project is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed, this part resolves as NO. If either (a) or (b) occurs, the question resolves as YES; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Google will reveal further job cuts beyond the initially stated 8%, or that a prominent South Korean battery manufacturer will start building a factory in Michigan by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if either of the following takes place by August 31, 2024: (a) Google makes a formal announcement regarding additional job cuts that exceed the initially stated 8% of its workforce. This announcement must be verified through official company communications or reports from at least two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The new layoffs must be distinctly separate from the previously reported 8% workforce reduction. If there are no further layoffs announced by the given date, or if Google only shares updates or clarifications regarding the original 8% reduction without disclosing new layoffs, this part will resolve as NO. (b) The construction of a large lithium-ion battery factory in Michigan, owned by a South Korean enterprise, has officially begun. Confirmation must be obtained from at least two of the following sources: official company statements, announcements from the Michigan state government, or reports from at least three leading news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal). The initiation of construction should involve substantial on-site activities such as groundbreaking, foundation laying, or major earthmoving work. Simple preparatory tasks like site clearing or permitting do not qualify as the start of construction. If no such construction has started by the specified date, or if the project is officially cancelled or postponed indefinitely, this part will resolve as NO. If either (a) or (b) occurs, the question will resolve as YES; otherwise, it will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the UK economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the UK economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the UK economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Will the UK economy steer clear of a recession by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if the UK economy has not fallen into a recession by July 31, 2024. A recession is characterized, for this question, as experiencing two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. The outcome will be NO if the UK economy undergoes two back-to-back quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) General Motors' quarterly net income increases by over 20% year-over-year for any quarter, and (b) the UK economy enters a recession?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) General Motors reports a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, as verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal), and (b) the UK economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024, as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. If either condition is not met, this question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will both of the following take place: (a) General Motors achieves a quarterly net profit growth exceeding 20% year-over-year for any quarter, and (b) the UK enters a recession?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied by July 31, 2024: (a) General Motors discloses a net profit increase greater than 20% for any quarter when compared to the same quarter from the previous year, as confirmed by official earnings reports from the company or at least three reputable financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal), and (b) the UK economy undergoes two successive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024, as documented by the UK's Office for National Statistics. If either of these criteria is not fulfilled, this question will be answered with a NO.

question.title: Will either the UK economy avoid a recession or General Motors' quarterly net income increase by over 20% year-over-year by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) The UK economy does not enter a recession by July 31, 2024, where a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics, occurring between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. (b) General Motors reports a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, in its official financial statements released by July 31, 2024. The increase must be verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or Wall Street Journal. The question resolves as NO if neither of these conditions is met.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the UK economy to evade a recession or for General Motors to report a quarterly net profit rise exceeding 20% year-over-year by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be affirmed as YES if at least one of the following takes place: (a) The UK economy successfully avoids a recession by July 31, 2024, where a recession is characterized as two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as documented by the UK's Office for National Statistics, occurring between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. (b) General Motors discloses a net profit growth of over 20% for any quarter in comparison to the same quarter from the previous year, in its official financial disclosures released by July 31, 2024. This growth must be substantiated through official company earnings reports or by at least three reputable financial news outlets such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or Wall Street Journal. The inquiry will be marked as NO if neither of these criteria is satisfied.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of New Zealand announce a new economic stimulus package by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of New Zealand officially announces a new economic stimulus package. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of New Zealand communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of New Zealand. The announcement should explicitly describe the new economic stimulus package. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of New Zealand maintains the current economic policy, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is the Central Bank of New Zealand expected to reveal a new economic stimulus initiative by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of New Zealand formally discloses a new economic stimulus initiative. The disclosure must originate from an official communication channel of the Central Bank of New Zealand, such as a press release or a public address by the Governor of the Central Bank of New Zealand. The disclosure should clearly outline the new economic stimulus initiative. It must be reported by at least two prominent financial news organizations (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be deemed valid. If no such disclosure occurs by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of New Zealand continues its current economic policy, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) South Korea's KOSPI index reaches or exceeds 3,500 points (b) The Central Bank of New Zealand does not announce a new economic stimulus package?
question.body:
(a) This part resolves as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, South Korea's KOSPI index reaches or exceeds 3,500 points. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Korea Exchange. Intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 3,500 points.

(b) This part resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of New Zealand does not officially announce a new economic stimulus package. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of New Zealand communication channel and be reported by at least two major financial news outlets to be considered valid.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to take place by August 2024: (a) the KOSPI index of South Korea hits or surpasses 3,500 points, and (b) the Central Bank of New Zealand refrains from declaring a new economic stimulus package?
para_P.body:
(a) This component is deemed YES if, at any moment from October 1, 2023 to August 31, 2024, the KOSPI index of South Korea reaches or exceeds 3,500 points. Confirmation will rely on official index reports from trusted financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Korea Exchange. Intraday peaks are applicable for resolution; the index is not required to close at or above 3,500 points.

(b) This component is considered YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of New Zealand does not publicly declare a new economic stimulus package. The announcement must originate from an official communication channel of the Central Bank of New Zealand and be reported by at least two significant financial news outlets to be regarded as valid.

question.title: Will either the Central Bank of New Zealand announce a new economic stimulus package by August 2024, or will South Korea's KOSPI index reach or exceed 3,500 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) By August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of New Zealand officially announces a new economic stimulus package. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of New Zealand communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of New Zealand. The announcement should explicitly describe the new economic stimulus package. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of New Zealand maintains the current economic policy, this component resolves as NO. (b) At any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, South Korea's KOSPI index reaches or exceeds 3,500 points. The 3,500 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Korea Exchange. If the index does not reach 3,500 points during this period, this component resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 3,500 points. If either component resolves as YES, the combined question resolves as YES.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that the Central Bank of New Zealand will introduce a new economic stimulus package by August 2024, or that the KOSPI index in South Korea will hit or surpass 3,500 points by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if at least one of the following happens: (a) By August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of New Zealand makes an official declaration regarding a new economic stimulus package. This declaration must originate from a recognized communication channel of the Central Bank of New Zealand, such as a press release or a public address by the Governor of the Central Bank. The announcement should clearly outline the details of the new economic stimulus package. It must be reported by a minimum of two prominent financial news organizations (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be deemed valid. If no such announcement is made by the given date, or if the Central Bank of New Zealand continues its current economic policy, this part will resolve as NO. (b) At any time between October 1, 2023, and August 31, 2024, South Korea's KOSPI index reaches or exceeds 3,500 points. The threshold of 3,500 points is selected as a notable benchmark that the index may have previously reached before a significant decline. Confirmation will rely on official index reports from trustworthy financial market data providers like Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Korea Exchange. If the index does not attain 3,500 points during this timeframe, this part will resolve as NO. It is important to note that intraday highs are considered for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 3,500 points. If either part resolves as YES, the overall question resolves as YES.

question.title: Will the U.S. government resume consideration of liquefied natural gas export projects by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the U.S. federal government has officially resumed the consideration of projects aimed at exporting liquefied natural gas (LNG). The resumption must be confirmed through official government announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or The Wall Street Journal). The resumption should involve the active processing or review of LNG export project applications by relevant federal agencies. If no such resumption occurs by the resolution date, or if the pause on consideration remains in effect, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not require the approval of any specific projects, only the resumption of the consideration process.

para_P.title: Will the U.S. administration restart the evaluation of liquefied natural gas export initiatives by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by July 31, 2024, the U.S. federal administration has officially restarted the evaluation of initiatives focused on exporting liquefied natural gas (LNG). The restart must be verified through official government announcements or reports from at least two credible news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or The Wall Street Journal). The restart should involve the active processing or assessment of LNG export project applications by the relevant federal authorities. If no such restart occurs by the resolution date, or if the halt on evaluation persists, the inquiry will be answered with NO. It is important to note that this question does not necessitate the approval of any specific initiatives, only the resumption of the evaluation process.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) BYD's quarterly net income increases by over 20% year-over-year, and (b) the U.S. government does not resume consideration of liquefied natural gas export projects?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) BYD reports a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal), and (b) the U.S. federal government has not officially resumed the consideration of projects aimed at exporting liquefied natural gas (LNG), confirmed through the absence of official government announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or The Wall Street Journal). If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will both of the following happen: (a) BYD's quarterly net profit rises by more than 20% compared to the previous year, and (b) the U.S. government will not restart its evaluation of liquefied natural gas export initiatives?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if both of the subsequent criteria are fulfilled by July 31, 2024: (a) BYD discloses a net profit increase exceeding 20% for any quarter relative to the same quarter from the previous year, validated through official earnings reports from the company or at least three trustworthy financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal), and (b) the U.S. federal government has not officially renewed its evaluation of projects intended for the export of liquefied natural gas (LNG), confirmed by the lack of official governmental announcements or reports from a minimum of two reputable news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or The Wall Street Journal). If either of the criteria is unmet, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by July 2024: (a) the U.S. government resumes consideration of liquefied natural gas export projects, OR (b) BYD's quarterly net income increases by over 20% year-over-year?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs by July 31, 2024: (a) The U.S. federal government officially resumes the consideration of projects aimed at exporting liquefied natural gas (LNG). This resumption must be confirmed through official government announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or The Wall Street Journal), involving the active processing or review of LNG export project applications by relevant federal agencies. (b) BYD reports a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, in its official financial statements released by July 31, 2024. This increase must be verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal). If neither of these conditions is met by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that by July 2024, either (a) the U.S. government will restart its evaluation of liquefied natural gas export initiatives, or (b) BYD's quarterly net profit will rise by more than 20% compared to the previous year?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by July 31, 2024, at least one of the following takes place: (a) The U.S. federal government officially reopens the evaluation of projects related to the export of liquefied natural gas (LNG). This reopening must be substantiated by official government announcements or reports from a minimum of two reliable news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or The Wall Street Journal), indicating that relevant federal agencies are actively processing or reviewing applications for LNG export projects. (b) BYD discloses a net profit increase exceeding 20% for any quarter when compared to the same quarter from the previous year, in its official financial disclosures released by July 31, 2024. This increase must be confirmed through official company earnings reports or at least three trustworthy financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal). If neither of these scenarios occurs by the resolution date, the question will be answered with NO.

question.title: Will Union Pacific implement a new scheduling system for train engineers in Texas by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Union Pacific Railroad announces and implements a new scheduling system aimed at making schedules more predictable for train engineers operating in Texas. The implementation must be confirmed through official company statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The new system must be specifically designed to address the quality of life concerns related to schedule predictability for train engineers in Texas. If no such system is implemented and confirmed by the resolution date, or if the implemented system does not specifically target schedule predictability for engineers in Texas, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will Union Pacific roll out a new timetable system for train operators in Texas by the end of August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, Union Pacific Railroad declares and puts into action a new timetable system intended to enhance the predictability of schedules for train operators working in Texas. The rollout must be validated through official announcements from the company or covered by at least two credible news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The new system should be explicitly targeted at addressing the quality of life issues associated with schedule predictability for train operators in Texas. If no such system is rolled out and confirmed by the resolution date, or if the system that is implemented does not specifically focus on schedule predictability for operators in Texas, the inquiry will be considered negative.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Union Pacific implements a new scheduling system for passenger train services, and (b) Union Pacific does not implement a new scheduling system for train engineers in Texas?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: (a) Union Pacific Railroad announces and implements a new scheduling system aimed at making schedules more predictable for passenger train services, confirmed through official company statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers), and specifically designed to address quality of life concerns related to schedule predictability for passenger train services; and (b) Union Pacific Railroad does not announce and implement a new scheduling system aimed at making schedules more predictable for train engineers operating in Texas, confirmed through official company statements or the absence of reports by at least two reputable news sources. If both conditions are not met, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) Union Pacific introduces a new scheduling system for passenger train operations, and (b) Union Pacific refrains from introducing a new scheduling system for train engineers in Texas?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if the following two criteria are fulfilled by August 31, 2024: (a) Union Pacific Railroad publicly announces and puts into effect a new scheduling system designed to enhance the predictability of schedules for passenger train operations, which must be verified by official company communications or reported by at least two credible news outlets (like Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers), specifically intended to improve quality of life regarding schedule predictability for passenger train services; and (b) Union Pacific Railroad does not announce or implement a new scheduling system aimed at improving schedule predictability for train engineers working in Texas, validated by official company statements or the lack of reports from at least two credible news sources. If either of these criteria is not satisfied, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Union Pacific implement a new scheduling system for either train engineers in Texas or passenger train services by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Union Pacific Railroad announces and implements a new scheduling system aimed at making schedules more predictable for either train engineers operating in Texas or for passenger train services. The implementation must be confirmed through official company statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The new system must be specifically designed to address the quality of life concerns related to schedule predictability for either engineers in Texas or passenger train services. If no such system is implemented and confirmed by the resolution date, or if the implemented system does not specifically target schedule predictability for either of these groups, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will Union Pacific introduce a new scheduling system for train engineers in Texas or for passenger train services by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, Union Pacific Railroad announces and puts into practice a new scheduling system aimed at enhancing schedule predictability for either train engineers working in Texas or for passenger train services. The confirmation of this implementation must come from official company announcements or be reported by at least two credible news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The new system must be specifically created to address the quality of life issues associated with schedule predictability for either engineers in Texas or passenger train services. If no such system is introduced and confirmed by the resolution date, or if the system that is put in place does not specifically focus on schedule predictability for either of these groups, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Pennsylvania conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Pennsylvania will hold a referendum regarding abortion rights before August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, prior to August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania holds a public referendum aimed specifically at establishing protections for abortion rights within the state. To achieve a YES outcome, the following conditions must be satisfied:

1. The state of Pennsylvania must officially announce and carry out the referendum.
2. The referendum must primarily address the protection of abortion rights.
3. The results of the referendum must be made public through official state announcements or reputable news outlets.

If such a referendum that meets these stipulations does not take place by August 31, 2024, the question will be answered with a NO. It is important to note that simply suggesting or planning a referendum without its execution by the given date does not qualify for a YES answer.

question.title: Will Missouri remove the work requirement from its Medicaid plan by July 2024 AND will Pennsylvania not conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following occur: (1) By July 31, 2024, the state of Missouri officially announces the removal of the work requirement from its Medicaid plan. This must be confirmed through official state announcements or reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The work requirement refers to the condition that beneficiaries must work or engage in other qualifying activities to receive Medicaid benefits. (2) By August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania does not conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. This means no referendum is officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania, the primary focus of any conducted referendum is not on abortion rights protection, and no referendum results are publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources. If both conditions are met, the question resolves as YES. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Missouri eliminate the employment mandate from its Medicaid program by July 2024 AND will Pennsylvania refrain from holding a vote on abortion rights by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if both of the following take place: (1) By July 31, 2024, Missouri officially declares the elimination of the employment mandate from its Medicaid program. This must be verified through official state declarations or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or significant national newspapers). The employment mandate refers to the requirement that recipients must work or engage in other qualifying activities to receive Medicaid assistance. (2) By August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania does not hold a public vote specifically aimed at establishing protections for abortion rights in the state. This means no vote is officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania, the primary focus of any conducted vote is not on the protection of abortion rights, and no vote results are publicly disclosed by official state channels or widely recognized news outlets. If both conditions are satisfied, the inquiry resolves as YES. If either condition is not satisfied, the inquiry resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either Pennsylvania conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024 or Missouri remove the work requirement from its Medicaid plan by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs:

(a) By August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:
1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.
If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, this part of the question will resolve as NO.

(b) By July 31, 2024, the state of Missouri officially announces the removal of the work requirement from its Medicaid plan. The change must be confirmed through official state announcements or reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The work requirement refers to the condition that beneficiaries must work or engage in other qualifying activities to receive Medicaid benefits. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the work requirement remains in place, this part of the question resolves as NO.

The overall question resolves as YES if either (a) or (b) resolves as YES.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Pennsylvania will hold a vote on abortion rights by August 2024, or that Missouri will eliminate the work requirement from its Medicaid program by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a YES if one of the following takes place:

(a) By August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania carries out a public vote aimed at establishing protections for abortion rights within the state. For a YES outcome, the following conditions must be satisfied:
1. The vote must be formally declared and executed by the state of Pennsylvania.
2. The main emphasis of the vote must be on safeguarding abortion rights.
3. The results of the vote must be disclosed by official state channels or widely acknowledged news outlets.
If no such vote that fulfills these conditions occurs by August 31, 2024, this segment of the question will conclude as NO.

(b) By July 31, 2024, the state of Missouri officially declares the removal of the work requirement from its Medicaid program. This change must be verified through official state communications or reported by at least two prominent news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The work requirement pertains to the stipulation that beneficiaries must work or participate in other qualifying activities to obtain Medicaid benefits. If no such declaration is made by the resolution date, or if the work requirement continues to be enforced, this portion of the question will resolve as NO.

The entire question will resolve as YES if either (a) or (b) resolves as YES.

question.title: Will Georgia hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Georgia officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Georgia state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

para_P.title: Will a public vote on abortion rights take place in Georgia before August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, Georgia formally carries out a public vote that is specifically aimed at establishing protections for abortion rights within the state. For a positive outcome:

1. The public vote must be officially declared and executed by the Georgia state authorities.
2. The public vote must directly tackle the matter of safeguarding abortion rights.
3. The outcomes of the public vote must be disclosed by official state sources or well-known news outlets.

The inquiry will be answered with a NO if:

1. No such public vote takes place by August 31, 2024.
2. A scheduled public vote is called off or delayed past the indicated date.
3. A public vote occurs, but it does not specifically aim at establishing protections for abortion rights.

Note: This inquiry does not take into account the result of the public vote, only whether it occurs within the designated timeframe.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) the FTC announces completion of a major pricing practices investigation by July 2024, and (b) Georgia does not hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) By July 31, 2024, the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) officially announces the completion of its investigation into pricing practices that use personal data to set prices based on individual shopper characteristics. The investigation must involve at least five major companies. Completion must be confirmed through an official FTC announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the FTC does not announce the completion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation is still ongoing, this part resolves as NO.

(b) By August 31, 2024, Georgia does not officially conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:
   1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
   2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
   3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.
   The question will resolve as NO if:
   1. The referendum is officially announced and conducted by the Georgia state government.
   2. The referendum explicitly addresses the issue of abortion rights protection.
   3. The results of the referendum are publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

This combined question resolves as YES only if both (a) and (b) occur as described.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) the FTC will declare the conclusion of a significant investigation into pricing practices by July 2024, and (b) Georgia will refrain from holding a referendum regarding abortion rights by August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if the following two conditions are satisfied:

(a) By July 31, 2024, the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) publicly announces that it has finished its investigation into pricing strategies that utilize personal data to determine prices based on individual consumer traits. This investigation must involve at least five major corporations. The completion must be verified through an official FTC announcement or reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the FTC does not declare the conclusion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation remains ongoing, this part will resolve as NO.

(b) By August 31, 2024, Georgia does not officially hold a public referendum specifically aimed at establishing protections for abortion rights within the state. For a positive resolution:
   1. No such referendum takes place by August 31, 2024.
   2. A planned referendum is canceled or delayed beyond the specified date.
   3. A referendum is conducted, but it does not specifically aim at establishing protections for abortion rights.
   The question will resolve as NO if:
   1. The referendum is officially announced and held by the Georgia state government.
   2. The referendum directly addresses the matter of abortion rights protection.
   3. The results of the referendum are publicly disclosed by official state channels or widely recognized news outlets.

This combined question will resolve as YES only if both (a) and (b) occur as outlined.

question.title: Will either Georgia hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024, or the FTC announce completion of a major pricing practices investigation by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs:

1. Georgia officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights by August 31, 2024. For this to resolve as YES:
   - The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Georgia state government.
   - It must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
   - The results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

2. The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) officially announces the completion of its investigation into pricing practices that use personal data to set prices based on individual shopper characteristics by July 31, 2024. For this to resolve as YES:
   - The investigation must involve at least five major companies.
   - Completion must be confirmed through an official FTC announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times).

If neither of these events occurs within their respective timeframes, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either Georgia will conduct a public vote on abortion rights before August 2024, or the FTC will declare the conclusion of a significant investigation into pricing practices by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if one of the following takes place:

1. Georgia officially holds a public vote aimed at establishing protections for abortion rights by August 31, 2024. For this to be a YES:
   - The vote must be formally announced and executed by the Georgia state authorities.
   - It must directly tackle the matter of protecting abortion rights.
   - The outcomes must be publicly disclosed by official state channels or well-known news organizations.

2. The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) formally announces that its investigation into pricing practices that utilize personal data to determine prices based on individual consumer traits has concluded by July 31, 2024. For this to be a YES:
   - The investigation must involve at least five major corporations.
   - The conclusion must be validated through an official FTC announcement or reported by no fewer than two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times).

If neither of these scenarios occurs within their designated timeframes, the question will be answered as NO.

question.title: Will the average rate on a 15-year mortgage exceed 5.5% by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, at any point during August 2024, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage, as reported by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, exceeds 5.5%. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. If the rate does not exceed 5.5% at any point during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. For clarity, the rate must surpass 5.5%, not merely equal it.

para_P.title: Will the typical interest rate for a 15-year mortgage go beyond 5.5% by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, at any time throughout August 2024, the typical interest rate for a 15-year fixed mortgage, as documented by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, goes beyond 5.5%. The rate must be validated by official reports from Freddie Mac or credible financial news outlets such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. Conversely, if the rate does not exceed 5.5% at any moment during August 2024, the answer will be NO. To clarify, the rate must exceed 5.5%, not just match it.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) PepsiCo report increased North American demand for its Cracker Jack brand by July 2024 and (b) the average rate on a 15-year mortgage not exceed 5.5% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) By July 31, 2024, PepsiCo reports an increase in North American demand for its Cracker Jack brand compared to the demand reported in the second quarter of 2023. The increase must be confirmed through official company earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The demand increase should be explicitly stated or clearly implied in the company's financial results or official communications. (b) At no point during August 2024 does the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage, as reported by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, exceed 5.5%. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. If the rate exceeds 5.5% at any point during August 2024, the condition is not met. For clarity, the rate must not surpass 5.5%, it can be equal to or less than 5.5%. If both conditions are met, the question resolves as YES. If either or both conditions are not met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place: (a) by July 2024, PepsiCo will report a rise in North American demand for its Cracker Jack brand and (b) the average rate on a 15-year mortgage will not go above 5.5% by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (a) By July 31, 2024, PepsiCo must announce an increase in North American demand for its Cracker Jack brand compared to the demand figures from the second quarter of 2023. This increase has to be validated through official earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo, and corroborated by at least two credible news outlets (like Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The demand increase should be clearly articulated or strongly implied in the company’s financial results or official communications. (b) Throughout August 2024, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage, as reported by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, must not exceed 5.5%. This rate needs to be verified by official reports from Freddie Mac or trustworthy financial news organizations such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. If the rate goes beyond 5.5% at any moment during August 2024, the condition is deemed unmet. To clarify, the rate must remain at or below 5.5%. If both criteria are fulfilled, the inquiry resolves to YES. If either or both criteria are not fulfilled, the inquiry resolves to NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by their respective dates: (a) The average rate on a 15-year mortgage exceed 5.5% in August 2024, or (b) PepsiCo report increased North American demand for Cracker Jack by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) At any point during August 2024, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage, as reported by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, exceeds 5.5%. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. The rate must surpass 5.5%, not merely equal it. (b) By July 31, 2024, PepsiCo reports an increase in North American demand for its Cracker Jack brand compared to the demand reported in the second quarter of 2023. The increase must be confirmed through official company earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The demand increase should be explicitly stated or clearly implied in the company's financial results or official communications. If neither of these conditions is met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following will take place by the specified deadlines: (a) The average interest rate for a 15-year mortgage surpass 5.5% in August 2024, or (b) PepsiCo announces a rise in North American interest for Cracker Jack by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if at least one of the following happens: (a) At any point in August 2024, the average interest rate for a 15-year fixed mortgage, as documented by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, goes beyond 5.5%. This rate must be verified by official reports from Freddie Mac or credible financial news outlets like Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. The rate must exceed 5.5%, rather than just match it. (b) By July 31, 2024, PepsiCo must report a growth in North American demand for its Cracker Jack brand compared to the figures from the second quarter of 2023. This growth must be validated through official earnings reports or announcements from PepsiCo and covered by at least two trustworthy news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The increase in demand should be clearly stated or strongly suggested in the company's financial results or official statements. If neither of these conditions is satisfied, the question will be answered with a NO.

question.title: Will the United Kingdom's House of Lords pass a major economic reform bill opposed by Prime Minister Sunak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United Kingdom's House of Lords passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the House of Lords, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from Prime Minister Sunak or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the UK economy.

If no such bill is passed by the House of Lords by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the House of Lords in the United Kingdom approve a significant economic reform legislation that Prime Minister Sunak is against by the end of August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by August 31, 2024, the House of Lords in the United Kingdom approves a significant economic reform legislation that is clearly opposed by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak or his government. To be considered:

1. The legislation must pertain to economic matters, including fiscal expenditure, taxation, or monetary policies.
2. It should be approved by the House of Lords, irrespective of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from Prime Minister Sunak or his government must be distinctly reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The legislation must be characterized as 'significant' or 'major' by these news outlets in relation to its possible effect on the UK economy.

If no such legislation is approved by the House of Lords by August 31, 2024, or if a legislation is approved but fails to meet all the aforementioned criteria, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Apple finalizes a union contract with store employees in Ohio by July 2024, and (b) the UK's House of Lords fails to pass a major economic reform bill opposed by Prime Minister Sunak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: 

(a) By July 31, 2024, Apple has finalized and officially signed a collective bargaining contract with the unionized store employees in Ohio. Confirmation must come from official announcements by Apple, the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers' Coalition of Organized Retail Employees, or be reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). The contract must be the first of its kind for Apple in the United States. If no such finalization and signing of the contract occurs by the specified date, or if the contract is still in a tentative or non-finalized state, the question resolves as NO.

(b) By August 31, 2024, the United Kingdom's House of Lords does not pass a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak or his administration. To qualify:
   1. No bill related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy, is passed by the House of Lords.
   2. If any bill is passed, it must not meet one or more of the following criteria:
      - It is not explicitly opposed by Prime Minister Sunak or his administration, as reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
      - It is not described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the UK economy.

If no such bill is passed by the House of Lords by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as YES.

The question resolves as YES only if both (a) and (b) are true. If either one or both are false, it resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to take place: (a) Apple completes a union agreement with its store staff in Ohio by July 2024, and (b) the UK's House of Lords does not approve a significant economic reform bill that Prime Minister Sunak opposes by August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if both of the following conditions are satisfied: 

(a) By July 31, 2024, Apple has successfully concluded and officially endorsed a collective bargaining agreement with the unionized retail employees in Ohio. Verification must be obtained from official statements by Apple, the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers' Coalition of Organized Retail Employees, or reported by at least two credible news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or prominent national newspapers). This contract must be the inaugural agreement of its kind for Apple in the United States. If the finalization and endorsement of the contract do not occur by the specified deadline, or if the contract remains tentative or unratified, the inquiry will be resolved as negative.

(b) By August 31, 2024, the House of Lords in the United Kingdom does not pass a significant economic reform bill that is clearly opposed by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak or his government. To qualify:
   1. No legislation pertaining to economic policy, including fiscal expenditure, taxation, or monetary regulation, is passed by the House of Lords.
   2. If any legislation is passed, it must not fulfill one or more of the following criteria:
      - It is not explicitly opposed by Prime Minister Sunak or his government, as reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
      - It is not characterized as 'major' or 'significant' by these news outlets regarding its potential effect on the UK economy.

If no such legislation is passed by the House of Lords by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but fails to meet all the specified criteria, the inquiry will resolve as affirmative.

The inquiry resolves as affirmative only if both (a) and (b) hold true. If either or both are false, it resolves as negative.

para_P.body:
