If no such conclusion and signing of the agreement occurs by the specified date, or if the agreement remains in a tentative or unresolved state, this segment will resolve as FALSE.

question.title: Will the Bank of England announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of England officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of England communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for monetary policy.

para_P.title: Will the Bank of England declare a reduction in interest rates before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if the Bank of England formally declares a reduction in interest rates to take effect by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be verified through official communications from the Bank of England, such as press releases, statements from the Monetary Policy Committee, or public addresses by Bank representatives. If no such declaration is made by the resolution date, the inquiry resolves as NO. It is important to note that the actual date of implementation for the rate reduction may occur after August 31, 2024, provided that the declaration itself is made by that date. The interest rate in question pertains to the Bank Rate, which serves as the primary instrument for monetary policy of the Bank of England.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) GNC Holdings emerges from bankruptcy by July 2024 and (b) the Bank of England does not announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) By July 31, 2024, GNC Holdings officially emerges from its Chapter 11 bankruptcy proceedings, confirmed by at least two reputable financial news outlets or through official company statements or court documents, involving a court-approved reorganization plan that allows GNC Holdings to continue operations with a restructured financial position. (b) The Bank of England does not officially announce an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The interest rate in question refers to the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for monetary policy. If either GNC Holdings fails to emerge from bankruptcy by the specified date or the Bank of England announces an interest rate cut by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) GNC Holdings will successfully exit bankruptcy by July 2024 and (b) the Bank of England will refrain from declaring an interest rate reduction by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (a) By July 31, 2024, GNC Holdings officially exits its Chapter 11 bankruptcy process, as confirmed by at least two credible financial news sources or through official announcements from the company or court records, involving a reorganization plan sanctioned by the court that enables GNC Holdings to operate with a revised financial structure. (b) The Bank of England does not make an official announcement regarding an interest rate cut that would take effect by August 31, 2024. The interest rate in question pertains to the Bank Rate, which serves as the Bank of England's main instrument for monetary policy. If either GNC Holdings does not emerge from bankruptcy by the indicated date or the Bank of England announces an interest rate cut by August 31, 2024, the resolution will be NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by mid-2024: (a) The Bank of England announces an interest rate cut (b) GNC Holdings emerges from bankruptcy?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following events occurs by their respective dates: (a) The Bank of England officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of England communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for monetary policy. (b) GNC Holdings officially emerges from its Chapter 11 bankruptcy proceedings by July 31, 2024. The emergence must be confirmed by at least two reputable financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, or CNBC) or through official company statements or court documents. The emergence should involve a court-approved reorganization plan that allows GNC Holdings to continue operations with a restructured financial position. If neither event occurs by their respective dates, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that by the middle of 2024, either (a) the Bank of England will declare a reduction in interest rates, or (b) GNC Holdings will successfully exit bankruptcy?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if at least one of the following situations takes place by the specified deadlines: (a) The Bank of England makes an official declaration of an interest rate reduction to be effective by August 31, 2024. This declaration must be validated by formal communications from the Bank of England, such as press releases, statements from the Monetary Policy Committee, or public addresses from Bank officials. It is important to note that the actual date when the rate cut is implemented may occur after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself is made by that date. The interest rate in question pertains to the Bank Rate, which serves as the primary instrument of monetary policy for the Bank of England. (b) GNC Holdings officially exits its Chapter 11 bankruptcy by July 31, 2024. This exit must be corroborated by at least two credible financial news organizations (like Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, or CNBC) or through official statements from the company or court documents. The exit should involve a court-sanctioned reorganization plan that enables GNC Holdings to operate with a restructured financial foundation. If neither of these events takes place by their respective deadlines, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will the World Health Organization declare the current Nipah virus outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing Nipah virus outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted heightened public health responses globally. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will the World Health Organization announce the conclusion of the current Nipah virus outbreak by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) formally states that the ongoing Nipah virus outbreak has concluded by August 31, 2024. This declaration must be validated by official announcements from the WHO or reports from a minimum of three credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak mentioned in this inquiry is the one that led to increased global public health measures. If no such declaration is made to signify the end of the outbreak by the specified resolution date, or if the WHO prolongs the emergency status past August 31, 2024, the inquiry will be answered with a NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) The mpox outbreak in the Central African Republic is declared over by July 2024, and (2) The World Health Organization does not declare the current Nipah virus outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) By July 31, 2024, the mpox outbreak in the Central African Republic is officially declared over by the country's health authorities or the World Health Organization (WHO), with the declaration reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN). (2) The World Health Organization (WHO) does not officially declare the ongoing Nipah virus outbreak over by August 31, 2024, meaning no declaration is made or the emergency status is extended beyond August 31, 2024, confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). If both conditions are met, the question resolves as YES; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the following events take place: (1) The mpox outbreak in the Central African Republic is officially announced as over by July 2024, and (2) The World Health Organization does not announce the current Nipah virus outbreak as over by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if both of the subsequent criteria are fulfilled: (1) By July 31, 2024, the mpox outbreak in the Central African Republic is officially declared concluded by the nation's health authorities or the World Health Organization (WHO), with the announcement covered by at least two credible international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN). (2) The World Health Organization (WHO) does not officially state that the ongoing Nipah virus outbreak is over by August 31, 2024, indicating that no announcement is made or the emergency status is prolonged past August 31, 2024, as verified by official WHO statements or reports from at least three trustworthy news agencies (like Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). If both criteria are satisfied, the inquiry resolves as YES; if not, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either the WHO declare the current Nipah virus outbreak over by August 2024, or the mpox outbreak in the Central African Republic be declared over by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if at least one of the following occurs: (a) The World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing Nipah virus outbreak over by August 31, 2024. This must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). (b) The mpox outbreak in the Central African Republic is officially declared over by the country's health authorities or the WHO by July 31, 2024. This must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN). If neither of these declarations is made by their respective resolution dates, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will the ongoing Nipah virus outbreak be officially declared over by the WHO by August 2024, or will the mpox outbreak in the Central African Republic be officially ended by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if at least one of the following takes place: (a) The World Health Organization (WHO) makes an official announcement that the current Nipah virus outbreak is concluded by August 31, 2024. This must be corroborated by official WHO communications or reports from a minimum of three credible news outlets (like Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). (b) The health authorities of the Central African Republic or the WHO announce that the mpox outbreak is officially over by July 31, 2024. This must be covered by at least two trustworthy international news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN). If neither of these announcements occur by their respective deadlines, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Spotify announce additional layoffs beyond the initially reported 2% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Spotify officially announces further layoffs beyond the initially reported 2% of its workforce by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official company statements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The additional layoffs must be clearly separate from and in addition to the initially reported 2% workforce reduction. If no such additional layoffs are announced by the specified date, or if Spotify only provides updates or clarifications about the initially reported 2% reduction without announcing new cuts, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will there be further layoffs at Spotify beyond the previously disclosed 2% before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if Spotify makes an official declaration regarding additional layoffs exceeding the previously disclosed 2% of its staff by August 31, 2024. The confirmation must come from official company communications or reports from at least two credible news outlets (like Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The new layoffs must be distinctly separate from the initially mentioned 2% workforce reduction. If no further layoffs are announced by the given date, or if Spotify only shares updates or clarifications regarding the initially reported 2% reduction without introducing new cuts, the inquiry will be marked as negative.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (1) The Reserve Bank of India announces a reduction in its key interest rate, and (2) Spotify refrains from announcing additional layoffs beyond the initially reported 2%?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: (1) The Reserve Bank of India publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate (repo rate) and this announcement is reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be a concrete announcement, not mere speculation. (2) Spotify does not officially announce further layoffs beyond the initially reported 2% of its workforce. If no additional layoffs are announced, or if only updates or clarifications about the initially reported 2% reduction are provided without new cuts, this condition is satisfied. The announcement of additional layoffs must be confirmed through official company statements or reports from at least two reputable news sources for this condition to be unmet.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will the following two events take place: (1) The Reserve Bank of India makes a public declaration of a decrease in its main interest rate, and (2) Spotify does not disclose any further layoffs beyond the initially stated 2%?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as YES if both of the following criteria are fulfilled by August 31, 2024: (1) The Reserve Bank of India makes a public declaration regarding a decrease in its main interest rate (repo rate), and this declaration is reported by at least two credible financial news outlets such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be a definitive announcement, not just speculation. (2) Spotify does not make any official announcement of further layoffs beyond the initially reported 2% of its employees. If no other layoffs are announced, or if only updates or clarifications regarding the initially reported 2% reduction are given without new layoffs, this condition is deemed fulfilled. The announcement of additional layoffs must be verified through official company statements or reports from at least two reputable news outlets for this condition to be considered unmet.

question.title: Will either Spotify announce additional layoffs beyond 2% or the Reserve Bank of India announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs by August 31, 2024: (a) Spotify officially announces further layoffs beyond the initially reported 2% of its workforce. The announcement must be confirmed through official company statements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The additional layoffs must be clearly separate from and in addition to the initially reported 2% workforce reduction. (b) The Reserve Bank of India publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate. The announcement must be officially made by the Reserve Bank of India and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the repo rate, which is the RBI's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If neither of these events occurs by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will either Spotify reveal further workforce reductions exceeding 2% or will the Reserve Bank of India lower its main interest rate by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if at least one of the following takes place by August 31, 2024: (a) Spotify makes an official declaration of additional layoffs beyond the initially stated 2% of its employees. This announcement must be validated through official statements from the company or reported by a minimum of two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The new layoffs must be distinctly separate from and in addition to the previously reported 2% workforce decrease. (b) The Reserve Bank of India issues a public statement regarding a decrease in its main interest rate. This must be an official communication from the Reserve Bank of India and covered by at least two trustworthy financial news organizations such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must pertain to the repo rate, which is the RBI's key mechanism for economic influence. A simple suggestion or speculation about possible future cuts will not suffice; an explicit announcement of a definitive rate decrease is required. If neither of these scenarios occurs by the indicated deadline, the resolution will be negative.

question.title: Will the Italian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Italian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the Italian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Can Italy's economy steer clear of a recession before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by the end of July 2024, Italy's economy has not fallen into a recession. For the context of this inquiry, a recession is characterized by two successive quarters of declining GDP as documented by the Italian National Institute of Statistics. Conversely, the inquiry will be answered with a NO if Italy's economy undergoes two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure shows a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% and (b) The Italian economy enters a recession?
question.body: (a) This question will resolve as YES if the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure (typically the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Federal Reserve or a relevant U.S. government agency (such as the Bureau of Economic Analysis) and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC). If no such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame. (b) This question resolves as YES if the Italian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics. The question resolves as NO if, by July 31, 2024, the Italian economy does not enter a recession.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will both of the following take place: (a) The Federal Reserve's favored inflation indicator exhibits a monthly rise surpassing 0.5% and (b) The Italian economy falls into a recession?
para_P.body: (a) This inquiry will be considered YES if the Federal Reserve's favored inflation indicator (usually the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) shows a month-over-month rise greater than 0.5% in any single month from October 2023 to July 31, 2024. The rise must be officially announced by the Federal Reserve or a pertinent U.S. government agency (like the Bureau of Economic Analysis) and reported by at least two trustworthy financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC). If no such rise is reported during this timeframe, the inquiry will be deemed NO. It is important to note that this question is concerned with the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other period. (b) This inquiry will be marked YES if the Italian economy undergoes two successive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. For this inquiry, a recession is characterized as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics. The inquiry will be marked NO if, by July 31, 2024, the Italian economy does not experience a recession.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The Italian economy avoids a recession, or (b) The Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure shows a monthly increase exceeding 0.5%?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) The Italian economy does not enter a recession by July 31, 2024, which means it does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. (b) The Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure (typically the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. This increase must be officially published by the Federal Reserve or a relevant U.S. government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. If neither of these occurs, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that by July 2024, either (a) the Italian economy manages to avoid a recession, or (b) the inflation measure favored by the Federal Reserve experiences a monthly rise exceeding 0.5%?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with YES if at least one of the following happens: (a) the Italian economy does not fall into a recession by July 31, 2024, meaning it does not show two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as recorded by the Italian National Institute of Statistics between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. (b) The inflation measure preferred by the Federal Reserve (usually the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) shows a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any month from October 2023 to July 31, 2024. This increase must be officially documented by the Federal Reserve or a pertinent U.S. government agency and reported by at least two credible financial news outlets such as Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. If neither of these scenarios takes place, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will Elon Musk conduct a live interview with Sergey Brin on X by August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Elon Musk conducts a live interview with Sergey Brin on X (formerly known as Twitter) by August 31, 2024. For a positive resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The interview must be conducted live on the X platform.
2. Elon Musk must be the primary interviewer.
3. Sergey Brin must be the interviewee.
4. The event must be officially announced by X or Elon Musk prior to its occurrence.
5. The interview must be publicly accessible on the X platform.
6. At least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must report on the event either before or after it takes place.

If all these conditions are met by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If any of these conditions are not met by this date, or if the interview does not occur, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Elon Musk host a live discussion with Sergey Brin on X before the end of August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if Elon Musk hosts a live discussion with Sergey Brin on X (previously known as Twitter) by August 31, 2024. For a positive outcome, the following conditions must be satisfied:

1. The discussion must take place live on the X platform.
2. Elon Musk must serve as the main interviewer.
3. Sergey Brin must be the one being interviewed.
4. The event needs to be officially announced by X or Elon Musk prior to its occurrence.
5. The discussion must be available for public viewing on the X platform.
6. At least two prominent news organizations (like CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must cover the event either before or after it happens.

If all these criteria are fulfilled by August 31, 2024, the inquiry will be resolved as YES. If any of these criteria are not met by that date, or if the discussion does not take place, the inquiry will be resolved as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) The United States implements a significant tariff on Chinese-made electric vehicles, and (b) Elon Musk does not conduct a live interview with Sergey Brin on X?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024:

(a) The United States officially implements a tariff of 50% or higher on imports of Chinese-made electric vehicles. The implementation must be confirmed by official U.S. government announcements and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The New York Times). The tariff must be specifically targeted at electric vehicles manufactured in China and not part of a broader tariff on all Chinese goods or all vehicles.

(b) Elon Musk does not conduct a live interview with Sergey Brin on X (formerly known as Twitter). For a positive resolution of this condition, any of the following criteria must be met:
   1. The interview is not conducted live on the X platform.
   2. Elon Musk is not the primary interviewer.
   3. Sergey Brin is not the interviewee.
   4. The event is not officially announced by X or Elon Musk prior to its occurrence.
   5. The interview is not publicly accessible on the X platform.
   6. Fewer than two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) report on the event either before or after it takes place.

If both of these conditions are satisfied by the specified date, the question resolves as YES. If either condition is not satisfied, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) A significant tariff is imposed by the United States on electric vehicles produced in China, and (b) Elon Musk refrains from conducting a live interview with Sergey Brin on X?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed YES if the following two criteria are fulfilled by August 31, 2024:

(a) The United States officially enforces a tariff of 50% or greater on the importation of electric vehicles made in China. This implementation must be validated by official announcements from the U.S. government and reported by a minimum of two prominent news organizations (like Reuters, Bloomberg, or The New York Times). The tariff must specifically target electric vehicles from China and not be part of a wider tariff affecting all Chinese products or all vehicles in general.

(b) Elon Musk does not engage in a live interview with Sergey Brin on X (previously known as Twitter). For this condition to be positively resolved, at least one of the following criteria must be met:
   1. The interview is not held live on the X platform.
   2. Elon Musk is not the main interviewer.
   3. Sergey Brin is not the person being interviewed.
   4. The event is not officially announced by X or Elon Musk before it happens.
   5. The interview is not available to the public on the X platform.
   6. Fewer than two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) report on the event either prior to or after it occurs.

If both of these criteria are met by the designated date, the inquiry resolves as YES. If either criterion is not met, the inquiry resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Elon Musk conducts a live interview with Sergey Brin on X, or (b) The United States implements a significant tariff on Chinese-made electric vehicles?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if either of the following events occurs by August 31, 2024:

(a) Elon Musk conducts a live interview with Sergey Brin on X (formerly known as Twitter). For a positive resolution, the following criteria must be met:
   1. The interview must be conducted live on the X platform.
   2. Elon Musk must be the primary interviewer.
   3. Sergey Brin must be the interviewee.
   4. The event must be officially announced by X or Elon Musk prior to its occurrence.
   5. The interview must be publicly accessible on the X platform.
   6. At least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must report on the event either before or after it takes place.

(b) The United States implements a significant tariff on Chinese-made electric vehicles. For a positive resolution, the following criteria must be met:
   1. The United States officially implements a tariff of 50% or higher on imports of Chinese-made electric vehicles.
   2. The implementation must be confirmed by official U.S. government announcements.
   3. The tariff must be reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The New York Times).
   4. The tariff must be specifically targeted at electric vehicles manufactured in China and not part of a broader tariff on all Chinese goods or all vehicles.

If either (a) or (b) occurs by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If neither event occurs by this date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will one of the following take place: (a) Elon Musk holds a live interview with Sergey Brin on X, or (b) The United States enacts a substantial tariff on electric vehicles produced in China?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if one of the following scenarios happens by August 31, 2024:

(a) Elon Musk holds a live interview with Sergey Brin on X (previously known as Twitter). For a YES outcome, the following conditions must be satisfied:
   1. The interview needs to be conducted live on the X platform.
   2. Elon Musk must serve as the main interviewer.
   3. Sergey Brin must be the person being interviewed.
   4. The event should be officially announced by either X or Elon Musk before it occurs.
   5. The interview must be available for public viewing on the X platform.
   6. At least two major news organizations (like CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must cover the event either prior to or following its occurrence.

(b) The United States enacts a substantial tariff on electric vehicles manufactured in China. For a YES outcome, the following conditions must be satisfied:
   1. The United States must officially impose a tariff of 50% or more on imports of electric vehicles from China.
   2. The implementation must be verified by official announcements from the U.S. government.
   3. The tariff must be covered by at least two major news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The New York Times).
   4. The tariff must specifically apply to electric vehicles made in China and not be part of a broader tariff on all goods from China or all vehicles.

If either (a) or (b) takes place by August 31, 2024, the question will be answered with YES. If neither event occurs by that date, the question will be answered with NO.

question.title: Will the Bank of England announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of England officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of England communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for monetary policy.

para_P.title: Will the Bank of England declare a reduction in interest rates before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed as YES if the Bank of England formally declares a reduction in interest rates to take effect by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be verified through official communications from the Bank of England, such as press releases, statements from the Monetary Policy Committee, or public addresses by Bank officials. If there is no such declaration made by the resolution date, the inquiry resolves as NO. It is important to note that the actual date of the rate reduction can occur after August 31, 2024, provided that the declaration itself is made by that date. The interest rate in question pertains to the Bank Rate, which serves as the primary mechanism for the Bank of England's monetary policy.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) India eliminates export taxes on agricultural products by July 2024, and (b) the Bank of England does not announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) By July 31, 2024, the Indian government officially announces or implements a policy to completely eliminate export taxes on agricultural products, confirmed by official government communications or reported by at least two reputable international news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or Associated Press). Partial reductions or eliminations on only some products do not suffice. (2) By August 31, 2024, the Bank of England does not officially announce an interest rate cut to take effect, confirmed by official Bank of England communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If both conditions are met, the question resolves as YES. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) India will abolish export duties on agricultural goods by July 2024, and (b) the Bank of England will refrain from declaring an interest rate reduction by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if both of the subsequent criteria are satisfied: (1) By July 31, 2024, the Indian government formally announces or carries out a policy to entirely abolish export duties on agricultural goods, verified by official government communications or reported by a minimum of two credible international news agencies (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or Associated Press). Partial cuts or abolitions affecting only certain products are insufficient. (2) By August 31, 2024, the Bank of England does not officially declare an interest rate reduction to take effect, confirmed by official communications from the Bank of England, such as press releases, statements from the Monetary Policy Committee, or public addresses by Bank officials. If both criteria are fulfilled, the inquiry resolves as YES. If either criterion is unmet, the inquiry resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either the Bank of England announce an interest rate cut by August 2024, or India eliminate export taxes on agricultural products by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) The Bank of England officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of England communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for monetary policy. (b) The Indian government officially announces or implements a policy to completely eliminate export taxes on agricultural products by July 31, 2024. The policy must be confirmed by official government communications or reported by at least two reputable international news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or Associated Press). Partial reductions in export taxes or the elimination of taxes on only some agricultural products will not be sufficient for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that the Bank of England will declare a reduction in interest rates by August 2024, or that India will abolish export duties on agricultural goods by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as YES if one of the following takes place: (a) The Bank of England publicly declares a reduction in interest rates to take effect by August 31, 2024. This declaration must be verified through official communications from the Bank of England, such as press releases, statements from the Monetary Policy Committee, or public addresses by Bank officials. It is important to note that the actual date for the rate reduction can occur after August 31, 2024, provided that the announcement is made by that date. The interest rate in question pertains to the Bank Rate, which serves as the Bank of England's main instrument for monetary policy. (b) The Indian government makes an official announcement or enacts a policy to entirely eliminate export duties on agricultural goods by July 31, 2024. This policy must be validated by official government communications or reported by at least two credible international news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or Associated Press). A partial reduction in export duties or the removal of duties on only certain agricultural products will not suffice for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will France appoint a new President by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a new President is officially appointed in France. The appointment must be confirmed by official government announcements or reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). For the purpose of this question, a 'new' President refers to an individual who is not currently serving in this role as of October 1, 2023. If no new President is appointed by the resolution date, or if the current President as of October 1, 2023, remains in office, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will a new President be named in France before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered TRUE if, by August 31, 2024, a new President is officially designated in France. The designation must be validated by official government announcements or reported by at least two credible international news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). For the purposes of this inquiry, a 'new' President is defined as an individual who is not currently holding this position as of October 1, 2023. If no new President is named by the resolution date, or if the current President as of October 1, 2023, continues in office, the inquiry resolves as FALSE.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) The Bank of England's base rate remains at or above 5.00% in August 2024, and (b) France does not appoint a new President by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) The Bank of England's base rate is reported to be at or above 5.00% at any point during August 2024, confirmed by official Bank of England announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Guardian). If the rate is reported to have decreased below 5.00% and remains below this level throughout August 2024, this condition resolves as NO. (2) No new President is officially appointed in France by August 31, 2024, including scenarios where the current President as of October 1, 2023, remains in office. This must be confirmed by official government announcements or reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). If a new President is appointed by the resolution date, this condition resolves as NO. A 'new' President refers to an individual who is not currently serving in this role as of October 1, 2023. The question resolves as NO if either of these conditions is not met.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) The Bank of England's base rate stays at or above 5.00%, and (b) France does not have a new President appointed?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if both of the subsequent criteria are fulfilled: (1) The Bank of England's base rate is documented to be at or above 5.00% at any time during August 2024, as confirmed by official announcements from the Bank of England or at least two credible financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Guardian). If the rate is reported to have fallen below 5.00% and stays under this threshold throughout August 2024, this criterion will be answered with NO. (2) No new President is officially designated in France by August 31, 2024, which includes situations where the current President as of October 1, 2023, continues in their role. This must be validated by official government communications or reported by at least two trustworthy international news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). If a new President is appointed by the resolution date, this condition will be answered with NO. A 'new' President refers to someone who is not currently in this position as of October 1, 2023. The question will be answered with NO if either of these criteria is not satisfied.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by August 2024: (a) France appoints a new President, or (b) the Bank of England's base rate remains at or above 5.00% in August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if at least one of the following occurs: (a) By August 31, 2024, a new President is officially appointed in France. The appointment must be confirmed by official government announcements or reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). A 'new' President refers to an individual who is not currently serving in this role as of October 1, 2023. (b) The Bank of England's base rate is reported to be at or above 5.00% at any point during August 2024. Confirmation must come from official Bank of England announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Guardian). If neither event occurs, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that by August 2024, either (a) a new President is named in France, or (b) the Bank of England's base interest rate stays at or above 5.00% during that month?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if at least one of the following takes place: (a) A new President is officially designated in France by August 31, 2024. This appointment must be validated by official government communications or reported by a minimum of two credible international news organizations (like Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). A 'new' President refers to someone who is not currently in this position as of October 1, 2023. (b) The Bank of England's base interest rate is documented to be at or above 5.00% at any time throughout August 2024. Verification must come from official announcements by the Bank of England or at least two reliable financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Guardian). If neither scenario occurs, the question will be answered with a NO.

question.title: Will Elon Musk conduct a live interview with Satya Nadella on X by August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Elon Musk conducts a live interview with Satya Nadella on X (formerly known as Twitter) by August 31, 2024. For a positive resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The interview must be conducted live on the X platform.
2. Elon Musk must be the primary interviewer.
3. Satya Nadella must be the interviewee.
4. The event must be officially announced by X or Elon Musk prior to its occurrence.
5. The interview must be publicly accessible on the X platform.
6. At least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must report on the event either before or after it takes place.

If all these conditions are met by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If any of these conditions are not met by this date, or if the interview does not occur, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Elon Musk will host a live discussion with Satya Nadella on X before the end of August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if Elon Musk hosts a live discussion with Satya Nadella on X (previously referred to as Twitter) by August 31, 2024. For an affirmative outcome, the following stipulations need to be satisfied:

1. The discussion must take place live on the X platform.
2. Elon Musk must serve as the main host.
3. Satya Nadella must be the one interviewed.
4. The event should be officially announced by X or Elon Musk ahead of time.
5. The discussion must be accessible to the public on the X platform.
6. At least two prominent news organizations (like CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) should cover the event either prior to or following its occurrence.

If all these criteria are fulfilled by August 31, 2024, the question will be answered affirmatively. If any of these criteria are unmet by this date, or if the discussion does not take place, the question will be answered negatively.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Nvidia announce measures to reduce AI-related electricity consumption by July 2024 and (2) Elon Musk not conduct a live interview with Satya Nadella on X by August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Nvidia officially announces specific measures aimed at reducing electricity consumption attributed to its AI operations by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be made through official company channels (such as press releases, blog posts, or annual reports) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The measures announced should be concrete steps or initiatives designed to decrease the energy usage of Nvidia's AI systems.

2. Elon Musk does not conduct a live interview with Satya Nadella on X (formerly known as Twitter) by August 31, 2024. For a positive resolution, any of the following criteria must be met:
   - The interview is not conducted live on the X platform.
   - Elon Musk is not the primary interviewer.
   - Satya Nadella is not the interviewee.
   - The event is not officially announced by X or Elon Musk prior to its occurrence.
   - The interview is not publicly accessible on the X platform.
   - Fewer than two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) report on the event either before or after it takes place.

If both conditions are satisfied, the question resolves as YES. If either condition is not satisfied, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (1) Nvidia will reveal strategies to lower electricity use related to AI by July 2024 and (2) Elon Musk will refrain from holding a live discussion with Satya Nadella on X before August 2024?

This question will be considered YES if both of these conditions are fulfilled:

1. Nvidia makes a formal announcement detailing specific strategies aimed at decreasing electricity consumption linked to its AI activities by July 31, 2024. This announcement must be communicated through official company channels (like press releases, blog entries, or annual reports) or covered by at least two prominent news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The strategies disclosed should be tangible actions or initiatives intended to lower the energy consumption of Nvidia's AI systems.

2. Elon Musk does not engage in a live discussion with Satya Nadella on X (previously known as Twitter) by August 31, 2024. For a positive outcome, any of the following conditions must be met:
   - The discussion is not conducted live on the X platform.
   - Elon Musk is not the main interviewer.
   - Satya Nadella is not the one being interviewed.
   - The event is not officially publicized by X or Elon Musk prior to it taking place.
   - The discussion is not available to the public on the X platform.
   - Fewer than two major news organizations (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) report on the event either before or after it occurs.

If both conditions are met, the question will resolve as YES. If either condition is not met, the question will resolve as NO.

question.body:
This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs:

   - Satya Nadella must be the interviewee.
   - The event must be officially announced by X or Elon Musk prior to its occurrence.
   - The interview must be publicly accessible on the X platform.
   - At least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must report on the event either before or after it takes place.

2. Nvidia officially announces specific measures aimed at reducing electricity consumption attributed to its AI operations by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be made through official company channels (such as press releases, blog posts, or annual reports) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The measures announced should be concrete steps or initiatives designed to decrease the energy usage of Nvidia's AI systems.

If either of these conditions is satisfied by their respective dates, the question resolves as YES. If neither condition is met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Elon Musk will hold a live interview with Satya Nadella on X before August 2024, or that Nvidia will reveal steps to lower AI-related energy consumption by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered YES if at least one of the following takes place:

1. A live interview featuring Elon Musk as the main interviewer and Satya Nadella as the interviewee occurs on the X platform (previously known as Twitter) by August 31, 2024, fulfilling all outlined conditions:
   - The interview must be broadcast live on the X platform.

   - At least two prominent news organizations (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must cover the event either prior to or following its occurrence.

2. Nvidia makes a formal announcement regarding specific actions to cut down on electricity usage associated with its AI functions by July 31, 2024. This announcement should come through official company communication channels (like press releases, blog entries, or annual reports) or be reported by at least two major news organizations (for instance, Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The announced actions should consist of tangible measures or initiatives aimed at reducing the energy consumption of Nvidia's AI systems.

If either of these conditions is fulfilled by their respective deadlines, the question will be answered with YES. If neither condition occurs, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will India's central bank's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if India's central bank's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Reserve Bank of India or a relevant Indian government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Economic Times). If no such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will the inflation metric favored by India's central bank register a monthly rise surpassing 0.5%?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if the inflation metric favored by India's central bank indicates a month-over-month rise exceeding 0.5% in any month from October 2023 to July 31, 2024. The rise must be officially reported by the Reserve Bank of India or an appropriate Indian governmental body and covered by at least two credible financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Economic Times). If there is no such rise reported within this timeframe, the inquiry will conclude with a NO. It is important to note that this question pertains to the month-over-month variation, rather than year-over-year or any alternative timeframe.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Uber lays off at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan, and (b) India's central bank's preferred inflation measure never shows a monthly increase exceeding 0.5%?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: 

(a) Uber confirms the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Uber confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution.

(b) India's central bank's preferred inflation measure does not report a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The absence of such an increase must be confirmed by the lack of official publications by the Reserve Bank of India or any relevant Indian government agency and not reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Economic Times). If any such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

Both conditions must be satisfied for this question to resolve as YES; otherwise, it will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) Uber will announce layoffs of at least 1,800 employees due to its AI-driven restructuring efforts, and (b) the preferred inflation gauge of India's central bank will not report a monthly increase higher than 0.5%?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as YES if both of the subsequent conditions are fulfilled by July 31, 2024: 

(a) Uber officially announces the termination of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-driven restructuring efforts. This confirmation must originate from official company statements, regulatory documents, or reports from at least two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be directly associated with the AI-driven restructuring plan that was revealed in 2023. If Uber announces a smaller number of layoffs, or if no confirmation meeting these standards is made by the resolution date, the inquiry will conclude as NO. Any partial layoffs or gradual implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee mark by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution.

(b) The preferred inflation gauge of India's central bank does not indicate a month-over-month increase exceeding 0.5% in any month from October 2023 to July 31, 2024. The absence of such an increase must be verified by the lack of official announcements from the Reserve Bank of India or any pertinent Indian governmental body, and it must not be reported by at least two reputable financial news organizations (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Economic Times). If any such increase is recorded during this time frame, the inquiry will conclude as NO. It is important to note that this question is concerned with month-over-month changes, not year-over-year or any other period.

Both conditions must be met for this inquiry to conclude as YES; otherwise, it will conclude as NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by July 2024: (a) India's central bank's preferred inflation measure shows a monthly increase exceeding 0.5%, or (b) Uber lays off at least 1,800 employees?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs by July 31, 2024: (a) India's central bank's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Reserve Bank of India or a relevant Indian government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Economic Times). (b) Uber confirms the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If neither of these events occurs by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that by July 2024, one of the following happens: (a) India's central bank's key inflation metric experiences a monthly rise surpassing 0.5%, or (b) Uber terminates a minimum of 1,800 jobs?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if at least one of the following takes place by July 31, 2024: (a) India's central bank's key inflation metric indicates a month-over-month increase exceeding 0.5% in any month from October 2023 to July 31, 2024. The rise must be officially reported by the Reserve Bank of India or a relevant Indian governmental body and covered by no fewer than two trusted financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Economic Times). (b) Uber officially declares the termination of at least 1,800 positions as part of its restructuring plan focused on AI. This confirmation must come from official company statements, regulatory documents, or reports from at least two credible news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be directly associated with the AI-centric restructuring plan revealed in 2023. If neither event occurs by the resolution date, the outcome will be NO.

question.title: Will Astellas allow generic production of its prostate cancer drug by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Astellas officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its prostate cancer drug, effectively not enforcing its patent. This could be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If no such announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, or if Astellas continues to enforce its patent rights, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Astellas permit the creation of generic versions of its prostate cancer medication by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, Astellas publicly declares or verifies that it will permit the creation of generic versions of its prostate cancer medication, effectively choosing not to uphold its patent. This could occur through a formal retraction of the patent, a voluntary licensing agreement, or any other means that facilitates unrestricted generic production. Verification must come from official announcements by the company, statements from pertinent regulatory authorities, or reports from at least two credible international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If no such declaration or verification is made by the given date, or if Astellas continues to enforce its patent rights, the inquiry will conclude with a NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) AstraZeneca allows generic production of its cancer treatment drug, and (b) Astellas prevents generic production of its prostate cancer drug?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) AstraZeneca officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its cancer treatment drug, effectively not enforcing its patent. This could be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). (b) Astellas does not officially announce or confirm that it will allow generic production of its prostate cancer drug, effectively continuing to enforce its patent. This could be by not withdrawing its patent, not entering into a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that restricts generic production. Confirmation of continued enforcement must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If both conditions are not met by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will both of these events take place: (a) AstraZeneca permits the generic manufacturing of its cancer drug, and (b) Astellas halts the generic production of its prostate cancer medication?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if both of the following criteria are satisfied by July 31, 2024: (a) AstraZeneca makes an official announcement or confirmation regarding the allowance of generic manufacturing of its cancer treatment drug, thereby not enforcing its patent. This could occur through a formal withdrawal of the patent, a voluntary licensing agreement, or any other means that facilitate unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must be sourced from official company announcements, statements from pertinent regulatory authorities, or reports from at least two credible international news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). (b) Astellas does not make any official announcement or confirmation permitting generic production of its prostate cancer drug, thereby continuing to enforce its patent. This could involve not withdrawing its patent, not engaging in a voluntary licensing agreement, or any other means that limit generic production. Confirmation of ongoing enforcement must be derived from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory authorities, or reports from at least two credible international news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If both of these criteria are not fulfilled by the designated date, the question will resolve as negative.

question.title: Will either Astellas or AstraZeneca allow generic production of their cancer drugs by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, either Astellas or AstraZeneca officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its respective cancer drug, effectively not enforcing its patent. For Astellas, this applies to its prostate cancer drug, and for AstraZeneca, this applies to its cancer treatment drug. This could be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If neither company makes such an announcement or confirmation by the specified date, or if both continue to enforce their patent rights, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Astellas or AstraZeneca permit the production of generic versions of their cancer medications by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if, by July 31, 2024, either Astellas or AstraZeneca makes an official announcement or confirmation that it will permit the production of generic versions of its respective cancer medication, thereby not enforcing its patent rights. For Astellas, this pertains to its prostate cancer medication, and for AstraZeneca, it pertains to its cancer treatment medication. This could occur through a formal withdrawal of the patent, a voluntary licensing agreement, or any other means that facilitate unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must be derived from official announcements by the companies, statements from relevant regulatory agencies, or reports from at least two credible international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If neither company issues such an announcement or confirmation by the designated date, or if both maintain their patent enforcement, the outcome will be NO.

question.title: Will the Mexican economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Mexican economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Geography of Mexico. The question resolves as NO if the Mexican economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Can the Mexican economy steer clear of a recession by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by the end of July 2024, the Mexican economy has not entered a recession. For the purposes of this inquiry, a recession is characterized by two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Geography of Mexico. The answer will be NO if the Mexican economy faces two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Sony Corporation resolves a major workers' strike and (b) the Mexican economy enters a recession?
question.body:
(a) Sony Corporation resolves a major workers' strike: This occurs if Sony Corporation reaches an agreement with unionized workers, ending a significant strike by July 31, 2024. The strike must involve at least 1,000 workers, last at least one week, and the resolution must be confirmed by official statements from Sony Corporation and the union, and reported by at least two reputable international news sources.

(b) The Mexican economy enters a recession: This occurs if the Mexican economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024, as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Geography of Mexico.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will both of the following take place: (a) a significant workers' strike at Sony Corporation is resolved and (b) the economy of Mexico falls into a recession?
para_P.body:
(a) A significant workers' strike at Sony Corporation is resolved: This happens if Sony Corporation comes to an agreement with its unionized workforce, bringing an end to a major strike by July 31, 2024. The strike must involve a minimum of 1,000 workers, last for at least one week, and the resolution must be validated by official announcements from both Sony Corporation and the union, as well as covered by at least two credible international news outlets.

(b) The economy of Mexico falls into a recession: This occurs if the Mexican economy undergoes two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024, as documented by the National Institute of Statistics and Geography of Mexico.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The Mexican economy avoids a recession or (b) Sony Corporation resolves a major workers' strike?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs by July 31, 2024:

(a) The Mexican economy does not enter a recession. This means there are no two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Geography of Mexico between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

(b) Sony Corporation reaches an agreement with unionized workers, ending a significant strike by July 31, 2024. The strike must involve at least 1,000 Sony Corporation workers, last for at least one week, and the resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Sony Corporation and the involved union, and reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If either condition (a) or (b) is met, the question resolves as YES. If neither condition is met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will one of the following happen: (a) The Mexican economy successfully avoids a recession or (b) Sony Corporation comes to a resolution regarding a significant workers' strike?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with YES if at least one of the following takes place by July 31, 2024:

(a) The Mexican economy remains out of recession, meaning there are no two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as documented by the National Institute of Statistics and Geography of Mexico from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

(b) Sony Corporation successfully negotiates an agreement with its unionized workforce, bringing an end to a major strike by July 31, 2024. The strike must involve no fewer than 1,000 Sony Corporation employees, persist for a minimum of one week, and the resolution must be validated by official announcements from both Sony Corporation and the relevant union, as well as reported by at least two credible international news outlets (such as Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If either condition (a) or (b) is satisfied, the answer will be YES. If neither condition is satisfied, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will the European Central Bank announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the European Central Bank officially announces a decrease in its main refinancing operations rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the ECB or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Governing Council of the ECB and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual ECB members will not count for resolution.
