question.title: Will the French economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the French economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies of France. The question resolves as NO if the French economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Can the French economy steer clear of a recession before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, the French economy has not slipped into a recession. For the context of this inquiry, a recession is characterized as two successive quarters of declining GDP growth as documented by the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies of France. The inquiry will be considered negative if the French economy undergoes two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The Central Bank of Mexico's preferred inflation measure shows a monthly increase exceeding 0.5%, and (b) The French economy enters a recession?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) The Central Bank of Mexico's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. This increase must be officially published by the Central Bank of Mexico or a relevant Mexican government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, El Financiero). (b) The French economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024, as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies of France. If both conditions are met, the question resolves as YES. If one or both conditions are not met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will both of the following take place: (a) The inflation metric preferred by the Central Bank of Mexico indicates a monthly rise surpassing 0.5%, and (b) The economy of France falls into a recession?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if the following two criteria are satisfied by July 31, 2024: (a) The inflation metric favored by the Central Bank of Mexico shows a month-over-month increase exceeding 0.5% in any individual month from October 2023 to July 31, 2024. This increase must be officially documented by the Central Bank of Mexico or a pertinent Mexican governmental body and must be reported by at least two credible financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or El Financiero). (b) The French economy records two successive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024, as indicated by the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies of France. If both criteria are fulfilled, the inquiry resolves as YES. If either or both criteria are not fulfilled, the inquiry resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The French economy avoids a recession or (b) The Central Bank of Mexico's preferred inflation measure shows a monthly increase exceeding 0.5%?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following conditions is met by July 31, 2024: (a) The French economy does not enter a recession, defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies of France, at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. (b) The Central Bank of Mexico's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024, with the increase being officially published by the Central Bank of Mexico or a relevant Mexican government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or El Financiero. If neither condition is met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that by July 2024, one of the following happens: (a) The French economy remains free from recession or (b) The preferred inflation metric of the Central Bank of Mexico records a monthly rise surpassing 0.5%?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if by July 31, 2024, at least one of the following scenarios occurs: (a) The French economy does not experience a recession, which is characterized by two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies of France, at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024. (b) The preferred inflation measure of the Central Bank of Mexico indicates a month-over-month increase exceeding 0.5% in any month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024, with the increase being officially published by the Central Bank of Mexico or a pertinent Mexican government agency and covered by at least two credible financial news outlets like Bloomberg, Reuters, or El Financiero. If neither of these conditions is satisfied, the outcome will be NO.

question.title: Will BNSF Railway reach a new agreement with the conductors' union addressing work schedule predictability by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, BNSF Railway and the union representing train conductors publicly announce a new agreement that specifically addresses work schedule predictability for conductors. The agreement must be officially confirmed by both BNSF Railway and the union, and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The agreement should directly address the issue of making schedules more predictable for train conductors, as mentioned in the ongoing dispute. If no such agreement is reached, announced, and reported by the resolution date, or if an announced agreement does not specifically address work schedule predictability, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will BNSF Railway finalize a new contract with the conductors' union concerning work schedule predictability by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, BNSF Railway and the union representing train conductors publicly declare a new contract that explicitly tackles work schedule predictability for conductors. The contract must be officially validated by both BNSF Railway and the union, and reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, or prominent national newspapers). The contract should specifically address the concern of enhancing schedule predictability for train conductors, as highlighted in the ongoing conflict. If no such contract is established, announced, and reported by the resolution date, or if an announced contract does not specifically deal with work schedule predictability, the inquiry will conclude with a NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Colorado implements a free community college plan by July 2024, and (b) BNSF Railway fails to reach a new agreement with the conductors' union addressing work schedule predictability by August 2024?
question.body:
(a) Colorado implements a free community college plan by July 2024: This will be true if, by July 31, 2024, Colorado has officially implemented a free community college plan. Implementation is confirmed if students are able to enroll in community colleges without tuition fees, as reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as local Colorado newspapers, national news outlets, or official state government announcements). The plan must be part of a state-wide initiative, not limited to specific institutions or pilot programs. If no such implementation occurs by the resolution date, or if the implementation is only partial or limited, this part resolves as NO.

(b) BNSF Railway fails to reach a new agreement with the conductors' union addressing work schedule predictability by August 2024: This will be true if, by August 31, 2024, no new agreement specifically addressing work schedule predictability for conductors is publicly announced by both BNSF Railway and the union representing train conductors, or if such an agreement is not reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). Additionally, if an announced agreement does not specifically address the issue of making schedules more predictable for train conductors, this part will resolve as YES. If a qualifying agreement is reached, announced, and reported by the resolution date, this part resolves as NO.

para_P.body:

The program must be part of a state-wide initiative, not restricted to particular institutions or pilot projects. If no such establishment occurs by the resolution date, or if the establishment is only partial or limited, this part will resolve as NO.

(b) BNSF Railway will not finalize a new contract with the conductors' union regarding work schedule predictability by August 2024: This will be confirmed if, by August 31, 2024, no new contract specifically addressing work schedule predictability for conductors is publicly announced by both BNSF Railway and the union representing train conductors, or if such a contract is not reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, or prominent national newspapers). Furthermore, if an announced contract does not specifically tackle the issue of making schedules more predictable for train conductors, this part will resolve as YES. If a qualifying contract is reached, announced, and reported by the resolution date, this part resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Minnesota hold a referendum on housing affordability by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of Minnesota officially conducts a referendum regarding housing affordability. The referendum must be a formal, state-wide vote on a proposed constitutional amendment or legislative measure specifically addressing housing affordability. The occurrence of the referendum must be verifiable through official state government announcements or reports from at least three major, reputable news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). If no such referendum is held by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only concerns the occurrence of the referendum itself, not its outcome.

para_P.title: Will there be a statewide vote in Minnesota regarding housing affordability before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, Minnesota officially organizes a statewide vote focused on housing affordability. The vote must be a legitimate, state-wide referendum on a proposed constitutional amendment or legislative action that directly pertains to housing affordability. Verification of the vote must be possible through official announcements from the state government or reports from at least three major, credible news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). If such a vote does not take place by the given date, or if a scheduled vote is canceled or postponed past July 31, 2024, the inquiry will be considered negative. It is important to note that this question pertains solely to the occurrence of the vote, not the result.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Tim Scott publicly retracts his statement about Biden's stance on criminal justice reform by August 31, 2024, and (b) Minnesota does not hold a referendum on housing affordability by July 31, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) By August 31, 2024, Tim Scott publicly retracts or significantly alters his statement regarding Joe Biden's position on criminal justice reform. The retraction or alteration must be reported by at least two major news outlets such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, The New York Times, or The Washington Post. A significant alteration involves a substantial change to the core message of his original statement, not just a minor clarification or rewording. 'Publicly' means through official statements, interviews, social media posts from verified accounts, or during public appearances. (b) By July 31, 2024, the state of Minnesota does not officially conduct a referendum regarding housing affordability. This includes if no formal, state-wide vote on a proposed constitutional amendment or legislative measure specifically addressing housing affordability is held, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024. The non-occurrence of the referendum must be verifiable through the absence of official state government announcements or lack of reports from at least three major, reputable news organizations such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN. If both conditions are met, the question resolves as YES; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Are the following two events going to take place: (a) Tim Scott will take back his remarks about Biden's views on criminal justice reform before August 31, 2024, and (b) Minnesota will not organize a referendum on housing affordability by July 31, 2024?

A significant modification entails a considerable change to the fundamental message of his initial statement, rather than a trivial clarification or rephrasing. 'Officially' indicates communication through formal statements, interviews, verified social media posts, or during public appearances. (b) By July 31, 2024, the state of Minnesota does not carry out an official referendum concerning housing affordability. This includes scenarios where no formal, statewide vote on a proposed constitutional amendment or legislative proposal specifically focused on housing affordability occurs, or if a scheduled referendum is cancelled or delayed past July 31, 2024. The absence of the referendum must be confirmed through the lack of official announcements from the state government or absence of reports from at least three major, reputable news outlets such as the Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN. question.title: Will the first phase of a major Native American drone delivery project in Texas be completed by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the first phase of a large-scale drone delivery project planned by a Native American tribe in Texas is completed. The tribe in question is the Kickapoo Traditional Tribe of Texas. Completion of the first phase must be confirmed through official announcements by the tribe or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). Completion implies that the drone delivery infrastructure is established and ready for operation, even if full service has not yet begun. If the first phase of the project is not completed by July 31, 2024, or if there is insufficient evidence of its completion, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is the initial stage of a significant drone delivery initiative led by a Native American tribe in Texas expected to be finalized by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, the initial stage of a substantial drone delivery initiative organized by the Kickapoo Traditional Tribe of Texas is finished. Confirmation of the completion of this phase must come from official announcements made by the tribe or coverage by at least two credible news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The term 'completion' indicates that the drone delivery system is set up and operationally ready, even if full service has not commenced. Conversely, if the first phase of this initiative is not completed by July 31, 2024, or if there is inadequate evidence to support its completion, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (1) The Food and Agriculture Organization announces new funding commitments totaling over $400 million, and (2) The first phase of a major Native American drone delivery project in Texas is not completed?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (1) The Food and Agriculture Organization officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official FAO channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. (2) The first phase of a large-scale drone delivery project planned by the Kickapoo Traditional Tribe of Texas is not completed. This condition is met if there is no official announcement by the tribe or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers) confirming its completion. Completion implies that the drone delivery infrastructure is established and ready for operation, even if full service has not yet begun. If both conditions are not met by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris announce her running mate at a rally in Los Angeles by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris publicly announces her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in Los Angeles, California. The announcement must be made by Harris herself during the rally and must clearly identify the individual chosen as her running mate. The event and announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally. If Harris does not make such an announcement at a Los Angeles rally by the end of August 2024, or if the announcement is made through other means or at a different location, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will Vice President Kamala Harris reveal her choice for running mate during a rally in Los Angeles before the end of August 2024?

The event and the announcement need to be validated by at least two trustworthy national news outlets (like Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours following the rally. If Harris fails to make such a declaration at a Los Angeles rally by the end of August 2024, or if the announcement occurs through different means or at another location, the inquiry will be deemed NO.

question.title: Will Nicholas Collon be recognized as the youngest music director of a major orchestra by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Nicholas Collon is officially recognized and announced by at least two reputable music industry publications or organizations as the youngest music director of a major orchestra. The recognition must be based on his age at the time of his appointment to a major orchestra, such as the London Philharmonic. A 'major orchestra' is defined as a professional symphony orchestra with international recognition and a regular concert season. The recognition must explicitly state that he is the youngest person to hold such a position. If no such recognition occurs by the specified date, or if another conductor is recognized as younger in such a role, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the World Health Organization declare the current Zika virus outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing Zika virus outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted heightened public health responses globally. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will the World Health Organization announce the conclusion of the current Zika virus outbreak by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially states that the ongoing Zika virus outbreak has ended by August 31, 2024. The conclusion must be validated through official announcements or reports from at least three credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak in question is the one that led to increased global public health responses. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO prolongs the emergency status past August 31, 2024, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Global Fund announces new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024 (b) The World Health Organization does not declare the current Zika virus outbreak over by August 2024?

The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. (b) The World Health Organization (WHO) does not officially declare the ongoing Zika virus outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The lack of a declaration must be confirmed through the absence of official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to is the one that prompted heightened public health responses globally. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Netflix announce a new major sports media partnership by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Netflix publicly announces a new partnership related to major sports media rights or broadcasting. The partnership must be with a major sports league, organization, or event (such as NFL, MLB, NBA, FIFA World Cup, Olympics, etc.). The announcement must be confirmed through official company statements or reported by at least two reputable news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Bloomberg, CNBC). Minor partnerships or those not primarily focused on sports media rights or broadcasting will not qualify. If no such announcement meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Netflix disclose a significant new collaboration in sports media before July 2024?

This collaboration must involve a prominent sports league, organization, or event (such as the NFL, MLB, NBA, FIFA World Cup, Olympics, etc.). The announcement should be validated through official statements from the company or reported by a minimum of two credible news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Bloomberg, CNBC). Partnerships of lesser significance or those not primarily centered on sports media rights or broadcasting will not be considered. If no announcement that meets these standards occurs by the resolution date, the inquiry will resolve as FALSE.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (1) the NFL settles the 'Sunday Ticket' antitrust case for less than $4.7 billion, and (2) Netflix does not announce a new major sports media partnership?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (1) The NFL reaches a settlement in the 'Sunday Ticket' antitrust case for an amount less than $4,707,259,944. The settlement must be officially confirmed through court documents or public announcements by involved parties. If no such settlement is reached by the resolution date, or if the settlement amount is equal to or more than $4.7 billion, this condition is not met. (2) Netflix does not publicly announce a new partnership related to major sports media rights or broadcasting. The partnership must be with a major sports league, organization, or event (such as NFL, MLB, NBA, FIFA World Cup, Olympics, etc.). The announcement must be confirmed through official company statements or reported by at least two reputable news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Bloomberg, CNBC). Minor partnerships or those not primarily focused on sports media rights or broadcasting will not qualify. If no such announcement meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, this condition is met. If both conditions are met, the question resolves as YES; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Spain's IBEX 35 index reaches or exceeds 10,000 points by August 2024, and (b) the World Bank does not announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: 

(a) At any point between October 1, 2023, and August 31, 2024, Spain's IBEX 35 index reaches or exceeds 10,000 points. The index level will be verified based on official reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Bolsa de Madrid. Intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 10,000 points.

(b) By July 31, 2024, the World Bank does not officially announce any new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. Verification will be based on announcements made through official World Bank channels and reported by at least two reputable news sources. The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs. If no such announcement is made, or if the total does not exceed $400 million, this condition is satisfied.

The question resolves as NO if either condition is not met.

The question will be answered in the negative if either criterion is not met.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by August 2024: (a) The World Bank announces new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024 (b) Spain's IBEX 35 index reaches or exceeds 10,000 points?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) By July 31, 2024, the World Bank officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official World Bank channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments does not exceed $400 million, this part resolves as NO. (b) At any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, Spain's IBEX 35 index reaches or exceeds 10,000 points. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Bolsa de Madrid. If the index does not reach 10,000 points during this period, this part resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 10,000 points.

para_P.title: Is it possible that by August 2024, one of the following happens: (a) The World Bank declares new funding commitments amounting to over $400 million by July 2024 (b) The IBEX 35 index of Spain hits or surpasses 10,000 points?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be marked as YES if at least one of the following takes place: (a) By July 31, 2024, the World Bank officially reveals one or more new funding commitments that together exceed $400 million. The announcement(s) must come through official channels of the World Bank (like their website or press releases) and be covered by a minimum of two credible news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments should be new projects or substantial expansions of current programs, not mere continuations of previously declared commitments. If no such declaration is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments does not go beyond $400 million, this segment will resolve as NO. (b) At any time from October 1, 2023 to August 31, 2024, Spain's IBEX 35 index attains or exceeds 10,000 points. Confirmation will rely on official index reports from trustworthy financial market data sources like Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Bolsa de Madrid. If the index fails to reach 10,000 points during this timeframe, this segment will resolve as NO. It is important to note that intraday highs are considered for resolution; the index is not required to close at or above 10,000 points.

question.title: Will the African Union declare the current mpox outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the African Union officially declares the ongoing mpox outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official African Union announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted the African Union to issue public health warnings. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the African Union extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will the African Union announce the conclusion of the current mpox epidemic by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered as YES if the African Union formally announces that the ongoing mpox epidemic has concluded by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be validated through official statements from the African Union or reports from at least three credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The epidemic mentioned in this inquiry is the one that led the African Union to issue public health alerts. If no declaration ending the epidemic is made by the resolution date, or if the African Union prolongs the emergency status past August 31, 2024, the inquiry will be deemed as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (1) The Central Bank of South Korea's base rate remains at or above 3.50%, and (2) The African Union does not declare the current mpox outbreak over?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) The Central Bank of South Korea's base rate is reported to be at or above 3.50% at any point during August 2024. Confirmation must come from official Central Bank of South Korea announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Korea Herald). If the rate is reported to have decreased below 3.50% and remains below this level throughout August 2024, this condition is not met. (2) The African Union does not officially declare the ongoing mpox outbreak over by August 31, 2024. This includes situations where no declaration is made, or if the African Union extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024. If the African Union officially declares the outbreak over by the resolution date, confirmed through official announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC), this condition is not met. The question resolves as NO if either or both of these conditions are not met.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will the following two events happen: (1) The Central Bank of South Korea's base interest rate stays at or above 3.50%, and (2) The African Union does not announce the end of the current mpox outbreak?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) At any time during August 2024, the Central Bank of South Korea's base interest rate is reported to be at or above 3.50%. This must be verified by official announcements from the Central Bank of South Korea or by at least two reliable financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or Korea Herald). If the rate is reported to drop below 3.50% and remains under this level for the entirety of August 2024, this criterion is not satisfied. (2) The African Union does not officially declare the ongoing mpox outbreak to be over by August 31, 2024. This includes scenarios where no announcement is made, or if the African Union prolongs the emergency status past August 31, 2024. If the African Union officially states that the outbreak is over by the resolution date, confirmed through official statements or reports from at least three credible news sources (like Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC), this criterion is not satisfied. The question will be answered as NO if either or both of these criteria are not fulfilled.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by August 2024: (a) The African Union declares the current mpox outbreak over, or (b) The Central Bank of South Korea's base rate remains at or above 3.50%?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) The African Union officially declares the ongoing mpox outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official African Union announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted the African Union to issue public health warnings. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the African Union extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, this part resolves as NO. (b) The Central Bank of South Korea's base rate is reported to be at or above 3.50% at any point during August 2024. Confirmation must come from official Central Bank of South Korea announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Korea Herald). If the rate is reported to have decreased below 3.50% and remains below this level throughout August 2024, this part resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will one of the following take place: (a) The African Union announces the conclusion of the current mpox outbreak, or (b) The base rate of the Central Bank of South Korea stays at 3.50% or higher?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if at least one of the following happens: (a) The African Union formally announces that the current mpox outbreak is over by August 31, 2024. This declaration must be validated through official communications from the African Union or reports from a minimum of three credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak in question is the one that led the African Union to issue public health alerts. If there is no declaration ending the outbreak by the resolution date, or if the African Union prolongs the emergency status past August 31, 2024, this part will be considered NO. (b) The base rate of the Central Bank of South Korea is reported to be at least 3.50% at any time during August 2024. Confirmation must be sourced from official announcements by the Central Bank of South Korea or at least two reliable financial news organizations (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Korea Herald). If the rate is recorded as falling below 3.50% and remains below this threshold throughout August 2024, this part will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Illinois maintain its current legal stance on abortion access by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Illinois Supreme Court has not reversed or significantly altered its 2023 decision that struck down state laws regulating abortion providers more strictly than other health care providers and banned a common second-trimester procedure. The question will resolve as NO if, by July 31, 2024, the Illinois Supreme Court has reversed this decision, reinstated stricter regulations on abortion providers, or reinstated the ban on the second-trimester procedure. The resolution will be based on official court decisions or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

para_P.title: Will the existing legal position on abortion access in Illinois remain unchanged by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Illinois Supreme Court has neither overturned nor made significant changes to its 2023 ruling that invalidated state laws imposing stricter regulations on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers and prohibited a commonly used second-trimester procedure. Conversely, it will resolve as NO if, by July 31, 2024, the Illinois Supreme Court has overturned this ruling, reinstated more stringent regulations on abortion providers, or reinstated the prohibition on the second-trimester procedure. The determination will rely on official court rulings or credible reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

question.title: Will both of the following occur by their respective deadlines: (a) The HHS's rule on telehealth services is enacted, and (b) Illinois changes its legal stance on abortion access?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) By August 31, 2024, a new Department of Health and Human Services rule specifically targeting the regulation of telehealth services is enacted through legal or administrative means. Enactment must be confirmed through official announcements by the HHS, court rulings, or other authoritative legal sources, and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, The Wall Street Journal, or The New York Times). The rule must be effective and not merely proposed or pending. (b) By July 31, 2024, the Illinois Supreme Court has reversed or significantly altered its 2023 decision that struck down state laws regulating abortion providers more strictly than other health care providers and banned a common second-trimester procedure. The resolution will be based on official court decisions or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post). If either of these conditions is not met by their respective deadlines, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Are both of the following events expected to happen by their respective deadlines: (a) The HHS's regulation on telehealth services is implemented, and (b) Illinois alters its legal position regarding abortion access?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (a) By August 31, 2024, a new rule from the Department of Health and Human Services specifically addressing the governance of telehealth services is put into effect through legal or administrative processes. Implementation must be substantiated by official announcements from the HHS, judicial rulings, or other authoritative legal sources, and reported by at least two prominent news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, The Wall Street Journal, or The New York Times). The rule must be operational and not just proposed or awaiting approval. (b) By July 31, 2024, the Illinois Supreme Court has overturned or significantly modified its 2023 ruling that invalidated state laws imposing stricter regulations on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers and prohibited a common second-trimester procedure. The resolution will be determined based on official court rulings or reliable reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post). If either of these criteria is not satisfied by their respective deadlines, the response will be NO.

question.title: Will either Illinois maintain its current legal stance on abortion access by July 2024 or the HHS's rule on telehealth services be enacted by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following conditions is met: (a) By July 31, 2024, the Illinois Supreme Court has not reversed or significantly altered its 2023 decision that struck down state laws regulating abortion providers more strictly than other health care providers and banned a common second-trimester procedure. This is based on official court decisions or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post). (b) By August 31, 2024, a new Department of Health and Human Services rule specifically targeting the regulation of telehealth services is enacted through legal or administrative means. Enactment must be confirmed through official announcements by the HHS, court rulings, or other authoritative legal sources, and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, The Wall Street Journal, or The New York Times). The rule must be effective and not merely proposed or pending. If neither condition is met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will Illinois either continue its existing position on abortion access, or will the HHS's regulations regarding telehealth services be implemented by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if at least one of the following scenarios occurs: (a) As of July 31, 2024, the Illinois Supreme Court has neither overturned nor substantially modified its 2023 ruling that invalidated state laws imposing stricter regulations on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers and prohibited a widely used second-trimester procedure. This determination is based on official judicial decisions or credible reporting from a minimum of three major news organizations (such as The New York Times, Reuters, or The Washington Post). (b) By August 31, 2024, a new rule from the Department of Health and Human Services specifically addressing the oversight of telehealth services is officially enacted through legal or administrative processes. Confirmation of enactment must come from official communications from the HHS, judicial decisions, or other recognized legal sources, and must be covered by at least two major news outlets (like The New York Times, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal). The rule must be operational and not just proposed or awaiting approval. If neither scenario occurs, the question will be answered with a NO.

question.title: Will Facebook's AI content moderation system be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Facebook's AI content moderation system is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention Facebook's AI system and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will there be reports indicating that Facebook's AI content moderation system is disseminating misinformation regarding elections?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if, by August 31, 2024, credible reports or official alerts from election officials, government entities, or trustworthy news organizations indicate that Facebook's AI content moderation system is disseminating misinformation related to elections. For the purposes of this inquiry, 'election misinformation' is defined as false or misleading information concerning election procedures, candidates, or outcomes. Credible reports must originate from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, prominent news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed articles published in respected journals. The reports or alerts must explicitly refer to Facebook's AI system and its involvement in the spread of election misinformation. If no such reports or alerts are made by the resolution date, the inquiry will conclude as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Mississippi hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024 and (b) Facebook's AI content moderation system not be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Mississippi officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of abortion rights by July 31, 2024. The referendum must be related to enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution or significantly altering existing abortion laws, must be officially announced by the Mississippi state government, and the voting process must be completed by the resolution date. The occurrence and results of the referendum must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). If no such referendum is held or completed by July 31, 2024, this part of the question will resolve as NO. (2) By August 31, 2024, there are no credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Facebook's AI content moderation system is spreading election misinformation. 'Election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention Facebook's AI system and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, this part of the question will resolve as YES. The overall question will resolve as YES only if both conditions (1) and (2) are met.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Mississippi will conduct a referendum regarding abortion rights by July 2024 and (b) Facebook's AI moderation system will not face reports for disseminating election misinformation by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if both of these criteria are fulfilled: (1) Mississippi officially carries out a statewide referendum concerning abortion rights before July 31, 2024. This referendum must aim to establish abortion rights in the state constitution or significantly modify current abortion laws, must be publicly announced by the Mississippi state government, and the voting must conclude by the resolution date. The occurrence and outcomes of the referendum must be documented by at least two major, credible news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or prominent national newspapers). Should no such referendum take place or be finalized by July 31, 2024, this segment of the question will be deemed negative. (2) By August 31, 2024, there are no trustworthy reports or official alerts from election officials, governmental bodies, or reputable news organizations indicating that Facebook's AI content moderation system is involved in spreading election misinformation. 'Election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information regarding electoral processes, candidates, or outcomes. Trustworthy reports should originate from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in respected journals. The reports or alerts must specifically refer to Facebook's AI system and its involvement in disseminating election misinformation. If no such reports or alerts are released by the resolution date, this part of the question will be considered affirmative. The overall question will be deemed affirmative only if both conditions (1) and (2) are satisfied.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by July/August 2024: (1) Facebook's AI content moderation system be reported for spreading election misinformation, or (2) Mississippi hold a referendum on abortion rights?
question.body:
(1) This part of the question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Facebook's AI content moderation system is spreading election misinformation. 'Election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention Facebook's AI system and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, this part will resolve as NO.

(2) This part of the question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Mississippi officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of abortion rights. The referendum must be related to enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution or significantly altering existing abortion laws. For a YES resolution, the referendum must be officially announced by the Mississippi state government and the voting process must be completed by the resolution date. The occurrence and results of the referendum must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). If no such referendum is held or completed by July 31, 2024, this part will resolve as NO. Merely scheduling a future referendum beyond the resolution date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: By July or August 2024, will either of the following take place: (1) reports emerge regarding Facebook's AI content moderation system disseminating election misinformation, or (2) will Mississippi hold a vote on abortion rights?
para_P.body:
(1) This segment will be considered YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible accounts or official alerts from election authorities, government entities, or trustworthy news organizations indicating that Facebook's AI content moderation system is distributing election misinformation. 'Election misinformation' pertains to incorrect or deceptive information concerning electoral processes, candidates, or outcomes. Credible accounts should originate from at least two sources: state or federal election officials, major news platforms (like Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or prominent US networks), or peer-reviewed research published in respected journals. The accounts or alerts must explicitly reference Facebook's AI system and its involvement in disseminating election misinformation. If no such accounts or alerts are made by the resolution date, this segment will be considered NO.

(2) This segment will be deemed YES if, by July 31, 2024, Mississippi officially carries out a statewide vote specifically addressing abortion rights. The vote must pertain to establishing abortion rights in the state constitution or significantly modifying current abortion laws. For a YES outcome, the vote must be officially declared by the Mississippi state government and the voting process must conclude by the resolution date. The occurrence and results of the vote must be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). If no such vote is conducted or finalized by July 31, 2024, this segment will resolve as NO. Simply scheduling a future vote beyond the resolution date does not qualify for a YES outcome.

question.title: Will YouTube face additional legal actions from the U.S. government by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, YouTube becomes subject to new legal actions initiated by any U.S. government entity. These legal actions may include, but are not limited to, lawsuits or regulatory actions. To qualify, the legal actions must be officially announced and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). The legal actions must be distinct from any ongoing cases or settlements as of October 1, 2023. If no such new actions are initiated by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will YouTube encounter further legal challenges from the U.S. government by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by August 31, 2024, YouTube is subjected to new legal challenges initiated by any governmental body in the United States. These challenges may encompass, but are not limited to, lawsuits or regulatory measures. To be considered, the legal challenges must be formally announced and reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). The legal challenges must be separate from any existing cases or settlements as of October 1, 2023. If no such new challenges are initiated by the resolution date, the inquiry resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Google faces additional legal actions from the U.S. government, and (b) YouTube avoids additional legal actions from the U.S. government?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: (a) Google becomes subject to new legal actions initiated by any U.S. government entity, including lawsuits or regulatory actions, officially announced and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN), distinct from any ongoing cases or settlements as of October 1, 2023; and (b) YouTube does not become subject to any new legal actions initiated by any U.S. government entity, with no official announcements or reports by at least two major news outlets of such new legal actions, distinct from any ongoing cases or settlements as of October 1, 2023. If both conditions are met by the resolution date, the question resolves as YES; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) Google will encounter further legal proceedings initiated by the U.S. government, and (b) YouTube will remain free from any new legal actions from the U.S. government?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if both of the following scenarios occur by August 31, 2024: (a) Google is subjected to new legal proceedings initiated by any entity of the U.S. government, including lawsuits or regulatory measures, which are officially declared and covered by at least two major news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN), separate from any ongoing cases or settlements as of October 1, 2023; and (b) YouTube does not face any new legal actions initiated by any U.S. government entity, with no official announcements or reports from at least two major news outlets regarding such new legal actions, distinct from any ongoing cases or settlements as of October 1, 2023. If both scenarios are fulfilled by the resolution date, the inquiry will be resolved as YES; otherwise, it will be resolved as NO.

question.title: Will either YouTube or Google face additional legal actions from the U.S. government by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, either YouTube or Google becomes subject to new legal actions initiated by any U.S. government entity. These legal actions may include, but are not limited to, lawsuits or regulatory actions. To qualify, the legal actions must be officially announced and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). The legal actions must be distinct from any ongoing cases or settlements as of October 1, 2023. If no such new actions are initiated against either company by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the U.S. government initiate further legal proceedings against YouTube or Google before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, either YouTube or Google is subjected to new legal proceedings started by any entity of the U.S. government. These proceedings may encompass, but are not limited to, lawsuits or regulatory measures. For these actions to be considered, they must be officially disclosed and reported by at least two prominent news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). The legal proceedings must be separate from any existing cases or settlements as of October 1, 2023. If no new actions are taken against either company by the resolution date, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the United Auto Workers endorse a Republican candidate for president by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the United Auto Workers (UAW) officially endorses a Republican candidate for the presidential election. The endorsement must be confirmed through official UAW statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, or The Washington Post). If no endorsement is made by the resolution date, or if the UAW endorses a candidate from a different party, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the United Auto Workers support a Republican presidential candidate before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by July 31, 2024, the United Auto Workers (UAW) formally supports a Republican candidate for the presidential election. The support must be validated through official UAW announcements or reported by at least two credible news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, or The Washington Post). If there is no support expressed by the resolution date, or if the UAW backs a candidate from another party, the inquiry will be answered as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (1) The United States announces plans to build additional nuclear reactors beyond the current two, and (2) The United Auto Workers do not endorse a Republican candidate for president?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (1) The U.S. government officially announces plans to build more nuclear reactors beyond the two currently planned. The announcement must come from an official government source, such as the Department of Energy or the President's office, and be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Bloomberg). The announcement must clearly indicate an intention to construct additional reactors beyond the two already planned, not just expansions or modifications to the existing plans. (2) The United Auto Workers (UAW) does not officially endorse a Republican candidate for the presidential election. This includes cases where no endorsement is made by the resolution date or if the UAW endorses a candidate from a different party. The lack of endorsement must be confirmed through official UAW statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, or The Washington Post). If either of these conditions is not met, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will the following two events take place: (1) The United States reveals intentions to construct more nuclear reactors in addition to the existing two, and (2) The United Auto Workers refrain from supporting a Republican presidential candidate?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if both of the subsequent criteria are satisfied by July 31, 2024: (1) The U.S. government publicly discloses plans to build additional nuclear reactors beyond the currently planned two. This announcement must originate from an official government entity, such as the Department of Energy or the President’s office, and be covered by at least two prominent international news organizations (for example, Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Bloomberg). The statement must explicitly express an intention to create further reactors beyond the two already slated, rather than merely indicating expansions or alterations to existing proposals. (2) The United Auto Workers (UAW) does not formally endorse a Republican candidate for the presidential election. This includes scenarios where no endorsement is made by the resolution date or if the UAW backs a candidate from another political party. The absence of endorsement must be verified through official UAW communications or reported by at least two credible news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, or The Washington Post). If either of these conditions fails to be fulfilled, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will either the United Auto Workers endorse a Republican candidate for president or the United States announce plans to build additional nuclear reactors by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs by July 31, 2024: (a) The United Auto Workers (UAW) officially endorses a Republican candidate for the presidential election. This endorsement must be confirmed through official UAW statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources, such as Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, or The Washington Post. (b) The U.S. government officially announces plans to build more nuclear reactors beyond the two currently planned. This announcement must come from an official government source, such as the Department of Energy or the President's office, and be reported by at least two major international news outlets, such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Bloomberg. The announcement must clearly indicate an intention to construct additional reactors beyond the two already planned, not just expansions or modifications to the existing plans. If neither of these events occurs by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the United Auto Workers will support a Republican presidential candidate or that the U.S. will reveal intentions to construct more nuclear reactors by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if one of the following happens by July 31, 2024: (a) The United Auto Workers (UAW) formally backs a Republican candidate for the presidential race. This support must be validated through official UAW communications or reported by at least two credible news organizations, such as Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, or The Washington Post. (b) The U.S. government officially discloses plans to build additional nuclear reactors beyond the two currently scheduled. This disclosure must originate from an official government entity, such as the Department of Energy or the office of the President, and must be covered by at least two prominent international news agencies, such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Bloomberg. question.title: Will the U.S. Senate pass a bill to cut the NASA budget by more than 20% by August 2024?
