question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The German economy avoids a recession by July 2024, and (b) The Bank of England does not announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: (a) The German economy avoids a recession by July 31, 2024, meaning it does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Federal Statistical Office of Germany between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. (b) The Bank of England does not announce an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024, meaning no official communications such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials confirm such an announcement by the resolution date. The interest rate refers to the Bank Rate, the Bank of England's primary monetary policy tool.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) The German economy will steer clear of a recession by July 2024, and (b) The Bank of England will refrain from declaring an interest rate reduction by August 2024?
para_P.body: (a) The German economy will successfully avoid a recession by July 31, 2024, indicating it does not undergo two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as recorded by the Federal Statistical Office of Germany between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. (b) The Bank of England will not make an announcement regarding an interest rate cut to be implemented by August 31, 2024, implying that there will be no official statements such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee communications, or public addresses by Bank representatives confirming such an announcement by the resolution date. The interest rate pertains to the Bank Rate, which is the primary monetary policy instrument of the Bank of England.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by mid-2024: (a) The Bank of England announces an interest rate cut, or (b) The German economy avoids a recession?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) The Bank of England officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of England communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. The actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for monetary policy. (b) The German economy does not enter a recession by July 31, 2024. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Federal Statistical Office of Germany. The question resolves as NO if the German economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Is it possible that by mid-2024, either (a) the Bank of England will declare a reduction in interest rates, or (b) the German economy will successfully avoid a recession?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if at least one of the following takes place: (a) The Bank of England makes an official declaration of an interest rate reduction that is scheduled to be effective by August 31, 2024. This declaration must be validated through official communications from the Bank of England, including press releases, statements from the Monetary Policy Committee, or public addresses made by Bank representatives. The actual date when the rate cut takes effect may be after August 31, 2024, provided that the announcement is made by that date. The interest rate in question pertains to the Bank Rate, which serves as the primary instrument of monetary policy for the Bank of England. (b) The German economy does not fall into a recession by July 31, 2024. For the purposes of this inquiry, a recession is characterized by two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Federal Statistical Office of Germany. The inquiry will be resolved as NO if the German economy records two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will an enforceable ethics code for U.S. Congress members be established by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, an enforceable ethics code specifically for U.S. Congress members is officially adopted by the United States government. The adoption must be confirmed by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press). The ethics code must be legally binding and applicable to all sitting Congress members. It should outline clear standards of conduct and mechanisms for enforcement. If no such code meeting these criteria is established and officially adopted by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Note that mere proposals or discussions about such a code do not qualify for a YES resolution; the code must be formally adopted and enforceable.

para_P.title: Will there be a legally binding ethics code for members of the U.S. Congress by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, a legally binding ethics code specifically for members of the U.S. Congress is formally approved by the United States government. This approval must be verified by at least two prominent, trustworthy news organizations (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press). The ethics code must be enforceable and relevant to all current Congress members. It should specify distinct standards of behavior and enforcement procedures. If no such code that fulfills these requirements is formally approved by the deadline, the question will be answered as NO. It is important to note that simple proposals or discussions regarding such a code do not meet the criteria for a YES answer; the code must be officially adopted and enforceable.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Michigan holds a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024, and (b) no enforceable ethics code for U.S. Congress members is established by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) By August 31, 2024, Michigan officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. This requires:
   1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Michigan state government.
   2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
   3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

(b) By July 31, 2024, no enforceable ethics code specifically for U.S. Congress members is officially adopted by the United States government. This requires confirmation by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press) that no such code has been officially adopted. The ethics code must be legally binding and applicable to all sitting Congress members, outlining clear standards of conduct and mechanisms for enforcement.

The question will resolve as NO if either:

1. No such referendum occurs in Michigan by August 31, 2024, or a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date, or a referendum is held but does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

2. An enforceable ethics code for U.S. Congress members is established and officially adopted by July 31, 2024, meeting the specified criteria.

para_P.title: Are both of the following going to take place: (a) Michigan will conduct a referendum concerning abortion rights by August 2024, and (b) there will be no enforceable ethics code for members of the U.S. Congress in effect by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with YES if both of the following criteria are fulfilled:

(a) By August 31, 2024, Michigan carries out an official public referendum aimed at securing abortion rights within the state. This entails:
   1. The state government of Michigan must officially announce and conduct the referendum.
   2. The referendum must directly address the matter of protecting abortion rights.
   3. The outcomes of the referendum must be reported publicly by official state communications or widely acknowledged news organizations.

(b) By July 31, 2024, no enforceable ethics code that applies specifically to U.S. Congress members is formally enacted by the United States government. Verification must come from at least two major, credible news organizations (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or the Associated Press) confirming that no such code has been officially enacted. The ethics code must be legally binding and applicable to all current members of Congress, detailing explicit standards of behavior and enforcement mechanisms.

The question will be answered with NO if either:

1. No referendum takes place in Michigan by August 31, 2024, or if a scheduled referendum is canceled or delayed beyond the specified date, or if a referendum is held but does not specifically aim to secure abortion rights.

2. An enforceable ethics code for U.S. Congress members is established and officially enacted by July 31, 2024, fulfilling the outlined requirements.

question.title: Will either an enforceable ethics code for U.S. Congress members be established by July 2024, or will Michigan hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs:

(a) By July 31, 2024, an enforceable ethics code specifically for U.S. Congress members is officially adopted by the United States government. The adoption must be confirmed by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press). The ethics code must be legally binding and applicable to all sitting Congress members. It should outline clear standards of conduct and mechanisms for enforcement. If no such code meeting these criteria is established and officially adopted by the resolution date, this part will resolve as NO. Note that mere proposals or discussions about such a code do not qualify for a YES resolution; the code must be formally adopted and enforceable.

(b) By August 31, 2024, Michigan officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution: 1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Michigan state government. 2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection. 3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources. The question will resolve as NO if: 1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024. 2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date. 3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights. Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will there be either a legally binding ethics code for members of the U.S. Congress or a public vote in Michigan regarding abortion rights by August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed YES if at least one of the following conditions is satisfied:

(a) An enforceable ethics framework for U.S. Congress members is officially established by the United States government by July 31, 2024. This establishment must be verified by two or more prominent, credible news organizations (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press). The ethics framework must be legally binding and applicable to all current members of Congress, containing explicit standards of conduct and enforcement procedures. If such a framework is not established and formally adopted by the deadline, this segment will resolve as NO. Note that mere discussions or proposals regarding this framework do not qualify for a YES; it must be formally adopted and enforceable.

(b) Michigan conducts a public vote by August 31, 2024, specifically aimed at securing abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution: 1. The vote must be officially organized and carried out by the Michigan state government. 2. It must specifically address the issue of protecting abortion rights. 3. The outcomes must be reported publicly by official state sources or major news outlets. This question will resolve as NO if: 1. No such vote is held by August 31, 2024. 2. A scheduled vote is cancelled or delayed beyond the specified date. 3. A vote occurs, but it does not specifically aim at securing abortion rights. Note: The outcome of the vote is not considered; only its occurrence within the given timeframe.

question.title: Will Mercedes-Benz's quarterly net income increase by over 20% year-over-year by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Mercedes-Benz reports a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, in its official financial statements released by July 31, 2024. The increase must be verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal). If no such increase is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported increase is 20% or less, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not consider any specific quarter, but rather any quarter-over-quarter comparison within the specified timeframe.

para_P.title: Will the quarterly net profit of Mercedes-Benz rise by more than 20% compared to the same quarter last year by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if Mercedes-Benz announces a net profit growth exceeding 20% for any quarter in comparison to the corresponding quarter from the previous year, as disclosed in its official financial reports released by July 31, 2024. The increase must be confirmed through official company earnings documents or by at least three reputable financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Wall Street Journal). If no such growth is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported growth is 20% or below, the inquiry will be considered NO. It is important to note that this question does not focus on any specific quarter, but rather any quarter-over-quarter assessment within the designated period.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The Canadian economy avoids a recession, and (b) Mercedes-Benz's quarterly net income does not increase by over 20% year-over-year?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) The Canadian economy does not enter a recession by July 31, 2024. A recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Canada. If the Canadian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024, this part resolves as NO.

(b) Mercedes-Benz does not report a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, in its official financial statements released by July 31, 2024. The increase must not be verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal). If no such increase is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported increase is 20% or less, this part resolves as YES.

The combined question resolves as YES only if both conditions (a) and (b) are met.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) The Canadian economy manages to steer clear of a recession, and (b) Mercedes-Benz's quarterly net earnings do not rise by more than 20% compared to the same quarter from the previous year?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of the subsequent criteria are satisfied:

(a) The Canadian economy remains out of recession by July 31, 2024. A recession is characterized as experiencing two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Canada. Should the Canadian economy undergo two successive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024, this part will be answered with a NO.

(b) Mercedes-Benz does not disclose a net income increase exceeding 20% for any quarter when compared to the same quarter from the prior year, in its official financial disclosures made public by July 31, 2024. The increase must not be substantiated through official company earnings reports or at least three reputable financial news outlets (for instance, Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal). If no such increase is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported increase is 20% or less, this part will be answered with a YES.

The overall question will be resolved as YES only if both conditions (a) and (b) are satisfied.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Mercedes-Benz's quarterly net income increases by over 20% year-over-year, or (b) The Canadian economy avoids a recession?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs by July 31, 2024: 
(a) Mercedes-Benz reports a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year in its official financial statements. The increase must be verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal). If no such increase is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported increase is 20% or less, this part resolves as NO. Note that this does not consider any specific quarter, but rather any quarter-over-quarter comparison within the specified timeframe.
(b) The Canadian economy does not enter a recession. For this purpose, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Canada. This part resolves as NO if the Canadian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Is it possible that by July 2024, either (a) Mercedes-Benz's quarterly net income rises by more than 20% compared to the previous year, or (b) the Canadian economy successfully avoids a recession?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if either of the following happens by July 31, 2024: 
(a) Mercedes-Benz discloses a net income growth exceeding 20% for any quarter when compared to the corresponding quarter of the prior year in its official financial disclosures. The increase must be corroborated through official earnings reports from the company or at least three reputable financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal). If such an increase is not reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported increase is 20% or lower, this aspect will resolve as NO. It is important to note that this does not pertain to any specific quarter, but rather any quarter-over-quarter evaluation within the designated timeframe.
(b) The Canadian economy does not fall into a recession. For this context, a recession is characterized by two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Canada. This part will resolve as NO if the Canadian economy undergoes two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will Sony Corporation resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Sony Corporation reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Sony Corporation workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Sony Corporation and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Sony Corporation come to an agreement to end a significant workers' strike before July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmed if Sony Corporation successfully negotiates with unionized employees, leading to the conclusion of a major strike by July 31, 2024. For this affirmation to be deemed legitimate:

1. The strike must involve a considerable number of workers from Sony Corporation (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must persist for a minimum duration of one week.
3. The affirmation must be substantiated by official announcements from both Sony Corporation and the relevant union.
4. The affirmation must be covered by at least two credible international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no resolution meeting all these stipulations is reached by the indicated date, or if no major strike takes place, the inquiry will be regarded as negated.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The United States maintains a 100% tariff on Chinese-made machinery through August 2024 (b) Sony Corporation does not resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: 

(a) The United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made machinery as of August 31, 2024. The existence and rate of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

(b) Sony Corporation does not reach an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the continuation of a significant strike beyond July 31, 2024, or if no significant strike occurs at all. For the resolution to be considered valid: 
1. A strike involving a substantial number of Sony Corporation workers (at least 1,000 participants) does not end with an agreement by the specified date. 
2. The strike must last for at least one week if it occurs. 
3. The lack of resolution must be confirmed by the absence of official statements from both Sony Corporation and the involved union regarding an agreement. 
4. The lack of resolution or the absence of a strike must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC). 

If such a resolution meeting all these criteria is not achieved by the specified date, the question resolves as YES.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) The United States keeps a full 100% tariff on machinery made in China until August 2024 (b) Sony Corporation fails to settle a significant workers' strike by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a YES if both of these conditions are satisfied: 

(a) The United States persists in enforcing a 100% tariff on the importation of machinery manufactured in China as of August 31, 2024. The presence and percentage of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (like the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and supported by at least two credible news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is lowered below 100% or entirely eliminated at any time up to and including August 31, 2024, the inquiry will conclude with a NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently change the 100% rate will not influence the outcome of this inquiry.

(b) Sony Corporation does not come to a resolution with unionized workers, leading to the continuation of a significant strike beyond July 31, 2024, or if no notable strike takes place at all. For the resolution to be deemed valid: 
1. A strike involving a considerable number of Sony Corporation employees (at least 1,000 participants) does not conclude with an agreement by the specified date. 
2. The strike must endure for a minimum of one week if it occurs. 
3. The absence of a resolution must be confirmed by the lack of official statements from both Sony Corporation and the involved union regarding an agreement. 
4. The absence of a resolution or the non-occurrence of a strike must be reported by at least two reputable international news outlets (like Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC). 

If such a resolution meeting all these criteria is not achieved by the specified date, the inquiry concludes with a YES.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Sony Corporation resolves a major workers' strike by July 2024 (b) The United States maintains a 100% tariff on Chinese-made machinery through August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs:

(a) Sony Corporation reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For this part to resolve as YES:
   - The strike must involve at least 1,000 Sony Corporation workers.
   - The strike must last for at least one week.
   - The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Sony Corporation and the involved union.
   - The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).
   If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, this part resolves as NO.

(b) As of August 31, 2024, the United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made machinery. For this part to resolve as YES:
   - The existence and rate of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce).
   - The tariff's existence must be corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times).
   If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, this part resolves as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this part.

para_P.title: Is it possible for one of the following to happen: (a) Sony Corporation settles a significant workers' strike by July 2024 (b) The United States keeps a 100% tariff on machinery imported from China until August 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with YES if at least one of the following takes place:

(a) Sony Corporation comes to an agreement with its unionized workforce, thereby ending a major strike by July 31, 2024. For this to count as YES:
   - The strike must involve a minimum of 1,000 workers from Sony Corporation.
   - The duration of the strike must be no less than one week.
   - Confirmation of the resolution must come from official announcements from both Sony Corporation and the relevant union.
   - At least two credible international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC) must report on the resolution.
   If such a resolution, meeting all these requirements, is not achieved by the deadline, or if a significant strike does not occur, this part will resolve as NO.

(b) By August 31, 2024, the United States continues to enforce a 100% tariff on Chinese-manufactured machinery imports. For this to resolve as YES:
   - The tariff's existence and its rate must be verifiable through official U.S. government documentation (such as from the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce).
   - The presence of the tariff must be confirmed by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times).
   If the tariff is lowered below 100% or entirely eliminated at any time up to and including August 31, 2024, this part will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently change the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this part.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate remain at or above 13.25% in August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate is reported to be at or above 13.25% at any point during August 2024. Confirmation must come from official Central Bank of Brazil announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Folha de S.Paulo). If the rate is reported to have decreased below 13.25% and remains below this level throughout August 2024, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Brazil's Central Bank maintain the Selic rate at or above 13.25% during August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if the Selic rate of Brazil's Central Bank is documented to be at or exceeding 13.25% at any time in August 2024. Verification must be provided by official announcements from the Central Bank of Brazil or at least two trusted financial news outlets (for example, Bloomberg, Reuters, Folha de S.Paulo). If the rate is noted to have fallen below 13.25% and stays below this threshold for the entirety of August 2024, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Argentine agricultural workers remain on strike through August 2024, and (b) the Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate falls below 13.25% at any point in August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) By August 31, 2024, agricultural workers in Argentina are still on strike or have not fully resumed normal operations following any current labor dispute. The status of the strike or work resumption must be confirmed by official statements from agricultural organizations, the unions representing the workers, or the Argentine government, and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Clarín, La Nación, or Reuters). If the workers have fully returned to work and normal operations have resumed before or during August 2024, the condition is not met. Partial returns to work or limited operations do not count as a full resolution of the strike. (b) The Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate is reported to have decreased below 13.25% and remains below this level throughout August 2024. Confirmation must come from official Central Bank of Brazil announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Folha de S.Paulo). If the rate is reported to be at or above 13.25% at any point during August 2024, the condition is not met. Both conditions must be satisfied for the question to resolve as YES; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) agricultural workers in Argentina will still be on strike until the end of August 2024, and (b) the Selic rate set by Brazil's Central Bank will drop below 13.25% at some time in August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if the following two criteria are fulfilled: (a) By the conclusion of August 2024, agricultural workers in Argentina are either still on strike or have not completely returned to normal operations following any ongoing labor disputes. The status of the strike or the resumption of work must be verified through official communications from agricultural organizations, the unions of the workers, or the Argentine government, and reported by at least two credible news outlets (like Clarín, La Nación, or Reuters). If the workers have entirely resumed work and normal operations have been restored before or during August 2024, this condition is not satisfied. Partial work returns or limited operations do not count as a complete resolution of the strike. (b) The Selic rate from the Central Bank of Brazil is reported to have fallen below 13.25% and stays beneath this threshold throughout August 2024. Verification must come from official announcements from the Central Bank of Brazil or at least two trusted financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Folha de S.Paulo). If the rate is indicated to be at or above 13.25% at any moment during August 2024, this condition is not satisfied. Both criteria must be met for the question to be answered as YES; otherwise, it will be answered as NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by the end of August 2024: (a) The Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate remains at or above 13.25% (b) Argentine agricultural workers remain on strike?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following conditions is met by August 31, 2024: (a) The Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate is reported to be at or above 13.25% at any point during August 2024. Confirmation must come from official Central Bank of Brazil announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Folha de S.Paulo). If the rate is reported to have decreased below 13.25% and remains below this level throughout August 2024, this part resolves as NO. (b) Agricultural workers in Argentina are still on strike or have not fully resumed normal operations following any current labor dispute. The status of the strike or work resumption must be confirmed by official statements from agricultural organizations, the unions representing the workers, or the Argentine government, and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Clarín, La Nación, or Reuters). If the workers have fully returned to work and normal operations have resumed before or during August 2024, this part resolves as NO. Partial returns to work or limited operations do not count as a full resolution of the strike.

para_P.title: By the conclusion of August 2024, will one of the following take place: (a) The Selic rate set by Brazil's Central Bank stays at or above 13.25% (b) Agricultural workers in Argentina continue their strike?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if at least one of the following scenarios occurs by August 31, 2024: (a) The Selic rate from Brazil's Central Bank is documented at or above 13.25% at any time during August 2024. Verification must come from official announcements by the Central Bank of Brazil or at least two credible financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Folha de S.Paulo). Should the rate be reported as dropping below 13.25% and staying below this threshold throughout August 2024, this segment will be marked as NO. (b) Agricultural workers in Argentina are still engaged in a strike or have not completely returned to regular operations following any ongoing labor conflict. The strike's status or the resumption of work must be validated by official declarations from agricultural bodies, the unions representing the workforce, or the Argentine government, and reported by at least two trustworthy news organizations (such as Clarín, La Nación, or Reuters). If the workforce has entirely resumed work and normal operations have been restored before or during August 2024, this segment will be marked as NO. Partial work returns or limited operations do not constitute a full resolution of the strike.

question.title: Will Sara Lee issue a recall of packaged meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Sara Lee officially announces a recall of any of its packaged meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Sara Lee's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Sara Lee
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Sara Lee recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will Sara Lee pull back its packaged meat products because of a listeria outbreak before August 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with YES if, by August 31, 2024, Sara Lee makes an official statement regarding the withdrawal of any of its packaged meat items due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be validated through at least one of the following channels:

2. A press statement from Sara Lee
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) that specifically references a Sara Lee recall
4. Reports from a minimum of three major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing authoritative sources

The recall must clearly state listeria as the cause for the product removal. If such a recall is not announced by the specified deadline, the question will be answered as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) the E. coli outbreak tied to lettuce results in more than 10 confirmed deaths, and (b) Sara Lee does not issue a recall of packaged meats due to a listeria outbreak?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024:

(a) There are official reports confirming more than 10 deaths attributed to the E. coli outbreak linked to lettuce from a specific producer. Official confirmation must come from credible sources such as the CDC (Centers for Disease Control and Prevention) or equivalent health authorities, and be reported by at least two reputable news outlets. The death toll must be specifically linked to this outbreak and not include deaths from unrelated E. coli cases. Only deaths directly attributed to this specific outbreak will be counted.

(b) Sara Lee does not officially announce a recall of any of its packaged meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The absence of a recall must be confirmed by the lack of any of the following sources:
   1. An official announcement on Sara Lee's website or social media channels
   2. A press release from Sara Lee
   3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Sara Lee recall
   4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources
The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal.

If both conditions (a) and (b) are met by the specified date, the question resolves as YES. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

(b) Sara Lee does not make any formal announcement regarding a recall of its packaged meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The absence of a recall must be corroborated by the lack of any of the following sources:
   1. An official statement on Sara Lee's website or social media platforms

The recall must clearly state listeria as the cause for the product withdrawal.

question.title: Will Andrew Bailey remain as Governor of the Bank of England through July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Andrew Bailey is still serving as the Governor of the Bank of England on July 31, 2024. Confirmation must come from official Bank of England announcements or be reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, CNBC, The Wall Street Journal, or Bloomberg). If he is no longer serving as Governor by the resolution date for any reason (including but not limited to resignation, removal, or end of term), the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, any interim or acting Governor appointments will not be considered as Bailey remaining in the position.

para_P.title: Is Andrew Bailey expected to continue as the Governor of the Bank of England until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if Andrew Bailey is still in the role of Governor of the Bank of England on July 31, 2024. If he is no longer in the position of Governor by the resolution date for any reason (including but not limited to resignation, dismissal, or completion of term), the inquiry will be answered with a NO. For the purposes of this inquiry, any interim or acting appointments will not be regarded as Bailey continuing in the role.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) a government-developed AI system be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024 and (2) Andrew Bailey not remain as Governor of the Bank of England through July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) By August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that a government-developed AI system is spreading election misinformation. 'Election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the government-developed AI system and its role in spreading election misinformation. (2) Andrew Bailey is no longer serving as the Governor of the Bank of England on or before July 31, 2024, for any reason (including but not limited to resignation, removal, or end of term). Confirmation must come from official Bank of England announcements or be reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, CNBC, The Wall Street Journal, or Bloomberg). If he is still serving as Governor by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, any interim or acting Governor appointments will not be considered as Bailey remaining in the position. If both conditions are met by their respective resolution dates, this question will resolve as YES; otherwise, it will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will a South Korean battery company's factory project in Ohio be canceled by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, it is confirmed that the South Korean lithium-ion battery company's plan to build a factory in Ohio has been officially canceled. Confirmation must come from official statements by the company, the state of Ohio, or at least two credible news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The cancellation must be a complete termination of the project, not just a delay or modification. If the project is still ongoing, under review, or has not been officially canceled by this date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'cancellation' means the company has formally withdrawn its plans or the state has definitively rejected the project.

para_P.title: Is the factory initiative of a South Korean battery manufacturer in Ohio going to be scrapped by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, it is established that the South Korean lithium-ion battery manufacturer's intention to construct a factory in Ohio has been officially abandoned. Verification must be provided through formal announcements from the company, the state of Ohio, or at least two reliable news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or significant national newspapers). The abandonment must signify a complete cessation of the project, rather than merely a postponement or alteration. If the initiative remains active, under consideration, or has not been formally scrapped by this deadline, the inquiry will be answered with a NO. For the context of this question, 'scrapping' indicates that the company has officially retracted its plans or the state has decisively declined the project.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) South Korea's KOSPI index reaches or exceeds 3,500 points, and (b) a South Korean battery company's factory project in Ohio is not canceled?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: 

(a) South Korea's KOSPI index reaches or exceeds 3,500 points at any time between October 1, 2023, and August 31, 2024. Intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 3,500 points. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Korea Exchange.

(b) The South Korean lithium-ion battery company's plan to build a factory in Ohio has not been officially canceled by August 31, 2024. The project must still be ongoing, under review, or not officially canceled by this date. Confirmation must come from official statements by the company, the state of Ohio, or at least two credible news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). If the project is officially canceled by this date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'not canceled' means the company has not formally withdrawn its plans and the state has not definitively rejected the project.

question.title: Will a Texas woman's lawsuit against local authorities over an abortion-related arrest reach a settlement by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, a publicly confirmed settlement is reached in the lawsuit filed by a Texas woman against local sheriff and prosecutors following her arrest and murder charge related to a self-managed abortion. The settlement must be officially announced by the involved parties or reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). If no such settlement is confirmed by the specified date, or if the case is dismissed or proceeds to trial without a settlement, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the lawsuit initiated by a Texas woman against local officials regarding her abortion-related arrest conclude with a settlement by July 2024?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Arizona enacts legislation restricting the public carrying of non-firearm weapons by August 2024, and (b) a Texas woman's lawsuit over an abortion-related arrest does not reach a settlement by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) By August 31, 2024, Arizona officially passes and enacts legislation that imposes new restrictions on the public carrying of non-firearm weapons, such as bladed weapons or other non-firearm implements. The legislation must specifically address the carrying of these weapons in public spaces. For a YES resolution, the new law must be officially enacted and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, local Arizona news outlets). If no such legislation is passed and enacted by the specified date, or if any enacted legislation does not specifically restrict the public carrying of non-firearm weapons, the condition is not met. (2) By July 31, 2024, no publicly confirmed settlement is reached in the lawsuit filed by a Texas woman against local sheriff and prosecutors following her arrest and murder charge related to a self-managed abortion. The question resolves as YES if the case is dismissed or proceeds to trial without a settlement. If a settlement is officially announced by the involved parties or reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post) by the specified date, the condition is not met. If both conditions are met, the question resolves as YES. If either or both conditions are not met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Apple fund full tuition for all Caltech physics students by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, it is officially confirmed that Apple's funding is being used to cover full tuition for all physics students at Caltech, regardless of their family income. The confirmation must come from official university announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources. If the funding does not cover full tuition for all physics students by the resolution date, or if it only covers tuition for a subset of students based on income or other criteria, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Apple provide complete tuition coverage for every physics student at Caltech by the end of July 2024?

The verification must be sourced from official university communications or reports from at least two credible news outlets. If the financial support does not encompass full tuition for all physics students by the specified resolution date, or if it only applies to a portion of students based on financial need or other criteria, the inquiry will be resolved as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Facebook resolves a major workers' strike by July 2024 (b) Apple does not fund full tuition for all Caltech physics students by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024:

(a) Facebook reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike. The strike must involve at least 1,000 participants, last for at least one week, and the resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Facebook and the involved union and reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

(b) It is not officially confirmed that Apple's funding is being used to cover full tuition for all physics students at Caltech, regardless of their family income. The lack of confirmation must be due to the funding not covering full tuition for all physics students, or only covering tuition for a subset of students based on income or other criteria.

If both conditions are met, the question resolves as YES. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

If both criteria are fulfilled, the inquiry will be deemed TRUE. If either criterion is not fulfilled, the inquiry will be deemed FALSE.

If the funding does not cover full tuition for all physics students by the resolution date, or if it only covers tuition for a subset of students based on income or other criteria, this part resolves as NO. (b) Facebook reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike. For this resolution to be considered valid, the strike must involve at least 1,000 Facebook workers, last for at least one week, and the resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Facebook and the involved union, and reported by at least two reputable international news sources. If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, this part resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either Apple will cover full tuition for every physics student at Caltech or that Facebook will settle a significant workers' strike by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if at least one of the following happens by July 31, 2024: (a) There is official confirmation that Apple's funding is allocated to pay for the complete tuition of all physics students at Caltech, irrespective of their family income. This confirmation must come from official announcements from the university or reports from no fewer than two credible news outlets. If the funding does not extend to cover the full tuition for every physics student by the resolution date, or if it only applies to a specific group of students based on income or other criteria, this aspect will resolve as NO. (b) Facebook successfully negotiates with unionized employees, leading to the conclusion of a major strike. For this resolution to be recognized, the strike must involve a minimum of 1,000 Facebook employees, persist for at least one week, and the agreement must be validated by official communications from both Facebook and the relevant union, as well as reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. If no resolution that meets all these conditions is reached by the specified date, or if no significant strike takes place, this aspect will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Nigeria maintain its ban on cryptocurrency transactions through August, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the government of Nigeria has not officially reversed its existing ban on cryptocurrency transactions. The ban must remain in place without any changes that would effectively legalize the transactions. Confirmation of the ban's status should be available through official government sources or reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. If the ban is reversed or significantly weakened to effectively allow cryptocurrency transactions before or during August 2024, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Nigeria continue its prohibition on cryptocurrency dealings until August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, the Nigerian government has not formally lifted its current prohibition on cryptocurrency dealings. The prohibition must stay intact without any alterations that would practically legalize the transactions. Verification of the prohibition's status should be obtainable from official government channels or reported by a minimum of two credible international news outlets. If the prohibition is lifted or significantly relaxed to effectively permit cryptocurrency dealings prior to or during August 2024, the inquiry will be deemed negative.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 31, 2024: (a) Russia's Federation Council passes a major economic reform bill opposed by President Putin, and (b) Nigeria lifts its ban on cryptocurrency transactions?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following occur by August 31, 2024:

(a) Russia's Federation Council passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Vladimir Putin or his administration. To qualify:
   1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
   2. It must be passed by the Federation Council, regardless of whether it becomes law.
   3. The opposition from President Putin or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
   4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Russian economy.

(b) The government of Nigeria officially reverses its existing ban on cryptocurrency transactions or makes changes that effectively legalize the transactions. Confirmation of the ban's reversal or weakening should be available through official government sources or reported by at least two reputable international news organizations.

If both conditions (a) and (b) are met by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If either or both are not met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the following two events happen before August 31, 2024: (a) the Federation Council of Russia approves a significant economic reform bill that President Putin opposes, and (b) Nigeria removes its prohibition on cryptocurrency transactions?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with YES if both of the following conditions are fulfilled by August 31, 2024:

(a) The Federation Council of Russia approves a significant economic reform bill that is clearly opposed by President Vladimir Putin or his administration. To qualify:
   1. The bill must pertain to economic policy, including fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
   2. It must be approved by the Federation Council, regardless of whether it is enacted into law.
   3. The opposition from President Putin or his administration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
   4. The bill must be characterized as 'major' or 'significant' by these news outlets in terms of its potential effect on the Russian economy.

(b) The Nigerian government officially lifts its current ban on cryptocurrency transactions or implements changes that effectively legalize these transactions. Confirmation of the ban's reversal or modification should be accessible through official government channels or reported by at least two credible international news organizations.

If both conditions (a) and (b) are satisfied by August 31, 2024, the inquiry will resolve as YES. If either or both are not satisfied, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the Indonesian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Indonesian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Indonesia. The question resolves as NO if the Indonesian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Can the Indonesian economy steer clear of a recession by July 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Indonesian economy has not fallen into a recession. A recession is characterized for this question as two successive quarters of declining GDP growth as recorded by Statistics Indonesia. The answer will be NO if the Indonesian economy goes through two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) the WHO declares the current measles outbreak over by August 2024, and (b) the Indonesian economy enters a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) The World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing measles outbreak over by August 31, 2024. This declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC. The outbreak referred to is the one prompting heightened global public health responses. (2) The Indonesian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024, as reported by Statistics Indonesia. If either or both conditions are not met, the question resolves as NO.

The epidemic in question is the one that has led to increased global public health actions. (2) Indonesia's economy records two successive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024, as reported by Statistics Indonesia. question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, President Joe Biden delivers a speech at any National Education Association (NEA) event held in Pennsylvania. para_P.title: Is President Biden expected to address a National Education Association gathering in Pennsylvania before July 2024?

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) the Iowa Senate passes a total abortion ban, and (b) President Biden does not deliver a speech at a National Education Association event in Pennsylvania?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) The Iowa Senate passes legislation enacting a total abortion ban, defined as prohibiting all or nearly all abortions with exceptions only for cases of rape, incest, or threat to the mother's life, as confirmed by official Iowa legislative records. (b) President Joe Biden does not deliver a speech at any National Education Association (NEA) event held in Pennsylvania, confirmed by the absence of official White House announcements and reports from at least two reputable news sources. para_P.title: By July 2024, will the Iowa Senate have enacted a comprehensive abortion ban and will President Biden have refrained from speaking at a National Education Association event in Pennsylvania?

question.title: Will the Australian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Australian economy does not enter a recession. The question resolves as NO if the Australian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the Australian economy to steer clear of a recession by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, the Australian economy has not entered a recession. question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) U.S. previously occupied home sales show a decline for two consecutive months, and (b) the Australian economy enters a recession?

(b) The Australian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024, as reported by the Australian Bureau of Statistics. para_P.title: Is it possible for the Australian economy to steer clear of a recession by July 2024, or for U.S. sales of previously owned homes to drop for two consecutive months by July 2024?

question.title: Will Apple finalize a union contract with store employees in Colorado by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Apple has finalized and officially signed a collective bargaining contract with the unionized store employees in Colorado. Confirmation must come from official announcements by Apple, the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers' Coalition of Organized Retail Employees, or be reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). The contract must be the first of its kind for Apple in the United States. If no such finalization and signing of the contract occurs by the specified date, or if the contract is still in a tentative or non-finalized state, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Apple complete a labor agreement with its retail workers in Colorado by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if, by July 31, 2024, Apple has successfully completed and officially executed a collective bargaining agreement with the unionized retail workers in Colorado. Verification must be provided through official statements from Apple, the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers' Coalition of Organized Retail Employees, or reported by at least two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). This agreement must be the first of its kind for Apple within the United States. If there is no completion and signing of the agreement by the given date, or if the agreement remains in a tentative or incomplete status, the inquiry will be deemed NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Central Bank of Chile announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024, AND (b) Apple does not finalize a union contract with store employees in Colorado by July 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Chile publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be officially made by the Central Bank of Chile and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the monetary policy rate, which is the Central Bank of Chile's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

(b) This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Apple has not finalized and officially signed a collective bargaining contract with the unionized store employees in Colorado. Confirmation must come from the absence of official announcements by Apple, the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers' Coalition of Organized Retail Employees, or lack of reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If the contract is still in a tentative or non-finalized state by the specified date, the question resolves as YES. If such finalization and signing of the contract occurs by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following events will take place: (a) The Central Bank of Chile will declare a decrease in its main interest rate by August 2024, AND (b) Apple will not complete a union agreement with its store workers in Colorado by July 2024?

The decrease must pertain to the monetary policy rate, which is the primary instrument of the Central Bank of Chile for economic influence. A mere suggestion or speculation regarding future rate decreases does not suffice; there must be a definitive announcement of an actual rate decrease. If no such declaration is made by the specified date, the inquiry resolves as NO.

(b) This inquiry resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Apple has not completed and officially endorsed a collective bargaining agreement with the unionized store workers in Colorado. Verification must come from the lack of official statements by Apple, the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers' Coalition of Organized Retail Employees, or the absence of reports by at least two reputable news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If the agreement remains in a tentative or non-finalized state by the specified date, the inquiry resolves as YES. If such completion and endorsement of the agreement takes place by the specified date, the inquiry resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Russia's Federation Council pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Putin by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia's Federation Council passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Vladimir Putin or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the Federation Council, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Putin or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Russian economy.

If no such bill is passed by the Federation Council by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Brazil's Bovespa index reach or exceed 130,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, Brazil's Bovespa index reaches or exceeds 130,000 points. The 130,000 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or B3 (Brasil Bolsa Balcão). If the index does not reach 130,000 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 130,000 points.

(2) At no point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, does Brazil's Bovespa index reach or exceed 130,000 points. question.title: Will Takeda allow generic production of its gastrointestinal drug by July 2024?
