question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The WHO declares the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa no longer a global emergency by August 2024 (b) Takeda prevents generic production of its gastrointestinal drug by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) By August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer considered a global emergency. For a YES resolution:
   1. The WHO must make a public announcement explicitly stating that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer a global emergency.
   2. This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
   3. The declaration must specifically refer to the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak, not a global Rift Valley fever situation in general.
   The question will resolve as NO if:
   1. The WHO does not make such a declaration by August 31, 2024.
   2. The WHO makes a declaration about Rift Valley fever that does not specifically address the East African outbreak.
   3. The WHO maintains or escalates the emergency status of the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak.
   Note: If the WHO has already declared the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak no longer a global emergency prior to this question's start date, the question will still resolve based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

(b) By July 31, 2024, Takeda does not officially announce or confirm that it will allow generic production of its gastrointestinal drug, effectively continuing to enforce its patent. This could be through not withdrawing its patent, not entering a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that prevents unrestricted generic production. Confirmation of no allowance must come from the absence of official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If such an announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, indicating Takeda will allow generic production, the question resolves as NO.

The question will resolve as NO if either (a) or (b) does not occur.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) The WHO will announce that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer regarded as a global emergency by August 2024, and (b) Takeda will not permit the manufacture of generic versions of its gastrointestinal medication by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of these conditions are fulfilled:

(a) By August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) must publicly state that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer viewed as a global emergency. For a YES outcome:
   1. The WHO needs to make a public declaration explicitly indicating that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer a global emergency.
   2. This announcement must be covered by at least two significant international news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
   3. The statement must specifically mention the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak, rather than a global situation regarding Rift Valley fever.
   The outcome will be NO if:
   1. The WHO fails to issue such a declaration by August 31, 2024.
   2. The WHO makes a statement about Rift Valley fever that does not specifically pertain to the East African outbreak.
   3. The WHO continues or intensifies the emergency declaration concerning the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak.
   Note: If the WHO has previously stated that the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak is no longer a global emergency before the onset of this question, the resolution will still be based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

(b) By July 31, 2024, Takeda does not make any official announcement or confirmation regarding the allowance of generic production of its gastrointestinal drug, thereby maintaining its patent rights. This could involve not retracting its patent, not entering into a voluntary licensing agreement, or any other method that hinders unrestricted generic production. Evidence of no allowance must come from the lack of official announcements from the company, statements from pertinent regulatory authorities, or reports by at least two credible international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If such an announcement or confirmation is made by the deadline, indicating that Takeda will permit generic production, the outcome will be NO.

The resolution will be NO if either (a) or (b) does not take place.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by their respective dates: (a) Takeda allow generic production of its gastrointestinal drug by July 2024? (b) WHO declare the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
question.body:
(a) Takeda allowing generic production of its gastrointestinal drug by July 31, 2024, means that Takeda officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its gastrointestinal drug, effectively not enforcing its patent. This could be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If no such announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, or if Takeda continues to enforce its patent rights, this part resolves as NO.

(b) The WHO declaring the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa no longer a global emergency by August 31, 2024, requires the World Health Organization (WHO) to officially declare that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer considered a global emergency. For a YES resolution:

1. The WHO must make a public announcement explicitly stating that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer a global emergency.
2. This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The declaration must specifically refer to the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak, not a global Rift Valley fever situation in general.

This part will resolve as NO if:
1. The WHO does not make such a declaration by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO makes a declaration about Rift Valley fever that does not specifically address the East African outbreak.
3. The WHO maintains or escalates the emergency status of the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak.

Note: If the WHO has already declared the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak no longer a global emergency prior to this question's start date, the question will still resolve based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that the following will happen by their specified deadlines: (a) Takeda will permit the production of generic versions of its gastrointestinal medication by July 2024? (b) Will the WHO announce that the Rift Valley fever situation in East Africa is no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) For Takeda to permit the creation of generic versions of its gastrointestinal medication by July 31, 2024, it means that Takeda must officially declare or verify that it will allow the production of generics, effectively not enforcing its patent rights. This could occur through a formal withdrawal of the patent, a voluntary licensing agreement, or any other method that permits unrestricted production of generics. Confirmation must come from official statements by the company, announcements from relevant regulatory agencies, or reports from at least two credible international news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or significant national newspapers). If no such declaration or confirmation is made by the deadline, or if Takeda continues to uphold its patent rights, this part will conclude as NO.

(b) For the WHO to state that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer a global emergency by August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) must officially announce that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer deemed a global emergency. For a YES outcome:

1. The WHO must publicly declare that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer classified as a global emergency.
2. This declaration needs to be reported by at least two major international news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The declaration must specifically mention the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak, not a general situation regarding Rift Valley fever globally.

This part will resolve as NO if:
1. The WHO fails to make such a declaration by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO issues a statement regarding Rift Valley fever that does not specifically pertain to the East African outbreak.
3. The WHO either maintains or escalates the emergency status of the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa.

Note: If the WHO has previously declared the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak no longer a global emergency before the start date of this question, the resolution will still depend on the status as of August 31, 2024.

question.title: Will the Australian Government announce conversion of additional vehicles to biofuel by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Australian Government officially announces that additional vehicles, beyond those already known, have been converted or are in the process of being converted to run on biofuel. The announcement must come from official government channels or be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as BBC, Reuters, Associated Press, or The Guardian). The additional vehicles must be part of the government fleet or directly associated with governmental transportation. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is the Australian Government expected to declare the conversion of more vehicles to biofuel by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, there is an official declaration from the Australian Government stating that more vehicles, in addition to those already identified, have been converted or are being converted to operate on biofuel. The declaration must originate from official government sources or be covered by at least two major, credible news organizations (such as BBC, Reuters, Associated Press, or The Guardian). The additional vehicles need to be part of the government fleet or closely linked to governmental transport. If no such declaration occurs by the specified deadline, the response will be NO.

question.title: Will the Swedish Royal Court announce conversion of additional vehicles to biofuel by July 2024 AND will the Australian Government NOT announce conversion of additional vehicles to biofuel by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following occur by July 31, 2024: (1) The Swedish Royal Court officially announces that additional vehicles, beyond those already known, have been converted or are in the process of being converted to run on biofuel. The announcement must come from official channels or be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as BBC, Reuters, Associated Press, or The Guardian). The additional vehicles must be part of the royal fleet or directly associated with royal transportation. (2) The Australian Government does not officially announce that additional vehicles, beyond those already known, have been converted or are in the process of being converted to run on biofuel. The lack of announcement must be such that no official government channels or at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as BBC, Reuters, Associated Press, or The Guardian) report it. The additional vehicles in question must be part of the government fleet or directly associated with governmental transportation. If both conditions are met, the question will resolve as YES. If either condition is not met, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will the Swedish Royal Court declare the conversion of more vehicles to biofuel by July 2024 AND will the Australian Government refrain from announcing the conversion of additional vehicles to biofuel by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if both of the subsequent events occur by July 31, 2024: (1) The Swedish Royal Court formally declares that further vehicles, in addition to those already acknowledged, have been converted or are undergoing conversion to operate on biofuel. This declaration must be made through official channels or reported by at least two prominent, credible news organizations (such as BBC, Reuters, Associated Press, or The Guardian). The additional vehicles must belong to the royal fleet or be directly linked to royal transportation. (2) The Australian Government does not formally declare that further vehicles, beyond those already acknowledged, have been converted or are in the process of being converted to biofuel. The absence of such a declaration must be evident, with no official government channels or at least two major, credible news organizations (such as BBC, Reuters, Associated Press, or The Guardian) reporting it. The vehicles in question must be part of the government fleet or directly related to governmental transportation. If both conditions are satisfied, this inquiry will resolve as affirmative. If either condition is unmet, it will resolve as negative.

question.title: Will either the Australian Government or the Swedish Royal Court announce conversion of additional vehicles to biofuel by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, either of the following occurs: (a) The Australian Government officially announces that additional vehicles, beyond those already known, have been converted or are in the process of being converted to run on biofuel. The announcement must come from official government channels or be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as BBC, Reuters, Associated Press, or The Guardian). The additional vehicles must be part of the government fleet or directly associated with governmental transportation. (b) The Swedish Royal Court officially announces that additional vehicles, beyond those already known, have been converted or are in the process of being converted to run on biofuel. The announcement must come from official channels or be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as BBC, Reuters, Associated Press, or The Guardian). The additional vehicles must be part of the royal fleet or directly associated with royal transportation. If neither announcement is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the Australian Government or the Swedish Royal Court will declare the conversion of more vehicles to biofuel by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, one of the following happens: (a) The Australian Government formally declares that more vehicles, in addition to those already acknowledged, have been converted or are in the process of being converted to operate on biofuel. The declaration must originate from official governmental sources or be reported by at least two major, reputable news organizations (such as BBC, Reuters, Associated Press, or The Guardian). The additional vehicles must belong to the government fleet or be directly linked to governmental transport. (b) The Swedish Royal Court formally declares that more vehicles, in addition to those already acknowledged, have been converted or are in the process of being converted to operate on biofuel. The declaration must come from official sources or be reported by at least two major, reputable news organizations (such as BBC, Reuters, Associated Press, or The Guardian). The additional vehicles must belong to the royal fleet or be directly linked to royal transport. If neither declaration is made by the specified date, the inquiry will be resolved as negative.

question.title: Will Arizona hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Arizona officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must be formally announced by the Arizona state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Arizona-based news outlets). The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in Arizona and focus primarily on abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only pertains to the occurrence of the referendum, not its outcome.

para_P.title: Will Arizona conduct a vote on abortion rights before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, Arizona officially carries out a statewide vote that specifically addresses the inclusion of abortion rights in the state constitution. The vote must be formally declared by the Arizona state authorities and confirmed by at least two prominent news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major news outlets based in Arizona). The vote must be accessible to all qualified voters in Arizona and primarily concentrate on abortion rights. If no such vote takes place or is finalized by the resolution date, or if the vote is canceled or delayed beyond July 31, 2024, the inquiry will conclude with a NO. It is important to note that this question only concerns the occurrence of the vote, not its results.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Wisconsin's near-total abortion ban be declared constitutional by August 2024 and (b) Arizona not hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) By August 31, 2024, a court ruling confirms the constitutionality of Wisconsin's near-total abortion ban. The confirmation must come from a Wisconsin state court and be reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major US newspapers). If the ban is not declared constitutional by the specified date, or if a court rules it unconstitutional, this condition resolves as NO. For the purpose of this condition, a 'near-total abortion ban' refers to the law that was blocked and is pending assessment, as mentioned in the article dated October 1, 2023. (2) By July 31, 2024, Arizona does not officially conduct a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. This includes scenarios where no referendum is formally announced by the Arizona state government, or if it is not verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Arizona-based news outlets). The condition will also resolve as YES if the referendum is not open to all eligible voters in Arizona, does not focus primarily on abortion rights, is canceled, or postponed beyond July 31, 2024. If such a referendum does occur and is completed by the resolution date, this condition will resolve as NO. Note that this condition only pertains to the occurrence of the referendum, not its outcome. The overall question resolves as YES only if both conditions are met.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following events take place: (a) Wisconsin's near-total abortion restriction is deemed constitutional by August 2024 and (b) Arizona refrains from holding a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES answer if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) By August 31, 2024, a judicial decision affirms the constitutionality of Wisconsin's near-total abortion restriction. The affirmation must originate from a Wisconsin state court and be reported by at least two credible national news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major US newspapers). If the restriction is not deemed constitutional by the specified date, or if a court rules it unconstitutional, this criterion resolves as NO. For the purpose of this criterion, a 'near-total abortion restriction' refers to the law that was blocked and is awaiting evaluation, as referenced in the article dated October 1, 2023. (2) By July 31, 2024, Arizona does not officially carry out a statewide referendum specifically regarding the inclusion of abortion rights in the state constitution. This encompasses situations where no referendum is formally declared by the Arizona state government, or if it is not validated by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or prominent Arizona-based news outlets). The criterion will also resolve as YES if the referendum is not accessible to all eligible voters in Arizona, does not primarily address abortion rights, is canceled, or postponed beyond July 31, 2024. If such a referendum occurs and is completed by the resolution date, this criterion will resolve as NO. Note that this criterion solely pertains to the occurrence of the referendum, not its results. The overall inquiry resolves as YES only if both criteria are satisfied.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Arizona holds a referendum on abortion rights, or (b) Wisconsin's near-total abortion ban is declared constitutional?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) By July 31, 2024, Arizona officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must be formally announced by the Arizona state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Arizona-based news outlets). The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in Arizona and focus primarily on abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, this part of the question will resolve as NO. Note that this part only pertains to the occurrence of the referendum, not its outcome. (b) By August 31, 2024, a court ruling confirms the constitutionality of Wisconsin's near-total abortion ban. The confirmation must come from a Wisconsin state court and be reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major US newspapers). If the ban is not declared constitutional by the specified date, or if a court rules it unconstitutional, this part of the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, a 'near-total abortion ban' refers to the law that was blocked and is pending assessment, as mentioned in the article dated October 1, 2023.

para_P.title: Is it possible that by August 2024, one of the following happens: (a) Arizona conducts a referendum on abortion rights, or (b) Wisconsin's almost complete abortion prohibition is upheld as constitutional?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if at least one of the following takes place: (a) By July 31, 2024, Arizona officially carries out a statewide referendum regarding the inclusion of abortion rights in the state constitution. This referendum must be formally declared by the Arizona state government and corroborated by a minimum of two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or significant Arizona-based news outlets). The referendum should be accessible to all eligible voters in Arizona and primarily concentrate on abortion rights. If such a referendum does not take place or is not finalized by the resolution date, or if it is canceled or delayed beyond July 31, 2024, this portion of the inquiry will result in NO. It is important to note that this aspect only concerns the occurrence of the referendum, not its result. (b) By August 31, 2024, a judicial decision affirms the constitutionality of Wisconsin's almost complete abortion prohibition. This confirmation must originate from a Wisconsin state court and be reported by at least two credible national news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major US newspapers). If the prohibition is not upheld as constitutional by the designated date, or if a court rules it unconstitutional, this segment of the question will resolve as NO. For the purposes of this inquiry, a 'near-total abortion ban' refers to the legislation that was halted and is awaiting evaluation, as referenced in the article dated October 1, 2023.

question.title: Will U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 300,000 for three consecutive weeks by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 300,000 for three consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if this condition is not met within the specified timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered.

para_P.title: Will the number of U.S. jobless claims surpass 300,000 for three straight weeks before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if the weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as documented by the U.S. Department of Labor, go beyond 300,000 for three consecutive weeks at any time up until August 31, 2024. It will be considered NO if this situation does not occur within the designated period. For the purpose of resolution, only the official figures published by the U.S. Department of Labor will be taken into account.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) US airline mechanics remain on strike and (b) U.S. weekly jobless claims do not exceed 300,000 for three consecutive weeks?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: (a) Airline mechanics in the United States are still on strike or have not fully resumed normal operations following any current labor dispute. This must be confirmed by official statements from the airlines, the unions representing the mechanics, or the US government, and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as The New York Times, CNN, or Reuters). (b) The number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, does not exceed 300,000 for three consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered for the jobless claims.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will these two events take place: (a) US airline mechanics continue their strike and (b) U.S. weekly unemployment claims remain below 300,000 for three straight weeks?
para_P.body: This inquiry is answered with a YES if both of the following criteria are fulfilled by August 31, 2024: (a) Mechanics working for airlines in the United States are still engaged in a strike or have not completely returned to standard operations after any ongoing labor conflict. This must be verified through official announcements from the airlines, the unions that represent the mechanics, or the US government, and covered by at least two credible news outlets (like The New York Times, CNN, or Reuters). (b) The weekly initial unemployment claims in the United States, as documented by the U.S. Department of Labor, do not surpass 300,000 for three consecutive weeks at any time from now until August 31, 2024. If either of these conditions fails to be met, the answer will be NO. For the purpose of resolution, only official statistics released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be taken into account regarding jobless claims.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by August 2024: (a) U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 300,000 for three consecutive weeks, or (b) US airline mechanics remain on strike?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following conditions is met: (a) The number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 300,000 for three consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. Official data from the U.S. Department of Labor will be used for this determination. (b) By August 31, 2024, airline mechanics in the United States are still on strike or have not fully resumed normal operations following any current labor dispute. This must be confirmed by official statements from the airlines, the unions representing the mechanics, or the US government, and reported by at least two reputable news sources such as The New York Times, CNN, or Reuters. The question resolves as NO if neither condition is met by the specified date.

para_P.title: Is it possible that by August 2024, either (a) the weekly jobless claims in the U.S. surpass 300,000 for three straight weeks, or (b) the mechanics for U.S. airlines continue their strike?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if at least one of the following scenarios occurs: (a) The weekly initial claims for unemployment benefits in the United States, as documented by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceed 300,000 for three consecutive weeks at any time before August 31, 2024. The determination will be based on official statistics from the U.S. Department of Labor. (b) By August 31, 2024, airline mechanics in the U.S. are either still on strike or have not completely returned to normal operations following any existing labor conflict. This must be verified by official announcements from the airlines, the unions representing the mechanics, or the U.S. government, and reported by at least two credible news outlets such as The New York Times, CNN, or Reuters. The question will be answered with a NO if neither scenario occurs by the given date.

question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India officially announces a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of India or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual RBI members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it expected that the Reserve Bank of India will declare a reduction in interest rates by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered in the affirmative if the Reserve Bank of India makes a formal announcement regarding a reduction in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be validated through official communications from the Reserve Bank of India or reported by at least two prominent financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate reduction must be an official decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and conveyed in their formal statement or press conference after a meeting. Any conjecture about potential future rate reductions or unofficial remarks from individual RBI members will not be considered for resolution. If no such official declaration of an interest rate reduction occurs by the resolution date, the inquiry will be answered negatively.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Central Bank of Singapore announces a new exchange rate policy by August 2024 and (b) The Reserve Bank of India does not announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) By August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Singapore officially announces a new exchange rate policy. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of Singapore communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of Singapore. The announcement should explicitly describe the new exchange rate policy. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. (2) The Reserve Bank of India does not officially announce a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The absence of an announcement must be confirmed by the lack of official statements from the Reserve Bank of India and not reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC) regarding an interest rate cut. If both conditions are satisfied, the question resolves as YES. If either condition is not satisfied, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that: (a) The Central Bank of Singapore will declare a new exchange rate policy by August 2024 and (b) The Reserve Bank of India will refrain from announcing a reduction in interest rates by July 2024?
para_P.body: This question is answered with a YES if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (1) By August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Singapore makes an official declaration of a new exchange rate policy. This declaration must originate from an official communication channel of the Central Bank of Singapore, such as a press release or a public address by the Governor of the Central Bank of Singapore. The declaration should clearly outline the new exchange rate policy and must be reported by at least two major financial news organizations (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be deemed valid. (2) The Reserve Bank of India does not make an official announcement regarding a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The lack of such an announcement must be verified by the absence of official statements from the Reserve Bank of India and must not be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC) concerning an interest rate cut. If both criteria are met, the question is answered with YES. If either criterion is not met, the question is answered with NO.

question.title: Will either the Reserve Bank of India announce an interest rate cut by July 2024 or the Central Bank of Singapore announce a new exchange rate policy by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if at least one of the following occurs: (a) The Reserve Bank of India officially announces a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of India or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. (b) The Central Bank of Singapore officially announces a new exchange rate policy by August 31, 2024. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of Singapore communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of Singapore. The announcement should explicitly describe the new exchange rate policy and must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times). If neither of these announcements is made by their respective dates, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the Reserve Bank of India will declare a reduction in interest rates by July 2024, or that the Central Bank of Singapore will introduce a new exchange rate policy by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if at least one of the following occurs: (a) The Reserve Bank of India makes an official announcement regarding a reduction in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. This announcement must be validated through official communications from the Reserve Bank of India or reported by a minimum of two prominent financial news organizations (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate reduction must be a formal resolution made by the Monetary Policy Committee and conveyed in their official statement or press conference after a meeting. (b) The Central Bank of Singapore publicly announces a new exchange rate policy by August 31, 2024. This announcement must originate from an official communication channel of the Central Bank of Singapore, such as a press release or a public address by the Governor of the Central Bank of Singapore. The announcement should clearly outline the new exchange rate policy and must be covered by at least two major financial news platforms (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times). If neither of these announcements occurs by their respective deadlines, the question will be answered with NO.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Russia's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Russia's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Central Bank of Russia or a relevant Russian government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, TASS). If no such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will the preferred inflation metric of the Central Bank of Russia record a monthly rise surpassing 0.5%?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if the favored inflation metric of the Central Bank of Russia indicates a month-to-month increase that exceeds 0.5% in any month from October 2023 through July 31, 2024. question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Elvira Nabiullina remains as Governor of the Central Bank of Russia through July 2024 and (b) the Central Bank of Russia's preferred inflation measure does not show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body:
(a) Elvira Nabiullina will remain as Governor of the Central Bank of Russia through July 31, 2024. This will be confirmed if she is still serving in this capacity on July 31, 2024, as verified by official announcements from the Central Bank of Russia or reports from at least two major news outlets such as Reuters, CNBC, The Wall Street Journal, or Bloomberg. If she is no longer in the position for any reason (including resignation, removal, or end of term), the question resolves as NO. Interim or acting Governor appointments will not count as her remaining in the position.

(b) The Central Bank of Russia's preferred inflation measure will not report a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any month from October 2023 to July 31, 2024. This must be verified by official publications from the Central Bank of Russia or a relevant Russian government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources like Bloomberg, Reuters, or TASS. The focus is on month-over-month changes, not year-over-year or other time frames.

The combined question resolves as YES only if both (a) and (b) are satisfied.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Elvira Nabiullina continues as the Governor of the Central Bank of Russia until July 2024 and (b) the Central Bank of Russia's main inflation indicator does not display a monthly rise greater than 0.5% by July 2024?

(b) The main inflation measure of the Central Bank of Russia will not indicate a month-over-month increase exceeding 0.5% in any month from October 2023 to July 31, 2024. This must be confirmed by official releases from the Central Bank of Russia or a relevant Russian governmental body and reported by at least two credible financial news outlets like Bloomberg, Reuters, or TASS. The emphasis is on month-over-month variations, not year-over-year or other durations.

The overall question will be answered as YES only if both (a) and (b) are fulfilled.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Nigeria announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Nigeria officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Central Bank of Nigeria communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the monetary policy rate, which is the Central Bank of Nigeria's primary tool for monetary policy.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the Central Bank of Nigeria will declare a reduction in interest rates before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered TRUE if the Central Bank of Nigeria makes an official declaration regarding a reduction in interest rates to take effect no later than August 31, 2024. The declaration must be validated through official communications from the Central Bank of Nigeria, including but not limited to press releases, statements from the Monetary Policy Committee, or public addresses by Bank representatives. If such a declaration is not made by the specified resolution date, the inquiry will be deemed FALSE. It is important to note that the actual date when the rate reduction takes effect may be after August 31, 2024, provided that the announcement itself is made by that date. The interest rate in question pertains to the monetary policy rate, which serves as the Central Bank of Nigeria's main instrument for monetary policy.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (1) The European Central Bank announces an interest rate cut, and (2) The Central Bank of Nigeria does not announce an interest rate cut?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: (1) The European Central Bank officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect, with the announcement confirmed by official ECB communications such as press releases, Governing Council statements, or public speeches by ECB officials. The interest rate in question refers to the main refinancing operations rate. (2) The Central Bank of Nigeria does not officially announce an interest rate cut, with confirmation from official Central Bank of Nigeria communications such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. The interest rate in question refers to the monetary policy rate. If both conditions are not met, the question resolves as NO.

The interest rate in question pertains to the primary refinancing operations rate. (2) The Central Bank of Nigeria does not formally declare a reduction in interest rates, with verification from official Central Bank of Nigeria communications such as press releases, statements from the Monetary Policy Committee, or public addresses by Bank representatives. The interest rate in question pertains to the monetary policy rate. If both criteria are not satisfied, the inquiry resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either the Central Bank of Nigeria or the European Central Bank announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) The Central Bank of Nigeria officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Central Bank of Nigeria communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. The interest rate in question refers to the monetary policy rate, which is the Central Bank of Nigeria's primary tool for monetary policy. (b) The European Central Bank officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The interest rate in question refers to the main refinancing operations rate, which is the ECB's primary tool for monetary policy. If neither announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that for both cases, the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date.

para_P.title: Will the Central Bank of Nigeria or the European Central Bank declare a reduction in interest rates by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if at least one of the following takes place: (a) The Central Bank of Nigeria formally declares a reduction in interest rates to be effective by August 31, 2024. This declaration must be validated by official communications from the Central Bank of Nigeria, such as press releases, statements from the Monetary Policy Committee, or public addresses by Bank officials. The interest rate in question pertains to the monetary policy rate, which is the Central Bank of Nigeria's key instrument for monetary policy. This announcement must be corroborated by official ECB communications, including press releases, statements from the Governing Council, or public speeches by ECB officials. If neither of these announcements is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. It is important to note that for both scenarios, the actual date of implementation of the rate cut may occur after August 31, 2024, provided that the announcement itself is made by that date.

question.title: Will France's weekly jobless claims exceed 200,000 for three consecutive weeks by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in France, as reported by the French National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies, exceeds 200,000 for three consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if this condition is not met within the specified timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the French National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies will be considered.

para_P.title: Will the number of weekly unemployment claims in France surpass 200,000 for a period of three consecutive weeks before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if the weekly initial unemployment claims in France, as documented by the French National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies, go beyond 200,000 for three straight weeks at any time from now until August 31, 2024. It will be answered with a NO if this scenario does not occur within the given timeframe. For the purpose of resolution, only the official statistics published by the French National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies will be taken into account.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) the Bank of England announces an interest rate cut by July 2024 and (b) France's weekly jobless claims never exceed 200,000 for three consecutive weeks by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The Bank of England officially announces a decrease in its bank rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Bank of England or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual BoE members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. (b) The number of weekly initial jobless claims in France, as reported by the French National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies, never exceeds 200,000 for three consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if this condition is met within the specified timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the French National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies will be considered. If both conditions are met, the question resolves as YES; if either condition is not met, it resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that: (a) the Bank of England makes a declaration of an interest rate reduction by July 2024 and (b) France's weekly unemployment claims remain below 200,000 for three straight weeks by August 2024?

question.title: Will Tesla announce additional layoffs beyond the initially reported 6% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Tesla officially announces further layoffs beyond the initially reported 6% of its workforce by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official company statements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The additional layoffs must be clearly separate from and in addition to the initially reported 6% workforce reduction. If no such additional layoffs are announced by the specified date, or if Tesla only provides updates or clarifications about the initially reported 6% reduction without announcing new cuts, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will there be further layoffs at Tesla beyond the initially disclosed 6% by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed TRUE if Tesla makes an official declaration of more layoffs exceeding the initially disclosed 6% of its workforce by August 31, 2024. The confirmation must come from official company announcements or reports from at least two credible news outlets (like Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The new layoffs must be distinctly separate from the previously reported 6% workforce cut. If no additional layoffs are communicated by the given date, or if Tesla only shares updates or clarifications regarding the initially reported 6% reduction without announcing any new layoffs, the inquiry will be considered FALSE.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) General Motors resolves a major workers' strike by July 2024 (b) Tesla refrains from announcing additional layoffs beyond the initially reported 6% by August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following occur: 

1. General Motors reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:
   - The strike must involve a substantial number of General Motors workers (at least 1,000 participants).
   - The strike must last for at least one week.
   - The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both General Motors and the involved union.
   - The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).
   - If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, this part resolves as NO.

2. Tesla does not officially announce further layoffs beyond the initially reported 6% of its workforce by August 31, 2024. If Tesla only provides updates or clarifications about the initially reported 6% reduction without announcing new cuts, or if no such additional layoffs are announced by the specified date, this part resolves as YES. The announcement must be confirmed through official company statements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal) for this part to resolve as YES.

The combined question resolves as YES only if both conditions are met as described.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) General Motors successfully ends a significant workers' strike by July 2024 (b) Tesla does not make any further announcements regarding layoffs beyond the initially stated 6% by August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with YES if both of the following conditions are satisfied: 

1. General Motors successfully negotiates with union workers, leading to the conclusion of a major strike by July 31, 2024. For this to be validated:
   - The strike must involve a considerable number of General Motors employees (at least 1,000 participants).
   - The strike must continue for a minimum of one week.
   - The resolution must be verified by official communications from both General Motors and the relevant union.
   - The resolution must be reported by no fewer than two credible international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).
   - If such a resolution, meeting all these stipulations, is not achieved by the specified date, or if no major strike occurs, this part will resolve as NO.

2. Tesla does not officially declare any additional workforce reductions beyond the initially reported 6% by August 31, 2024. If Tesla merely updates or clarifies the originally reported 6% cut without announcing new layoffs, or if no such additional layoffs are declared by the specified date, this part will resolve as YES. The announcement must be validated through official company communications or reports from at least two reliable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal) for this part to be considered YES.

The overall question will resolve as YES only if both conditions are fulfilled as outlined.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The average rate on a 30-year mortgage in the US falls below 6.2% by August 2024 (b) LG Electronics fails to resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) By August 31, 2024, the average rate on a 30-year fixed-rate mortgage in the United States, as reported by Freddie Mac in their Primary Mortgage Market Survey, falls below 6.2% at any point. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. If the rate does not fall below 6.2% by the specified date, or if Freddie Mac discontinues reporting this metric, this part of the question will resolve as NO. For clarity, a rate of exactly 6.2% will not be considered as falling below 6.2%.

(b) LG Electronics does not reach an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the continuation of a significant strike beyond July 31, 2024, or if no significant strike occurs at all. For the resolution to be considered valid:
1. The strike must involve a substantial number of LG Electronics workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The lack of resolution must be confirmed by the absence of official statements from both LG Electronics and the involved union regarding an agreement.
4. The continuation or absence of a strike must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If both conditions (a) and (b) are met, the question resolves as YES. If either or both conditions are not met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Indiana hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Indiana officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must be formally announced by the Indiana state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Indiana-based news outlets). The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in Indiana and focus primarily on abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only pertains to the occurrence of the referendum, not its outcome.

para_P.title: Is there a plan for Indiana to conduct a vote on abortion rights before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by July 31, 2024, Indiana officially carries out a statewide vote regarding the inclusion of abortion rights in the state constitution. question.title: Will Texas hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Texas officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on abortion rights. The referendum must be a statewide vote, officially organized by the state government, and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. The referendum topic must directly address abortion rights, either proposing to enshrine protections or to restrict/ban abortion. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on abortion does not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue. If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Russia report a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia reports a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley, characterized by yields meeting or exceeding the average of the past five years. The success must be confirmed by official agricultural statistics from the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Economic Times). For this question, 'successful' is defined as the combined production of wheat and barley being at least 5% above the five-year average. If the winter crop season does not meet these criteria, or if insufficient data is available to make a determination, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Russia announce a prosperous winter harvest for wheat and barley by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia announces a prosperous winter harvest for wheat and barley, defined by yields that are at least equal to or greater than the average of the last five years. For the purpose of this question, 'prosperous' means that the total output of wheat and barley is at least 5% higher than the five-year average. If the winter harvest does not fulfill these requirements, or if there is inadequate information available to reach a conclusion, the question will resolve as NO.

The announcement must clearly indicate an intention to construct additional reactors beyond the two already planned, not just expansions or modifications to the existing plans. (b) By August 31, 2024, Russia does not report a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley, characterized by yields not meeting or exceeding the average of the past five years. The lack of success must be confirmed by official agricultural statistics from the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or the absence of confirmation from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Economic Times). For this condition, 'not successful' is defined as the combined production of wheat and barley being less than 5% above the five-year average. If both conditions are not met, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) A major hospital system in France cancels over €250 million in medical debt by August 2024 (b) The United Nations Development Programme does not announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: 

(a) By August 31, 2024, a hospital system based in France, in collaboration with a nonprofit organization, successfully cancels more than €250 million in medical debt for at least 150,000 patients across multiple regions. The cancellation must be officially announced by the hospital system or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Le Monde, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The debt cancellation should target patients who are considered financially needy or unable to pay. If the debt cancellation is not completed or officially confirmed by the specified date, or if the amount cancelled is €250 million or less, this condition is not met.

(b) By July 31, 2024, the United Nations Development Programme does not officially announce new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. If no announcement is made, or if the total of new funding commitments does not exceed $400 million, this condition is met. The announcement(s) must be made through official UNDP channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments.

Both conditions (a) and (b) must be satisfied for this question to resolve as YES. If either condition is not satisfied, the question resolves as NO.

The funding commitments must be new projects or significant expansions of existing initiatives, not continuations of previously announced commitments.

question.title: Will Google lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Google has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Google confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution.

para_P.title: Will Google terminate a minimum of 1,800 staff members by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered TRUE if, by July 31, 2024, Google has officially acknowledged the termination of no fewer than 1,800 staff members as part of its reorganization strategy focused on AI. Confirmation must be derived from official company statements, regulatory documents, or coverage by at least two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The terminations must be directly associated with the AI-oriented restructuring plan revealed in 2023. If Google announces a lesser number of terminations, or if no confirmation that meets these requirements is provided by the resolution date, the inquiry will be deemed FALSE. Partial terminations or staged processes that do not achieve the 1,800 employee minimum by the resolution date will also lead to a FALSE resolution.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The South African Reserve Bank announces an interest rate cut, and (b) Google lays off fewer than 1,800 employees?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) The South African Reserve Bank officially announces a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the South African Reserve Bank or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual SARB members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. (b) Google has confirmed the layoff of fewer than 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan, or if no such confirmation meeting the original criteria is made by the resolution date. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Google confirms the layoff of at least 1,800 employees, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will result in a YES resolution. If both conditions (a) and (b) are met, the question resolves as YES; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of the subsequent criteria are fulfilled by July 31, 2024: (a) The South African Reserve Bank formally announces a cut in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. (b) Google has officially confirmed the termination of fewer than 1,800 positions as part of its AI-oriented restructuring plan, or if such confirmation that meets the original criteria is not provided by the resolution date. Confirmation must originate from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two credible news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). Partial layoffs or gradual implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee count by the resolution date will lead to a YES resolution. If both conditions (a) and (b) are satisfied, the question resolves as YES; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Shanghai Composite index reach or exceed 4,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the Shanghai Composite index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points. The 4,000 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Shanghai Stock Exchange. If the index does not reach 4,000 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,000 points.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the Shanghai Composite index to hit or surpass 4,000 points by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, at any time from October 1, 2023 to August 31, 2024, the Shanghai Composite index hits or surpasses 4,000 points. The 4,000 point threshold is selected as a significant benchmark that the index may have reached prior to a major decline. Confirmation will rely on official index data from trusted financial market information sources like Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Shanghai Stock Exchange. If the index fails to reach 4,000 points during this timeframe, the answer will be NO. Please note that intraday peaks are considered for resolution; the index does not have to close at or above 4,000 points.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Bank of Korea announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024, and (b) The Shanghai Composite index fails to reach 4,000 points by August 2024?

(a) This component will resolve as YES if the Bank of Korea publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be officially made by the Bank of Korea and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the base rate, which is the Bank of Korea's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, this component resolves as NO.

(b) This component will resolve as YES if, at no point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the Shanghai Composite index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points. The 4,000 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Shanghai Stock Exchange. If the index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points during this period, this component resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,000 points.

For the combined question to resolve as YES, both (a) and (b) must resolve as YES.

question.title: Will Pennsylvania receive over $300 million in federal grants for electric vehicle projects by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of Pennsylvania is confirmed to have been awarded more than $300 million in federal grants specifically for electric vehicle manufacturing, assembly, or related projects. Confirmation must come from official U.S. government sources (such as the Department of Energy or the White House) or be reported by at least two major national news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The grants must be explicitly designated for electric vehicle-related initiatives within Pennsylvania. If the total amount of such grants awarded to Pennsylvania does not exceed $300 million by the specified date, or if there is insufficient evidence to confirm such an award, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is it expected that Pennsylvania will obtain more than $300 million in federal funding for electric vehicle initiatives by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, it is verified that the state of Pennsylvania has received in excess of $300 million in federal funding specifically allocated for electric vehicle manufacturing, assembly, or associated projects. The funding must be distinctly earmarked for electric vehicle-related efforts within Pennsylvania. question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. resolves a major workers' strike and (b) Pennsylvania does not receive over $300 million in federal grants for electric vehicle projects?
question.body:
(a) Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. resolves a major workers' strike: This question resolves as YES if Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

(b) Pennsylvania does not receive over $300 million in federal grants for electric vehicle projects: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of Pennsylvania is confirmed to have been awarded $300 million or less in federal grants specifically for electric vehicle manufacturing, assembly, or related projects, or if there is insufficient evidence to confirm such an award. Confirmation must come from official U.S. government sources (such as the Department of Energy or the White House) or be reported by at least two major national news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The grants must be explicitly designated for electric vehicle-related initiatives within Pennsylvania. If the total amount of such grants awarded to Pennsylvania exceeds $300 million by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

(b) Pennsylvania will not be granted over $300 million in federal funding for electric vehicle initiatives: This question will be marked as YES if, by July 31, 2024, it is confirmed that Pennsylvania has received $300 million or less in federal funding specifically for electric vehicle manufacturing, assembly, or related projects, or if there is a lack of sufficient evidence to confirm such funding. Confirmation must come from official U.S. government entities (such as the Department of Energy or the White House) or be reported by at least two major national news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding must be explicitly allocated for electric vehicle-related projects in Pennsylvania. If the total amount of funding awarded to Pennsylvania surpasses $300 million by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will 'Kingsman: The Blue Blood' be the highest-grossing R-rated movie by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if 'Kingsman: The Blue Blood' remains the highest-grossing R-rated movie worldwide, not accounting for inflation, as of August 31, 2024. The ranking must be based on total box office earnings reported by at least two reputable sources such as Box Office Mojo, Variety, or The Hollywood Reporter. If any other R-rated movie surpasses its earnings by this date, or if 'Kingsman: The Blue Blood' loses its top position at any point before the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, only theatrical releases are considered, excluding any streaming or VOD revenues.

para_P.title: Will 'Kingsman: The Blue Blood' hold the title of the highest-grossing R-rated film by the end of August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if 'Kingsman: The Blue Blood' is still recognized as the highest-grossing R-rated film globally, excluding inflation, by August 31, 2024. question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The UK economy avoids a recession by July 2024 (b) 'Kingsman: The Blue Blood' is not the highest-grossing R-rated movie by August 2024?
question.body:
(a) The UK economy avoids a recession by July 31, 2024, meaning it does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024, as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics.

(b) 'Kingsman: The Blue Blood' is not the highest-grossing R-rated movie worldwide, not accounting for inflation, by August 31, 2024. This is based on total box office earnings reported by at least two reputable sources such as Box Office Mojo, Variety, or The Hollywood Reporter. The movie must not surpass other R-rated movies' earnings or lose its top position at any point before August 31, 2024. Only theatrical releases are considered, excluding streaming or VOD revenues.

para_P.body:
(a) The UK economy will not fall into a recession by July 31, 2024, which means it will not record two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024, as indicated by the UK's Office for National Statistics.

(b) 'Kingsman: The Blue Blood' will not rank as the highest-grossing R-rated film globally, excluding inflation, by August 31, 2024.
