The film must not exceed the earnings of other R-rated films or relinquish its leading position at any time prior to August 31, 2024. Only theatrical releases are taken into account, with streaming or VOD revenues disregarded.

question.title: Will either 'Kingsman: The Blue Blood' be the highest-grossing R-rated movie by August 2024, or will the UK economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) 'Kingsman: The Blue Blood' remains the highest-grossing R-rated movie worldwide, not accounting for inflation, as of August 31, 2024. The ranking must be based on total box office earnings reported by at least two reputable sources such as Box Office Mojo, Variety, or The Hollywood Reporter. If any other R-rated movie surpasses its earnings by this date, or if 'Kingsman: The Blue Blood' loses its top position at any point before the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, only theatrical releases are considered, excluding any streaming or VOD revenues. (b) The UK economy does not enter a recession by July 31, 2024. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the UK economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will either 'Kingsman: The Blue Blood' hold the title of the highest-grossing R-rated film, or will the UK economy successfully evade a recession by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if at least one of the following conditions is met: (a) 'Kingsman: The Blue Blood' continues to be the highest-grossing R-rated film globally, not adjusted for inflation, as of August 31, 2024. The ranking must rely on total box office revenue as reported by a minimum of two credible sources such as Box Office Mojo, Variety, or The Hollywood Reporter. Should any other R-rated film exceed its earnings by this date, or if 'Kingsman: The Blue Blood' loses its leading position at any time before the resolution date, the answer will be NO. For this question, only theatrical releases are taken into account, excluding any revenues from streaming or VOD. (b) The UK economy does not fall into a recession by July 31, 2024. For this question, a recession is characterized as two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. The answer will be NO if the UK economy faces two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will Oregon receive over $300 million in federal grants for electric vehicle projects by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of Oregon is confirmed to have been awarded more than $300 million in federal grants specifically for electric vehicle manufacturing, assembly, or related projects. Confirmation must come from official U.S. government sources (such as the Department of Energy or the White House) or be reported by at least two major national news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The grants must be explicitly designated for electric vehicle-related initiatives within Oregon. If the total amount of such grants awarded to Oregon does not exceed $300 million by the specified date, or if there is insufficient evidence to confirm such an award, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is it expected that Oregon will obtain more than $300 million in federal funding for electric vehicle initiatives by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, it is verified that the state of Oregon has received in excess of $300 million in federal funding specifically allocated for electric vehicle production, assembly, or associated projects. Verification must be sourced from official U.S. government entities (such as the Department of Energy or the White House) or reported by at least two prominent national news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding must be clearly earmarked for electric vehicle-related efforts within Oregon. If the cumulative amount of such funding granted to Oregon does not surpass $300 million by the designated date, or if there is inadequate evidence to substantiate such a grant, the inquiry will conclude with a NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Netflix announces plans to increase its AI-related workforce, and (b) Oregon does not receive over $300 million in federal grants for electric vehicle projects?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) Netflix publicly announces plans to increase its AI-related workforce. The announcement must be made through official company channels (such as press releases, investor relations statements, or official social media accounts) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, Wall Street Journal). The increase in AI-related workforce must be explicitly stated and not inferred from general hiring plans. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if Netflix only announces maintaining or decreasing its AI-related workforce, this part resolves as NO. (b) The state of Oregon is not confirmed to have been awarded more than $300 million in federal grants specifically for electric vehicle manufacturing, assembly, or related projects. Confirmation must not come from official U.S. government sources (such as the Department of Energy or the White House) or be reported by at least two major national news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The grants must not be explicitly designated for electric vehicle-related initiatives within Oregon. If the total amount of such grants awarded to Oregon does exceed $300 million by the specified date, or if there is sufficient evidence to confirm such an award, this part resolves as NO. If both conditions are satisfied, the question resolves as YES; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris announce her running mate at a rally in New York City by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris publicly announces her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in New York City, New York. The announcement must be made by Harris herself during the rally and must clearly identify the individual chosen as her running mate. The event and announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally. If Harris does not make such an announcement at a New York City rally by the end of August 2024, or if the announcement is made through other means or at a different location, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will Vice President Kamala Harris reveal her choice for a running mate at a New York City rally before the end of August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if, by August 31, 2024, Kamala Harris publicly discloses her selection for the upcoming election's running mate during a rally taking place in New York City, New York. The announcement must come directly from Harris at the rally and must clearly specify the person chosen as her running mate. Additionally, the event and the announcement need to be verified by at least two credible national news outlets (like Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours following the rally. If Harris fails to make such a declaration at a New York City rally by the end of August 2024, or if the announcement occurs through other channels or at a different venue, the inquiry will be marked as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Maryland holds a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024, and (b) Kamala Harris does not announce her running mate at a rally in New York City by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: 

(a) By July 31, 2024, Maryland officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must be formally announced by the Maryland state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Maryland-based news outlets). The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in Maryland and focus primarily on abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, this part of the question will resolve as NO.

(b) By August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris does not publicly announce her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in New York City, New York. This includes scenarios where the announcement is not made by Harris herself during the rally, does not clearly identify the individual chosen as her running mate, or the event and announcement are not confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally. If Harris makes such an announcement at a New York City rally by the end of August 2024, this part of the question will resolve as NO.

The overall question will resolve as YES only if both (a) and (b) resolve as YES.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Maryland will conduct a referendum regarding abortion rights by July 2024, and (b) Kamala Harris will refrain from revealing her running mate at a rally in New York City before August 2024?

The referendum should be available to all eligible voters in Maryland and predominantly address abortion rights. If such a referendum does not take place or is not finalized by the resolution date, or if it is canceled or delayed past July 31, 2024, this segment will resolve as NO.

(b) By August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris does not make a public declaration of her running mate for the forthcoming election during a rally in New York City, New York. This includes situations where the announcement is not delivered by Harris herself at the rally, does not distinctly name the selected individual as her running mate, or the event and announcement are not verified by at least two credible national news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours following the rally. If Harris announces her running mate at a New York City rally by the end of August 2024, this part will resolve as NO.

The overall inquiry will be considered YES only if both (a) and (b) result in YES.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Brazil announce a new inflation target by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Brazil officially announces a new inflation target. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of Brazil communication channel, such as a press release, monetary policy statement, or a public speech by the President of the Central Bank of Brazil. The announcement should explicitly state the new inflation target. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of Brazil maintains the current inflation target, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it expected that the Central Bank of Brazil will set a new inflation target before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Brazil formally declares a new inflation target. The declaration must originate from an official communication channel of the Central Bank of Brazil, such as a press release, monetary policy statement, or a public address by the President of the Central Bank of Brazil. The statement should clearly indicate the new inflation target. Additionally, the announcement must be covered by at least two major financial news organizations (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be deemed valid. If no such declaration is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of Brazil continues with the existing inflation target, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will the Global Fund announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024 and will the Central Bank of Brazil not announce a new inflation target by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following occur: (1) By July 31, 2024, the Global Fund officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official Global Fund channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. (2) By August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Brazil does not officially announce a new inflation target. If no announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of Brazil maintains the current inflation target, the question resolves as YES. The question resolves as NO if the Central Bank of Brazil officially announces a new inflation target by the specified date. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of Brazil communication channel, such as a press release, monetary policy statement, or a public speech by the President of the Central Bank of Brazil, and must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets to be considered valid. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

If neither (a) nor (b) occurs by their respective deadlines, the question is answered with NO.

question.title: Will Universal Studios Hollywood workers approve a new labor agreement by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the workers at Universal Studios Hollywood represented by the unions involved in recent negotiations approve a new labor agreement with Universal. The approval must be confirmed by official union announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The agreement in question must be related to the negotiations mentioned in recent news about avoiding a potential strike. If no such approval is confirmed by the resolution date, or if the agreement is rejected, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the employees at Universal Studios Hollywood consent to a new labor contract by the end of July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if, by July 31, 2024, the employees at Universal Studios Hollywood, who are represented by the unions engaged in the latest negotiations, give their consent to a new labor contract with Universal. The consent must be validated by official announcements from the unions or reports from at least two credible news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The contract in question must pertain to the discussions highlighted in recent news concerning the prevention of a possible strike. If such consent is not confirmed by the resolution date, or if the contract is rejected, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Central Bank of the Philippines announces an interest rate cut by August 2024, and (b) Universal Studios Hollywood workers do not approve a new labor agreement by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The Central Bank of the Philippines officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas communications, such as press releases, Monetary Board statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the overnight reverse repurchase rate, which is the Central Bank of the Philippines' primary tool for monetary policy. (b) By July 31, 2024, the workers at Universal Studios Hollywood represented by the unions involved in recent negotiations do not approve a new labor agreement with Universal. The lack of approval must be confirmed by the absence of official union announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers) confirming the approval. The agreement in question must be related to the negotiations mentioned in recent news about avoiding a potential strike. If either condition is not met, this question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Facebook implement court-ordered changes to its advertising policies by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Facebook implements any changes to its advertising policies as a result of a federal court ruling related to antitrust concerns. The implementation must be confirmed by official announcements from Facebook, court documents, or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). Changes may include, but are not limited to, modifications in ad targeting, pricing models, or advertiser agreements. If no such changes are implemented and confirmed by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not consider any appeals or stay orders that might delay the implementation of changes.

para_P.title: Will Facebook make court-mandated adjustments to its advertising policies by the end of August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, Facebook makes any adjustments to its advertising policies due to a federal court decision concerning antitrust issues. The changes must be verified by official statements from Facebook, legal documents, or coverage by at least two prominent news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). Adjustments may encompass, but are not limited to, alterations in ad targeting, pricing structures, or agreements with advertisers. If no such adjustments are made and verified by the resolution date, the inquiry will be answered with a NO. It is important to note that this question does not take into account any appeals or stay orders that could postpone the implementation of adjustments.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) New York conducts a referendum on abortion rights and (b) Facebook does not implement court-ordered changes to its advertising policies?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024:

1. New York conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights. For a YES resolution on this part, the following criteria must be met:
   - The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of New York.
   - The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
   - The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.
   - The referendum must occur by August 31, 2024.
   - Merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

2. Facebook does not implement any changes to its advertising policies as a result of a federal court ruling related to antitrust concerns. For a YES resolution on this part, the following criteria must be met:
   - No changes to Facebook's advertising policies are implemented by August 31, 2024.
   - The lack of implementation must be confirmed by the absence of official announcements from Facebook, court documents, or reports by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times).
   - This question does not consider any appeals or stay orders that might delay the implementation of changes.

If both of these conditions are met by the specified date, the question resolves as YES. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) a referendum regarding abortion rights is held in New York and (b) Facebook refrains from making court-mandated alterations to its advertising policies?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of the subsequent conditions are satisfied by August 31, 2024:

1. A public referendum in New York is conducted with a specific emphasis on safeguarding abortion rights. For a YES outcome regarding this aspect, the following requirements must be fulfilled:
   - The referendum should be officially announced and carried out by the state of New York.
   - The main focus of the referendum must be on the protection of abortion rights.
   - The results of the referendum must be reported publicly by official state channels or widely recognized news organizations.
   - The referendum should take place by August 31, 2024.
   - Simply proposing or planning a referendum without its actual execution by the specified date will not qualify for a YES outcome.

2. Facebook must not execute any modifications to its advertising policies stemming from a federal court ruling concerning antitrust issues. For a YES resolution on this matter, the following conditions must be met:

   - An official statement on Hillshire Farm's website or social media platforms

   - An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) that specifically mentions a Hillshire Farm recall
   - Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

If no recall that explicitly cites listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal is announced by the designated date, the question will resolve to YES.

The question will resolve to NO if either of the criteria is not fulfilled.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Hillshire Farm issue a recall of sausage products due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024 (b) The FDA issue a recall for ground ginger products due to lead contamination by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs:

(a) By August 31, 2024, Hillshire Farm officially announces a recall of any of its sausage products due to a listeria outbreak. This recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources: an official announcement on Hillshire Farm's website or social media channels, a press release from Hillshire Farm, an announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Hillshire Farm recall, or reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources. The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, this part resolves as NO.

(b) By July 31, 2024, the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) officially issues a recall for any ground ginger products due to lead contamination. This recall must be confirmed through official FDA announcements or reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Washington Post). A recall is defined as a formal request by the FDA for manufacturers to remove their products from the market. Warnings or alerts without an official recall do not qualify for a YES resolution. If no such recall is issued by the resolution date, this part resolves as NO.

The overall question resolves as YES if either (a) or (b) resolves as YES.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either (a) Hillshire Farm will announce a recall of sausage products due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024, or (b) the FDA will recall ground ginger products because of lead contamination by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if at least one of the following happens:

(a) By August 31, 2024, Hillshire Farm makes an official statement regarding the recall of any of its sausage products due to a listeria outbreak. This recall must be validated by at least one of these sources: an official communication on Hillshire Farm's website or social media, a press release from Hillshire Farm, a notification from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically referencing a Hillshire Farm recall, or reports from a minimum of three major news agencies (such as Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources. The recall must clearly state listeria as the reason for the withdrawal of the product. If no such recall that meets these criteria is announced by the specified date, this part will be considered negative.

(b) By July 31, 2024, the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) formally issues a recall for any ground ginger products due to lead contamination. This recall must be confirmed through official announcements from the FDA or reports from at least two major news outlets (like Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Washington Post). A recall is defined as an official request by the FDA for manufacturers to withdraw their products from the market. Alerts or warnings without an official recall do not qualify for a positive resolution. If no such recall is issued by the resolution date, this part will be considered negative.

The overall inquiry will be affirmative if either (a) or (b) results in an affirmative answer.

question.title: Will Zoom lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Zoom has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Zoom confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution.

para_P.title: Is it true that Zoom will terminate at least 1,800 staff members by July 2024?

The layoffs must be directly associated with the AI-centric restructuring plan introduced in 2023. Should Zoom verify a lesser number of layoffs, or if there is a lack of confirmation that meets these standards by the deadline for resolution, the outcome will be negative. para_P.title: By July 2024, will both of the following take place: (a) PayPal will have laid off no fewer than 1,800 employees, and (b) Zoom will have laid off fewer than 1,800 employees, in connection with their respective AI-driven restructuring strategies?

question.title: Will either Zoom or PayPal lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?

para_P.title: Is it possible that either Zoom or PayPal will terminate at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?

question.title: Will the United States maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made textiles through August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, as of August 31, 2024, the United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made textiles. The existence and rate of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

para_P.title: Will the United States uphold a full 100% tariff on textiles produced in China until August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if, on August 31, 2024, the United States is still enforcing a 100% tariff on the importation of textiles manufactured in China. The presence and percentage of the tariff must be confirmed through official sources from the U.S. government (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and supported by at least two credible news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is lowered below 100% or entirely eliminated at any time up to and including August 31, 2024, the outcome will be NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are clearly indicated as temporary and do not permanently change the 100% rate will not influence the resolution of this inquiry.

question.title: Will the United States maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made footwear through August 2024 AND reduce or remove the 100% tariff on Chinese-made textiles before September 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) As of August 31, 2024, the United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made footwear. The existence and rate of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff on footwear is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the condition will not be met. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect this condition. (2) At any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the United States reduces the tariff below 100% or completely removes it on imports of Chinese-made textiles. The change in the tariff rate must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect this condition. If the 100% tariff on textiles is maintained continuously through August 31, 2024, the condition will not be met. The question will resolve as NO if either of these conditions is not met.

para_P.title: Will the U.S. continue to enforce a full 100% tariff on shoes manufactured in China until August 2024 AND lower or eliminate the 100% tariff on Chinese textiles before September 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) By August 31, 2024, the U.S. persists in applying a 100% tariff on imports of footwear produced in China. The presence and percentage of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government channels (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and confirmed by at least two credible news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the footwear tariff is lowered below 100% or entirely removed at any time up to and including August 31, 2024, this condition will not be fulfilled. Temporary suspensions or exemptions of the tariff that are clearly designated as temporary and do not permanently change the 100% rate will not influence this condition. (2) At any time up to and including August 31, 2024, the U.S. reduces the tariff to below 100% or completely abolishes it on imports of textiles from China. The alteration in the tariff rate must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently modify the 100% rate will not impact this condition. If the 100% tariff on textiles is consistently maintained until August 31, 2024, this condition will not be satisfied. The question will be answered as NO if either of these criteria is not met.

question.title: Will the United States maintain a 100% tariff on either Chinese-made textiles or footwear through August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, as of August 31, 2024, the United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of either Chinese-made textiles or Chinese-made footwear. The existence and rate of the tariffs must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff on either Chinese-made textiles or Chinese-made footwear is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO for that category. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariffs that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

para_P.title: Will the United States continue to impose a full 100% tariff on either textiles or footwear made in China until August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if, on August 31, 2024, the United States is still enforcing a 100% tariff on the importation of either textiles or footwear produced in China. The presence and percentage of these tariffs must be verifiable through official U.S. government channels (like the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and supported by at least two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, or The New York Times). If the tariff on either Chinese-made textiles or footwear is lowered below 100% or entirely eliminated at any time up to and including August 31, 2024, the outcome will be NO for that specific category. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariffs that are clearly stated to be temporary and do not permanently change the 100% rate will not influence the resolution of this question.

question.title: Will Kansas hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Kansas officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of abortion rights. The referendum must be related to enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution or significantly altering existing abortion laws. For a YES resolution, the referendum must be officially announced by the Kansas state government and the voting process must be completed by the resolution date. The occurrence and results of the referendum must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). If no such referendum is held or completed by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely scheduling a future referendum beyond the resolution date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Will Kansas conduct a vote on abortion rights before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, Kansas officially carries out a statewide vote specifically concerning abortion rights. The vote must pertain to either establishing abortion rights in the state constitution or making significant changes to current abortion laws. For a YES outcome, the vote must be formally announced by the Kansas state government, and the electoral process must be finalized by the resolution date. The occurrence and outcome of the vote must be reported by at least two major, credible news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). If no such vote is conducted or completed by July 31, 2024, the inquiry will resolve as NO. It is important to note that simply planning a future vote beyond the resolution date does not qualify for a YES outcome.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Michigan holds a referendum on abortion rights and (b) Kansas does not hold a referendum on abortion rights?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) Michigan officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must be formally announced by the Michigan state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Michigan-based news outlets). The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in Michigan and focus primarily on abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, this condition will not be met. (b) Kansas does not officially conduct a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of abortion rights. The referendum must not be related to enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution or significantly altering existing abortion laws. For this condition to be met, the referendum must not be officially announced by the Kansas state government and the voting process must not be completed by the resolution date. The non-occurrence or lack of results of the referendum must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). If such a referendum is held or completed by July 31, 2024, this condition will not be met. Both conditions (a) and (b) must be satisfied for this question to resolve as YES. If either condition is not met, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will both of these events take place: (a) a referendum regarding abortion rights is held in Michigan and (b) a referendum on abortion rights is not held in Kansas?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if the following two criteria are fulfilled by July 31, 2024: (a) Michigan must carry out a statewide referendum explicitly concerning the inclusion of abortion rights in the state constitution. This referendum needs to be officially declared by the Michigan state authorities and confirmed by at least two prominent news organizations (like Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or significant Michigan news outlets). The referendum should be accessible to all qualified voters in Michigan and primarily address abortion rights. If such a referendum does not take place or is not concluded by the resolution date, or if it is canceled or postponed past July 31, 2024, this condition will not be satisfied. (b) Kansas must not hold a statewide referendum specifically focused on abortion rights. This referendum should not pertain to the inclusion of abortion rights in the state constitution or significantly modify existing abortion regulations. For this condition to be fulfilled, the referendum must not be officially announced by the Kansas state authorities, and the voting must not be finalized by the resolution date. The absence or lack of results from the referendum must be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). If such a referendum is conducted or finalized by July 31, 2024, this condition will not be met. Both conditions (a) and (b) must be satisfied for this question to resolve as YES. If either condition fails, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will either Kansas or Michigan hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, either Kansas or Michigan officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of abortion rights. 

For Kansas: The referendum must be related to enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution or significantly altering existing abortion laws. It must be officially announced by the Kansas state government, with the voting process completed by the resolution date. The occurrence and results must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). Merely scheduling a future referendum beyond the resolution date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

For Michigan: The referendum must be formally announced by the Michigan state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Michigan-based news outlets). It must be open to all eligible voters in Michigan and focus primarily on abortion rights. If the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, it will resolve as NO.

If either state completes such a referendum by July 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If neither state conducts a referendum by this date, it resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will a referendum concerning abortion rights be held in either Kansas or Michigan before July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, either Kansas or Michigan carries out an official statewide referendum explicitly addressing abortion rights. 

Regarding Kansas: The referendum must pertain to the establishment of abortion rights within the state constitution or a significant modification of current abortion regulations. It must be officially declared by the Kansas state government, with the voting finalized by the resolution date. The event and its outcomes must be confirmed by no fewer than two major, credible news outlets (like Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or prominent national newspapers). Simply scheduling a future referendum after the resolution date does not count as a YES resolution.

Concerning Michigan: The referendum must be officially announced by the Michigan state government and corroborated by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or significant Michigan-based news agencies). It must be accessible to all eligible voters in Michigan and primarily focus on abortion rights. If the referendum is canceled or delayed past July 31, 2024, it will be resolved as NO.

If either state successfully conducts such a referendum by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as YES. If neither state holds a referendum by this deadline, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Virginia's Medicaid plan with work requirements enroll at least 25,000 beneficiaries by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Virginia's Medicaid plan, which includes a work requirement, has enrolled at least 25,000 low-income residents. Enrollment figures must be confirmed by official state reports, the Virginia Department of Medical Assistance Services, or at least three widely recognized news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The plan must maintain its work requirement feature throughout the period. If the enrollment is below 25,000 by the resolution date, or if the work requirement is removed from the plan, the question resolves as NO. In case of any legal challenges or federal interventions that significantly alter the plan's structure or implementation, the question will still resolve based on the enrollment numbers of the original plan or its closest equivalent.

para_P.title: Is Virginia's Medicaid initiative with employment prerequisites expected to include a minimum of 25,000 participants by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, Virginia's Medicaid initiative, which incorporates an employment prerequisite, has included at least 25,000 low-income individuals. Enrollment statistics must be validated by official state documents, the Virginia Department of Medical Assistance Services, or by at least three reputable news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The initiative must retain its employment prerequisite throughout the timeframe. If the enrollment falls short of 25,000 by the resolution date, or if the employment prerequisite is eliminated from the initiative, the inquiry will conclude with a NO. In the event of any legal disputes or federal actions that significantly modify the initiative's framework or execution, the inquiry will still resolve based on the enrollment figures of the original initiative or its nearest equivalent.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Apple Inc. resolves a major workers' strike and (b) Virginia's Medicaid plan with work requirements enrolls fewer than 25,000 beneficiaries?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024:

(a) Apple Inc. reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike. For the resolution to be considered valid:
   1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Apple Inc. workers (at least 1,000 participants).
   2. The strike must last for at least one week.
   3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Apple Inc. and the involved union.
   4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).
   If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the condition is not met.

(b) Virginia's Medicaid plan, which includes a work requirement, enrolls fewer than 25,000 low-income residents. Enrollment figures must be confirmed by official state reports, the Virginia Department of Medical Assistance Services, or at least three widely recognized news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The plan must maintain its work requirement feature throughout the period. If the enrollment is at least 25,000 by the resolution date, and the work requirement is not removed from the plan, the condition is not met. In case of any legal challenges or federal interventions that significantly alter the plan's structure or implementation, the question will still resolve based on the enrollment numbers of the original plan or its closest equivalent.

Only if both (a) and (b) occur as described will the question resolve as YES. Otherwise, it resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) Apple Inc. successfully negotiates an end to a significant workers' strike, and (b) fewer than 25,000 beneficiaries are enrolled in Virginia's Medicaid program with work requirements?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of these conditions are satisfied by July 31, 2024:

(a) Apple Inc. comes to a resolution with its unionized workforce, leading to the conclusion of a major strike. For this resolution to be deemed valid:
   1. The strike must involve a considerable number of Apple Inc. employees (minimum of 1,000 participants).
   2. The strike must endure for a minimum of one week.
   3. The agreement must be validated by official announcements from both Apple Inc. and the relevant union.
   4. The resolution must be covered by at least two credible international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).
   If such a resolution that meets all these requirements is not achieved by the specified deadline, or if no significant strike takes place, the condition is not fulfilled.

(b) Virginia's Medicaid program, which has a work requirement, must enroll fewer than 25,000 low-income individuals. Enrollment data must be validated by official state documents, the Virginia Department of Medical Assistance Services, or at least three widely respected news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The work requirement must remain in effect throughout this period. If enrollment reaches 25,000 or more by the resolution date, and the work requirement is not eliminated from the program, the condition is not satisfied. Any legal disputes or federal actions that significantly change the program's framework or execution will not affect the resolution, which will still be based on the enrollment figures of the original program or its closest equivalent.

The question will only resolve as YES if both (a) and (b) occur as outlined. If not, it will resolve as NO.

For the resolution to be considered valid: The strike must involve a substantial number of Apple Inc. workers (at least 1,000 participants), last for at least one week, and the resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Apple Inc. and the involved union. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC). If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Virginia's Medicaid program to enroll a minimum of 25,000 beneficiaries or for Apple Inc. to settle a significant workers' strike before July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as YES if one of the following takes place by July 31, 2024:

(a) Virginia's Medicaid program, which includes a work requirement, successfully enrolls at least 25,000 low-income individuals. If the enrollment falls short of 25,000 by the resolution date, or if the work requirement is eliminated from the program, the inquiry will resolve as NO. Additionally, the resolution must be reported by at least two respected international news organizations (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC). If such a resolution that meets all these conditions is not achieved by the designated date, or if no significant strike occurs, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Michigan remove the work requirement from its Medicaid plan by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of Michigan officially announces the removal of the work requirement from its Medicaid plan. The change must be confirmed through official state announcements or reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The work requirement refers to the condition that beneficiaries must work or engage in other qualifying activities to receive Medicaid benefits. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the work requirement remains in place, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the work requirement for Medicaid in Michigan be eliminated by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, Michigan's state government publicly declares the elimination of the work requirement from its Medicaid program. This alteration must be verified through official announcements from the state or reported by at least two prominent news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or leading national newspapers). The work requirement pertains to the stipulation that beneficiaries are obligated to work or participate in other qualifying activities in order to receive Medicaid benefits. question.title: Will Pedro Sánchez remain the Prime Minister of Spain through July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Pedro Sánchez continues to hold the position of Prime Minister of Spain through July 31, 2024. Confirmation must come from official Spanish government records or credible news reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., El País, El Mundo, Reuters, AFP). The question will resolve as NO if Sánchez leaves or is removed from the position at any point before or during July 2024. For the purpose of this question, temporary absences due to illness or vacation do not count as leaving the position.

The inquiry will be considered negative if Sánchez departs from or is ousted from the role at any time prior to or during July 2024. Temporary absences due to illness or vacation do not count as leaving the position. para_P.title: Will either Pedro Sánchez continue as the Prime Minister of Spain or will Boris Johnson stay as the Prime Minister of the UK until the end of July 2024?

question.title: Will Louisiana's near-total abortion ban be declared constitutional by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a court ruling confirms the constitutionality of Louisiana's near-total abortion ban. The confirmation must come from a Louisiana state court and be reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major US newspapers). If the ban is not declared constitutional by the specified date, or if a court rules it unconstitutional, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, a 'near-total abortion ban' refers to the law that was blocked and is pending assessment, as mentioned in the article dated October 1, 2023.

para_P.title: Will the constitutionality of Louisiana's almost complete abortion prohibition be upheld by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by August 31, 2024, a judicial decision affirms the constitutionality of Louisiana's almost complete abortion prohibition. The affirmation must originate from a Louisiana state court and be covered by at least two credible national news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or leading US newspapers). If the prohibition is not upheld as constitutional by the given date, or if a court determines it to be unconstitutional, the inquiry will resolve as NO. For the purposes of this question, an 'almost complete abortion prohibition' refers to the legislation that was blocked and is awaiting evaluation, as referenced in the article dated October 1, 2023.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (1) Missouri conducts a referendum on abortion rights and (2) Louisiana's near-total abortion ban is not declared constitutional?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024:

1. Missouri conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For this to resolve as YES:
   - The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Missouri.
   - The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
   - The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.
   If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, this part resolves as NO.

2. Louisiana's near-total abortion ban is not declared constitutional. This resolves as YES if:
   - No court ruling confirms the constitutionality of the ban by the specified date.
   - There is no confirmation of constitutionality reported by at least two reputable national news sources.
   If the ban is declared unconstitutional, or if there is no confirmation of constitutionality, this part resolves as YES; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

Both conditions must be met for the overall question to resolve as YES. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

1. Missouri holds a public vote specifically aimed at establishing protections for abortion rights within the state. For this to be deemed affirmative:

   - The main focus of the vote must be on safeguarding abortion rights.
   - The outcomes of the vote must be publicly disclosed through official state channels or widely acknowledged news outlets.
   If such a vote does not take place by the designated date, this aspect resolves as negative.

2. Louisiana's near-total abortion prohibition is not affirmed as constitutional. This will be considered affirmative if:
   - No judicial decision validates the constitutionality of the prohibition by the specified date.
   - There is no verification of constitutionality reported by at least two credible national news organizations.
   If the prohibition is declared unconstitutional, or if there is no validation of constitutionality, this aspect resolves as affirmative; otherwise, it resolves as negative.

Both criteria must be fulfilled for the overall inquiry to resolve positively. If either criterion is unmet, the inquiry resolves negatively.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of South Korea announce a new digital payment system by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of South Korea officially announces the launch of a new digital payment system. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of South Korea communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of South Korea. The announcement should explicitly state the introduction of the digital payment system. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of South Korea does not announce a new digital payment system, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will South Korea's Central Bank reveal a new digital payment system before August 2024?

The statement should clearly indicate the launch of the digital payment system. Additionally, the announcement must be covered by at least two prominent financial news organizations (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be deemed valid. If no such declaration occurs by the specified deadline, or if the Central Bank of South Korea fails to announce a new digital payment system, the response will be NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Central Bank of Mexico announces an interest rate cut by July 2024, and (b) The Central Bank of South Korea does not announce a new digital payment system by August 2024?
question.body:
(a) The Central Bank of Mexico must officially announce a decrease in its target for the overnight interbank interest rate by July 31, 2024. This announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Central Bank of Mexico or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Board of Governors and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual Central Bank of Mexico members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, this part resolves as NO.

(b) The Central Bank of South Korea must not officially announce the launch of a new digital payment system by August 31, 2024. If no announcement is made from an official Central Bank of South Korea communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of South Korea, explicitly stating the introduction of the digital payment system, or if the announcement is not reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times), then this part resolves as YES. If such an announcement is made by the specified date, this part resolves as NO.

The combined question resolves as YES if both (a) the Central Bank of Mexico announces the interest rate cut by the specified date and (b) the Central Bank of South Korea does not announce the new digital payment system by the specified date. Otherwise, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will China's central bank's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if China's central bank's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the People's Bank of China or a relevant Chinese government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, South China Morning Post). If no such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

question.title: Will Green Acres Co. be officially linked to a new salmonella outbreak by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Green Acres Co. is officially linked to a new salmonella outbreak that is different from any previously reported outbreaks. The link must be confirmed by U.S. federal health officials (such as the CDC or FDA) and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post). The outbreak must be traced back to products from Green Acres Co. and must have occurred after October 1, 2023. If no such new outbreak is linked to Green Acres Co. by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Nigeria's Senate pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Tinubu by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Nigeria's Senate passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Bola Tinubu or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the Senate, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Tinubu or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Nigerian economy.

If no such bill is passed by the Senate by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Nigeria's Senate to approve a significant economic reform legislation that President Tinubu is against by August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Nigeria's Senate approves a significant economic reform legislation that is clearly opposed by President Bola Tinubu or his administration. To be eligible:

2. It must be approved by the Senate, regardless of whether it is enacted into law.
3. The opposition from President Tinubu or his administration must be explicitly reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The legislation must be characterized as 'major' or 'significant' by these news outlets in terms of its potential effect on the Nigerian economy.

If no such legislation is approved by the Senate by August 31, 2024, or if a legislation is approved but fails to meet all the aforementioned criteria, the inquiry resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Bayer allows generic production of its cardiovascular drug by July 2024, and (b) Nigeria's Senate fails to pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Tinubu by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) By July 31, 2024, Bayer officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its cardiovascular drug, effectively not enforcing its patent. This could be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If no such announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, or if Bayer continues to enforce its patent rights, this part resolves as NO.

(b) By August 31, 2024, Nigeria's Senate does not pass a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Bola Tinubu or his administration. To qualify:
1. No bill related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy, is passed by the Senate.
2. Or, if a bill is passed by the Senate, it is not opposed by President Tinubu or his administration as clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
3. Or, the bill is not described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Nigerian economy.
If no such bill is passed by the Senate by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, this part resolves as YES.

The overall question resolves as YES only if both (a) and (b) resolve as YES.

question.title: Will TikTok's AI-driven content recommendations be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that TikTok's AI-driven content recommendations are spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention TikTok's AI and its role in spreading election misinformation. question.title: Will Colorado's near-total abortion ban be declared constitutional by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a court ruling confirms the constitutionality of Colorado's near-total abortion ban. For the purpose of this question, a 'near-total abortion ban' refers to the law that was blocked and is pending assessment, as mentioned in the article dated October 1, 2023.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if one of the following happens by August 31, 2024: (a) A judicial decision affirms the constitutionality of Colorado's near-total abortion restriction, confirmed by a Colorado state court and at least two credible national news outlets (like Associated Press, Reuters, or prominent US newspapers). If neither (a) nor (b) occurs by the given date, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will Spain eliminate export taxes on agricultural products by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Spanish government officially announces or implements a policy to completely eliminate export taxes on agricultural products. The policy must be confirmed by official government communications or reported by at least two reputable international news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or Associated Press). Partial reductions in export taxes or the elimination of taxes on only some agricultural products will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If no such policy is introduced or implemented by the resolution date, or if only partial measures are taken, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Spain remove export duties on agricultural goods by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, the Spanish government officially declares or enacts a policy to entirely abolish export duties on agricultural goods. The policy must be validated by official government announcements or covered by at least two credible international news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or Associated Press). Any partial cuts in export duties or the removal of duties on only specific agricultural goods will not be adequate for an affirmative resolution. If no such policy is introduced or executed by the resolution date, or if only partial actions are taken, the inquiry resolves as negative.

question.title: Will the United States report a bumper harvest for both corn and soybeans by August 2024 and will Spain maintain export taxes on some or all agricultural products beyond July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) By August 31, 2024, the United States officially reports a bumper harvest for both corn and soybeans, indicating higher than average yields compared to the previous five-year average. A bumper harvest is defined as a crop yield that is significantly above average, typically at least 10% higher than the five-year average. Confirmation must come from official reports by the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) or at least three reputable news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Wall Street Journal). If a bumper harvest is reported for only one of the crops (either corn or soybeans) but not both, or if no bumper harvest is reported for either crop, this part resolves as NO. (b) By July 31, 2024, the Spanish government does not officially announce or implement a policy to completely eliminate export taxes on agricultural products. If no such policy is introduced or implemented by the resolution date, or if only partial measures are taken, this part resolves as YES. The policy must be confirmed by official government communications or reported by at least two reputable international news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or Associated Press). Partial reductions in export taxes or the elimination of taxes on only some agricultural products will be sufficient for a YES resolution. The overall question resolves as YES only if both conditions (a) and (b) are satisfied.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will the United States announce an exceptional harvest for both corn and soybeans, and will Spain continue to impose export taxes on some or all agricultural goods past July 2024?

Confirmation must be sourced from official reports by the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) or at least three credible news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Wall Street Journal). If an exceptional harvest is reported for only one of the crops (either corn or soybeans) but not both, or if neither crop reports an exceptional harvest, this segment will resolve as NO. (b) By July 31, 2024, the Spanish government does not officially declare or execute a policy to entirely abolish export taxes on agricultural goods. If such a policy is not introduced or enacted by the resolution date, or if only partial actions are taken, this segment resolves as YES. The policy must be validated by official government announcements or reported by at least two reputable international news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or Associated Press). Partial reductions in export taxes or the removal of taxes on only certain agricultural goods will suffice for a YES conclusion. The overall inquiry resolves as YES only if both criteria (a) and (b) are met.

Confirmation must come from official reports by the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) or at least three reputable news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Wall Street Journal).

para_P.title: Is it possible that by August 2024, either (a) Spain abolishes export taxes on agricultural goods, or (b) the United States announces an exceptionally high harvest for both corn and soybeans?

question.title: Will Missouri hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Missouri officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must be formally announced by the Missouri state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Missouri-based news outlets). The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in Missouri and focus primarily on abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. question.title: Will the World Health Organization declare the current West Nile virus outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing West Nile virus outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted heightened public health responses globally. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will the World Health Organization announce the termination of the ongoing West Nile virus outbreak by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if the World Health Organization (WHO) publicly states that the current West Nile virus outbreak is concluded by August 31, 2024. question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Land O'Frost issues a recall of deli meats due to a listeria outbreak and (b) the WHO does not declare the current West Nile virus outbreak over?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024:

(a) Land O'Frost officially announces a recall of any of its deli meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:
   1. An official announcement on Land O'Frost's website or social media channels
   2. A press release from Land O'Frost
   3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Land O'Frost recall
   4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources
   The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal.

(b) The World Health Organization (WHO) does not officially declare the ongoing West Nile virus outbreak over. This includes scenarios where no declaration is made, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024. If both conditions are met, the question will resolve as YES. If either or both conditions are not met, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the average rate on a 15-year mortgage in the US fall below 5.0% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage in the United States, as reported by Freddie Mac in their Primary Mortgage Market Survey, falls below 5.0% at any point. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. If the rate does not fall below 5.0% by the specified date, or if Freddie Mac discontinues reporting this metric, the question will resolve as NO. For clarity, a rate of exactly 5.0% will not be considered as falling below 5.0%.
