question.title: Will Iowa's 6-week abortion ban be overturned by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Iowa's law banning most abortions after approximately six weeks of pregnancy is either repealed by the state legislature or invalidated by a court ruling. The repeal or invalidation must be confirmed by official state announcements or reported by at least two reputable news sources. If the law remains in effect as of July 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'overturned' means the law is no longer enforceable in its current form, either through legislative action or judicial decision.

para_P.title: Will the six-week abortion restriction in Iowa be nullified by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, Iowa's legislation prohibiting the majority of abortions after around six weeks of pregnancy is either revoked by the state legislature or struck down by a court ruling. The revocation or judicial decision must be verified by official state communications or reported by at least two credible news organizations. If the law is still in force as of July 31, 2024, the answer will be NO. In this context, 'nullified' means the law is no longer applicable in its existing form, whether through legislative measures or judicial verdict.

question.title: Will both Colorado's abortion law allowing procedures up to 22 weeks remain unchanged by August 2024 and Iowa's 6-week abortion ban remain in effect through July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following occur: (1) By August 31, 2024, Colorado's current abortion law permitting abortions up to 22 weeks remains in effect without any changes. The status of the law must be confirmed by official state legislative records or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or local Colorado newspapers). If the law is modified, replaced, or overturned by the specified date, the question resolves as NO. This includes any changes that either restrict or expand the current 22-week limit. (2) By July 31, 2024, Iowa's law banning most abortions after approximately six weeks of pregnancy remains in effect and is not repealed by the state legislature or invalidated by a court ruling. The continued enforcement of the law must be confirmed by the absence of official state announcements or lack of reports by at least two reputable news sources indicating its repeal or invalidation. If the law is overturned as of July 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'remain in effect' means the law is still enforceable in its current form, with no legislative action or judicial decision rendering it void.

The repeal or invalidation must be confirmed by official state announcements or reported by at least two reputable news sources. For this part, 'overturned' means the law is no longer enforceable in its current form, either through legislative action or judicial decision. (b) By August 31, 2024, Colorado's current abortion law permitting abortions up to 22 weeks is modified, replaced, or overturned. This includes any changes that either restrict or expand the current 22-week limit. The status of the law must be confirmed by official state legislative records or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or local Colorado newspapers). If neither event occurs by the specified dates, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that by August 2024, one of the following will take place: (a) the repeal of Iowa's six-week abortion restriction by July 2024, or (b) an amendment to Colorado's abortion legislation that permits procedures up to 22 weeks by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if at least one of these scenarios occurs: (a) By July 31, 2024, Iowa's statute prohibiting most abortions after roughly six weeks of gestation is either annulled by the state legislature or rendered invalid by a court ruling. question.title: Will another U.S. state adopt a Medicaid plan with a mental health support requirement by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes a mental health support requirement for beneficiaries. The mental health support requirement must be a key component of the plan. For a positive resolution, there must be an official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The plan must be officially adopted, not merely proposed or under consideration. If no other state adopts such a plan by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for an additional U.S. state to implement a Medicaid program that mandates mental health support by July 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with YES if, by July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state, excluding Georgia, formally implements a Medicaid program that requires mental health support for its beneficiaries. question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Tennessee conducts a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024, and (b) no other U.S. state adopts a Medicaid plan with a mental health support requirement by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following occur:

(a) By August 31, 2024, Tennessee conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. The criteria for this are:
   1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Tennessee.
   2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
   3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.
   If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, this part will resolve as NO.

(b) By July 31, 2024, no U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes a mental health support requirement for beneficiaries. The criteria for this are:
   1. The mental health support requirement must be a key component of the plan.
   2. There must be no official announcement from any state government or state's Medicaid agency, and no consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post).
   3. The plan must not be officially adopted, only proposed or under consideration.
   If another state adopts such a plan by July 31, 2024, this part will resolve as NO.

The question will resolve as YES only if both (a) and (b) resolve as YES.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris announce her running mate at a rally in Miami by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris publicly announces her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in Miami, Florida. The announcement must be made by Harris herself during the rally and must clearly identify the individual chosen as her running mate. The event and announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally. If Harris does not make such an announcement at a Miami rally by the end of August 2024, or if the announcement is made through other means or at a different location, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will a major social media platform be reported for spreading election misinformation through its AI systems by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that a major social media platform is spreading election misinformation through its AI systems. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the platform and its AI systems' role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India officially announces a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of India or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual RBI members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

Any conjecture regarding potential rate cuts or unofficial remarks by individual RBI officials will not be sufficient for resolution. If no such formal announcement regarding an interest rate reduction is made by the resolution deadline, the inquiry will be resolved as negative.

(2) The Reserve Bank of India does not officially announce a decrease in its repo rate. If either of these conditions is not fulfilled, the outcome will be NO.

question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs by July 31, 2024: (a) President Joe Biden delivers a speech at any National Education Association (NEA) event held in Illinois, confirmed by official White House announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources; or (b) the state of California is confirmed to have been awarded more than $300 million in federal grants specifically for electric vehicle manufacturing, assembly, or related projects, with confirmation from official U.S. government sources or reports by at least two major national news organizations. If neither event occurs by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, is it possible that either of the following happens: (a) President Biden gives a speech at a National Education Association gathering in Illinois, or (b) California secures more than $300 million in federal funding for electric vehicle initiatives?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if at least one of the following takes place by July 31, 2024: (a) President Joe Biden speaks at any National Education Association (NEA) event occurring in Illinois, verified by official announcements from the White House or reports from a minimum of two credible news outlets; or (b) it is confirmed that California has received over $300 million in federal grants intended for electric vehicle production, assembly, or associated projects, with verification from official U.S. government sources or reports from at least two prominent national news organizations. If neither of these events occurs by the specified resolution date, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will a major hospital system in the Northeast US cancel over $300 million in medical debt by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a hospital system based in the Northeast United States, in collaboration with a nonprofit organization, successfully cancels more than $300 million in medical debt for at least 150,000 patients across multiple Northeastern states. The cancellation must be officially announced by the hospital system or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The debt cancellation should target patients who are considered financially needy or unable to pay. If the debt cancellation is not completed or officially confirmed by the specified date, or if the amount cancelled is $300 million or less, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is a significant healthcare provider in the Northeast US going to eliminate over $300 million in medical liabilities by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, a healthcare provider located in the Northeastern United States, in partnership with a nonprofit entity, successfully eliminates more than $300 million in medical liabilities for no fewer than 150,000 patients across various Northeastern states. The cancellation must be publicly announced by the healthcare provider or covered by at least two prominent news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The debt relief should focus on patients deemed financially disadvantaged or unable to pay. If the cancellation is not finalized or officially recognized by the specified deadline, or if the amount canceled is $300 million or less, the inquiry will be deemed negative.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Hyundai Motor Company resolves a major workers' strike by July 2024, and (b) no major hospital system in the Northeast US cancels over $300 million in medical debt by August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Hyundai Motor Company reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For this condition to be met:
   1. The strike must involve at least 1,000 Hyundai Motor Company workers.
   2. The strike must last for at least one week.
   3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Hyundai Motor Company and the involved union.
   4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

(b) By August 31, 2024, no hospital system based in the Northeast United States, in collaboration with a nonprofit organization, successfully cancels more than $300 million in medical debt for at least 150,000 patients across multiple Northeastern states. Alternatively, this condition is met if the cancellation is not officially announced by the hospital system or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The debt cancellation should target patients who are considered financially needy or unable to pay.

If both conditions are met, the question resolves as YES. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that the following will happen: (a) Hyundai Motor Company settles a significant workers' strike by July 2024, and (b) no major hospital network in the Northeast US eliminates over $300 million in medical debt by August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of these conditions are satisfied:

(a) Hyundai Motor Company comes to a resolution with its unionized workforce, leading to the conclusion of a substantial strike by July 31, 2024. For this condition to be fulfilled:
   1. The strike must engage at least 1,000 workers from Hyundai Motor Company.
   2. The strike must persist for a minimum of one week.
   3. The resolution must be validated through official announcements from both Hyundai Motor Company and the relevant union.
   4. The resolution must be covered by no fewer than two credible international news organizations (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

(b) By August 31, 2024, no hospital network located in the Northeastern United States, in partnership with a nonprofit organization, successfully abolishes more than $300 million in medical debt for at least 150,000 patients across several Northeastern states. Alternatively, this condition is satisfied if the cancellation is not formally declared by the hospital network or reported by at least two prominent news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The debt relief should focus on patients deemed financially vulnerable or unable to afford payment.

If both conditions are met, the inquiry will resolve as YES. If either condition is unmet, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

   2. The strike must last for at least one week.
   3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Hyundai Motor Company and the involved union.
   4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If neither of these events occurs by their respective dates, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that a prominent healthcare system in the Northeastern United States will eliminate over $300 million in medical debt by August 2024, or that Hyundai Motor Company will settle a significant labor strike by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This question is answered with YES if at least one of the following conditions is met:

(a) By August 31, 2024, a healthcare system located in the Northeastern United States, in partnership with a nonprofit organization, effectively cancels more than $300 million in medical debt for at least 150,000 patients across various Northeastern states. The debt cancellation must be publicly announced by the healthcare system or reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The cancellation should focus on patients who are deemed financially disadvantaged or unable to pay.

If neither of these scenarios occurs by their respective deadlines, the question will be answered as NO.

question.title: Will the SEC announce completion of a major insider trading investigation by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) officially announces the completion of its investigation into insider trading practices involving at least five major companies. Completion must be confirmed through an official SEC announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the SEC does not announce the completion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation is still ongoing, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the SEC declare the conclusion of a significant insider trading probe by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) publicly announces that its investigation into insider trading activities involving at least five prominent companies has been completed. The conclusion must be validated through an official SEC statement or reported by a minimum of two major news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the SEC fails to announce the conclusion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation remains ongoing, the inquiry will be resolved as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Central Bank of Australia announces a new fiscal policy initiative by August 2024 (b) The SEC does not announce completion of a major insider trading investigation by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) By August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Australia officially announces a new fiscal policy initiative. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of Australia communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of Australia. The announcement should explicitly describe the new fiscal policy initiative. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. (b) By July 31, 2024, the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) does not officially announce the completion of its investigation into insider trading practices involving at least five major companies. This could be because the investigation is still ongoing or has not been confirmed through an official SEC announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If either of these conditions is not met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it the case that both of the following will happen: (a) By August 2024, the Central Bank of Australia will unveil a new fiscal policy initiative (b) The SEC will refrain from declaring the conclusion of a significant insider trading investigation by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of the following stipulations are satisfied: (a) By August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Australia makes an official announcement regarding a new fiscal policy initiative. This announcement must originate from an authorized communication channel of the Central Bank of Australia, such as a press release or a public address by the Governor of the Central Bank of Australia. The announcement should clearly outline the new fiscal policy initiative and must be reported by at least two prominent financial news organizations (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be deemed valid. (b) By July 31, 2024, the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) does not make an official statement regarding the conclusion of its insider trading investigation involving at least five major firms. This could be due to the investigation still being in progress or not being confirmed through an official SEC announcement or reported by at least two leading news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If either of these conditions fails to be met, the inquiry will be answered with a NO.

question.title: Will either the SEC announce completion of a major insider trading investigation by July 2024, or the Central Bank of Australia announce a new fiscal policy initiative by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) By July 31, 2024, the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) officially announces the completion of its investigation into insider trading practices involving at least five major companies. Completion must be confirmed through an official SEC announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). (b) By August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Australia officially announces a new fiscal policy initiative. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of Australia communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of Australia, and should explicitly describe the new fiscal policy initiative. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times). If neither of these events occurs by their respective dates, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the SEC will declare the conclusion of a significant insider trading investigation by July 2024, or that the Reserve Bank of Australia will introduce a new fiscal policy by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if one of the following scenarios takes place: (a) By July 31, 2024, the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) makes an official declaration regarding the conclusion of its investigation into insider trading activities involving at least five prominent companies. This conclusion must be verified through an official announcement from the SEC or covered by a minimum of two major news organizations (like Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). (b) By August 31, 2024, the Reserve Bank of Australia makes an official announcement regarding a new fiscal policy initiative. This announcement must originate from an official communication channel of the Reserve Bank of Australia, such as a press release or a public address by the Governor of the Reserve Bank of Australia, and should clearly outline the new fiscal policy initiative. The announcement must also be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times). If neither of these situations occurs by the specified dates, the inquiry will be answered with NO.

question.title: Will Virginia maintain its current legal stance on abortion access by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Virginia Supreme Court has not reversed or significantly altered its 2023 decision that struck down state laws regulating abortion providers more strictly than other health care providers and banned a common second-trimester procedure. The question will resolve as NO if, by July 31, 2024, the Virginia Supreme Court has reversed this decision, reinstated stricter regulations on abortion providers, or reinstated the ban on the second-trimester procedure. The resolution will be based on official court decisions or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

para_P.title: Will Virginia uphold its existing legal position regarding abortion access by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Virginia Supreme Court has neither overturned nor made significant changes to its 2023 ruling that invalidated state laws imposing stricter regulations on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers and prohibited a common second-trimester procedure. Conversely, the answer will be NO if, by July 31, 2024, the Virginia Supreme Court has overturned this ruling, reinstated stricter regulations on abortion providers, or reinstated the prohibition on the second-trimester procedure. The conclusion will rely on official court rulings or credible reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

question.title: Will both Florida maintain and Virginia change their current legal stances on abortion access by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, both of the following occur: (a) The Florida Supreme Court has not reversed or significantly altered its 2023 decision that struck down state laws regulating abortion providers more strictly than other health care providers and banned a common second-trimester procedure. (b) The Virginia Supreme Court has reversed or significantly altered its 2023 decision that struck down state laws regulating abortion providers more strictly than other health care providers and banned a common second-trimester procedure. The question will resolve as NO if either Florida reverses its decision or Virginia does not change its decision by the specified date. The resolution will be based on official court decisions or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

para_P.title: Will the current legal positions on abortion access remain unchanged in Florida while being altered in Virginia by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if, by July 31, 2024, both of the following conditions are met: (a) The Florida Supreme Court has neither reversed nor significantly modified its 2023 ruling that invalidated state regulations on abortion providers that were more stringent than those applied to other healthcare providers and prohibited a common second-trimester procedure. (b) The Virginia Supreme Court has reversed or significantly amended its 2023 ruling that invalidated state regulations on abortion providers that were more stringent than those applied to other healthcare providers and prohibited a common second-trimester procedure. The inquiry will be marked as NO if either Florida changes its ruling or Virginia fails to amend its ruling by the given deadline. The resolution will rely on official court rulings or credible reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

question.title: Will either Virginia or Florida maintain their current legal stance on abortion access by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, either the Virginia Supreme Court or the Florida Supreme Court has not reversed or significantly altered their respective 2023 decisions that struck down state laws regulating abortion providers more strictly than other health care providers and banned a common second-trimester procedure. The question will resolve as NO if, by July 31, 2024, both the Virginia Supreme Court and the Florida Supreme Court have reversed their decisions, reinstated stricter regulations on abortion providers, or reinstated the ban on the second-trimester procedure. The resolution will be based on official court decisions or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

para_P.title: Will either Virginia or Florida uphold their existing legal position regarding abortion access by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, neither the Virginia Supreme Court nor the Florida Supreme Court has overturned or significantly modified their respective 2023 rulings that invalidated state laws imposing stricter regulations on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers and prohibited a common second-trimester procedure. Conversely, the inquiry will yield a NO if, by July 31, 2024, both the Virginia Supreme Court and the Florida Supreme Court have overturned their rulings, reinstated more stringent regulations on abortion providers, or reinstated the prohibition on the second-trimester procedure. The outcome will rely on official judicial rulings or reliable reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

question.title: Will IBM lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, IBM has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If IBM confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution.

para_P.title: Is it expected that IBM will terminate a minimum of 1,800 employees by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered in the affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, IBM has officially acknowledged the termination of at least 1,800 employees as part of its reorganization strategy centered on AI. Such acknowledgment must originate from formal company statements, regulatory documents, or reports from at least two credible news organizations (like Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The job cuts must be directly associated with the AI-centered reorganization plan introduced in 2023. If IBM announces a smaller number of layoffs, or if there is no confirmation that meets these stipulations by the resolution date, the outcome will be negative. Additionally, if layoffs are implemented in stages or are partial and do not meet the 1,800 employee criteria by the resolution date, it will also lead to a negative outcome.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Tiff Macklem remains as Governor of the Bank of Canada and (b) IBM lays off fewer than 1,800 employees?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) Tiff Macklem is still serving as the Governor of the Bank of Canada on July 31, 2024. Confirmation must come from official Bank of Canada announcements or be reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, CNBC, The Wall Street Journal, or Bloomberg). If he is no longer serving as Governor by the resolution date for any reason (including but not limited to resignation, removal, or end of term), the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, any interim or acting Governor appointments will not be considered as Macklem remaining in the position. (b) IBM has confirmed the layoff of fewer than 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan, or if no confirmation meeting the criteria for the original question is made by the resolution date. Confirmation of fewer layoffs or lack of confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). If IBM confirms layoffs of at least 1,800 employees linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) Tiff Macklem continues his role as Governor of the Bank of Canada and (b) IBM will not lay off more than 1,800 workers?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of these conditions are fulfilled by July 31, 2024: (a) Tiff Macklem is still in his position as the Governor of the Bank of Canada on July 31, 2024. Verification must come from official announcements from the Bank of Canada or be reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Reuters, CNBC, The Wall Street Journal, or Bloomberg). If he is no longer in the role of Governor by the resolution date for any reason (including but not limited to resignation, removal, or end of term), the inquiry will resolve as NO. For the purposes of this inquiry, any interim or acting Governor appointments will not count as Macklem remaining in the position. (b) IBM has verified that it will lay off fewer than 1,800 employees as part of its AI-centered reorganization plan, or if there is no confirmation that meets the criteria for the original inquiry by the resolution date. Verification of fewer layoffs or the absence of confirmation must come from official company statements, regulatory documents, or reports by at least two credible news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). If IBM verifies layoffs of 1,800 employees or more associated with the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by July 2024: (a) IBM lays off at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan, or (b) Tiff Macklem remains as Governor of the Bank of Canada?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs by July 31, 2024: (a) IBM confirms the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan, with confirmation from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal), explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023; or (b) Tiff Macklem is still serving as the Governor of the Bank of Canada on July 31, 2024, with confirmation from official Bank of Canada announcements or reports by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, CNBC, The Wall Street Journal, or Bloomberg). If neither of these conditions is met by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will one of the following take place: (a) IBM will have terminated at least 1,800 employees due to its AI-centered restructuring strategy, or (b) Tiff Macklem continues his role as Governor of the Bank of Canada?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if at least one of the following happens by July 31, 2024: (a) IBM announces the dismissal of a minimum of 1,800 employees as part of its AI-centered restructuring strategy, with validation from official corporate statements, regulatory documents, or reports from no fewer than two credible news organizations (like Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal), clearly associated with the AI-centered restructuring plan revealed in 2023; or (b) Tiff Macklem is still in his position as the Governor of the Bank of Canada on July 31, 2024, with confirmation from official communications from the Bank of Canada or reports from at least two significant news outlets (such as Reuters, CNBC, The Wall Street Journal, or Bloomberg). If neither condition is satisfied by the resolution date, the outcome will be negative.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Chile announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Chile publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be officially made by the Central Bank of Chile and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the monetary policy rate, which is the Central Bank of Chile's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the Central Bank of Chile declare a decrease in its primary interest rate by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if the Central Bank of Chile officially declares a decrease in its primary interest rate by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be made publicly by the Central Bank of Chile and covered by at least two credible financial news outlets such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The decrease must pertain to the monetary policy rate, which serves as the Central Bank of Chile's main instrument for economic influence. A simple suggestion or conjecture regarding potential future rate reductions does not suffice; there must be a definitive announcement of a real rate decrease. If no such declaration occurs by the given date, the inquiry will be answered with NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) U.S. previously occupied home sales show a decline for two consecutive months by July 2024, and (b) the Central Bank of Chile not announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) By July 31, 2024, there are two consecutive months where sales of previously occupied homes in the U.S. show a decline compared to the previous month. The data must be verified by reputable sources such as the National Association of Realtors or other widely recognized real estate market analysts. The declines must be reported in terms of seasonally adjusted annual rates. If no such consecutive monthly declines are reported by the resolution date, or if only a single month shows a decline, this part resolves as NO. (2) The Central Bank of Chile does not publicly announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. The resolution criteria require that no official announcement of a rate reduction is made by the Central Bank of Chile and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. If there is only a hint or speculation about future rate cuts without a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction by the specified date, this part resolves as YES. The combined question resolves as YES only if both conditions are met.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Sales of previously owned homes in the U.S. will experience a drop for two consecutive months by July 2024, and (b) the Central Bank of Chile will not make a statement regarding a decrease in its main interest rate by August 2024?

The information must be confirmed by credible sources such as the National Association of Realtors or other well-known real estate market analysts. The declines should be reported in terms of seasonally adjusted annual rates. If no such consecutive monthly declines are recorded by the resolution date, or if only one month reflects a decline, this part will resolve as NO. (2) The Central Bank of Chile does not officially announce a decrease in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. The resolution criteria stipulate that no formal announcement of a rate reduction is made by the Central Bank of Chile and is reported by at least two trustworthy financial news outlets such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. If there is merely a suggestion or speculation about potential rate cuts without a definitive announcement of an actual rate reduction by the specified date, this part will resolve as YES. The overall question will resolve as YES only if both conditions are fulfilled.

question.title: Will either the Central Bank of Chile announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024, or U.S. previously occupied home sales show a decline for two consecutive months by July 2024?

The announcement must be officially made by the Central Bank of Chile and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the monetary policy rate, which is the Central Bank of Chile's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. The data must be verified by reputable sources such as the National Association of Realtors or other widely recognized real estate market analysts. The declines must be reported in terms of seasonally adjusted annual rates. If neither of these events occurs by their respective dates, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that the Central Bank of Chile will declare a decrease in its primary interest rate by August 2024, or that U.S. sales of previously owned homes will drop for two consecutive months by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if at least one of the following happens: (a) The Central Bank of Chile officially states a decrease in its primary interest rate by August 31, 2024. This must be a formal announcement made by the Central Bank of Chile and covered by at least two credible financial news outlets like Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The decrease must pertain to the monetary policy rate, which is the main instrument the Central Bank of Chile uses to affect the economy. Speculation or suggestions about potential rate cuts are insufficient; there must be a definitive announcement of a real rate reduction. (b) By July 31, 2024, there are two months in a row where sales of previously occupied homes in the U.S. show a decrease compared to the month prior. This data must be corroborated by reliable sources such as the National Association of Realtors or other well-known real estate market analysts. The declines should be reported in terms of seasonally adjusted annual rates. If neither occurrence takes place by their respective deadlines, the question will be answered as NO.

question.title: Will North Carolina enact a new law modifying restrictions on medical care for transgender youth by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of North Carolina enacts a new law that modifies or replaces the current restrictions on medical care for transgender youth. The enactment must be confirmed through official state legislative records and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or local North Carolina news stations). The new law must specifically address and alter the existing restrictions on medical care for transgender youth in North Carolina. If no such law is enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted law does not modify the current restrictions, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will North Carolina pass a new regulation changing the limitations on medical treatment for transgender minors before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, North Carolina passes a new regulation that changes or supersedes the existing limitations on medical treatment for transgender minors. The new regulation must explicitly address and modify the current limitations on medical treatment for transgender minors in North Carolina. If no such regulation is passed by the resolution date, or if any passed regulation does not change the existing limitations, the question will be answered with a NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Georgia will hold a referendum on healthcare reform by August 2024 and (b) North Carolina will not enact a new law modifying restrictions on medical care for transgender youth by July 2024?

This question will resolve as YES if both of the following occur:

(a) By August 31, 2024, Georgia conducts an official public referendum specifically focused on healthcare reform in the state. For a YES resolution, the referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Georgia, the primary focus must be on healthcare reform, and the results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by August 31, 2024, this part will resolve as NO.

(b) By July 31, 2024, the state of North Carolina does not enact a new law that modifies or replaces the current restrictions on medical care for transgender youth. If no such law is enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted law does not modify the current restrictions, this part resolves as YES. The enactment must be confirmed through official state legislative records and reported by at least two major news outlets. The new law must specifically address and alter the existing restrictions on medical care for transgender youth in North Carolina. If a law is enacted that modifies the current restrictions, this part resolves as NO.

The overall question will resolve as YES only if both (a) and (b) resolve as YES.

question.title: Will the World Health Organization declare the current SARS-CoV-2 outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing SARS-CoV-2 outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted the WHO to declare a Public Health Emergency of International Concern. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will the World Health Organization announce the conclusion of the current SARS-CoV-2 outbreak by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) formally announces the cessation of the ongoing SARS-CoV-2 outbreak by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be validated through official communications from the WHO or reports from at least three credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak mentioned in this inquiry is the one that led the WHO to declare a Public Health Emergency of International Concern. If no such announcement ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO prolongs the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) The Bahraini health ministry confirms more than one case of polio in Manama, and (b) The World Health Organization does not declare the current SARS-CoV-2 outbreak over?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024:

(a) The Bahraini health ministry officially confirms more than one case of polio in Manama. For this to be considered confirmed:
   1. Confirmation must come from official Bahraini health ministry reports or statements.
   2. The confirmation must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Al Jazeera).
   3. The cases must be new and separate from any cases reported before October 1, 2023.
   4. Only cases within the geographical boundaries of Manama will be considered.
   5. The type of polio (wild poliovirus or vaccine-derived poliovirus) does not matter for this question.
   If no additional cases beyond the first are confirmed by the specified date, or if only one case in total is confirmed, this condition will be NO.

(b) The World Health Organization (WHO) does not officially declare the ongoing SARS-CoV-2 outbreak over. This requires:
   - The absence of such a declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or lack of reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC).
   - The outbreak referred to is the one that prompted the WHO to declare a Public Health Emergency of International Concern.
   If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, this condition will be YES.

The question will resolve as YES only if both conditions (a) and (b) are met by the specified date.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will both of the following take place: (a) The health ministry of Bahrain acknowledges more than one instance of polio in Manama, and (b) The World Health Organization does not announce the conclusion of the current SARS-CoV-2 outbreak?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied by August 31, 2024:

(a) The health ministry of Bahrain officially recognizes more than one instance of polio in Manama. For this to count as confirmed:
   1. Confirmation must originate from official statements or reports from the Bahraini health ministry.
   2. The confirmation should be reported by at least two credible international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Al Jazeera).
   3. The cases must be novel and distinct from any reported prior to October 1, 2023.
   4. Only cases within the geographical limits of Manama will be considered.
   5. It does not matter whether the polio type is wild poliovirus or vaccine-derived poliovirus for this inquiry.
   If no additional cases beyond the first are confirmed by the given date, or if only one case in total is confirmed, this criterion will be NO.

(b) The World Health Organization (WHO) does not officially declare the ongoing SARS-CoV-2 outbreak to be over. This necessitates:
   - The lack of such a declaration must be validated through official WHO announcements or the absence of reports from at least three reputable news outlets (like Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC).
   - The outbreak in question is the one that led the WHO to declare a Public Health Emergency of International Concern.
   If no declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO prolongs the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, this condition will be YES.

The question will be resolved as YES only if both criteria (a) and (b) are fulfilled by the specified date.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Chile announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Chile publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be officially made by the Central Bank of Chile and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the monetary policy rate, which is the Central Bank of Chile's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the Central Bank of Chile will declare a decrease in its main interest rate before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if the Central Bank of Chile makes a public declaration regarding a decrease in its primary interest rate by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be officially issued by the Central Bank of Chile and reported by at least two credible financial news outlets such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The decrease must pertain to the monetary policy rate, which serves as the Central Bank of Chile's main instrument for economic influence. Simply suggesting or speculating about potential future rate cuts does not meet the criteria; there must be a definitive announcement of a real rate reduction. Should no such declaration occur by the stated date, the inquiry will be resolved as negative.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Brazil's monthly job growth falls below 50,000 in any single month by July 2024 (b) The Central Bank of Chile does not announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Brazil records a monthly job growth figure below 50,000 in any official jobs report. The data must be confirmed by the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics in their monthly employment reports. Job growth refers to the net change in employment. Revisions to previous months' data will not be considered for this question's resolution. If job growth does not fall below 50,000 in any month from October 2023 through July 2024, the question resolves as NO.

(b) This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Chile does not publicly announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. If no official announcement of a rate reduction is made by the Central Bank of Chile and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC by the specified date, the question resolves as YES. question.title: Will the Indian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Indian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation of India. The question resolves as NO if the Indian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Will India manage to steer clear of a recession before July 2024?

The response will be NO if the Indian economy undergoes two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will Illinois hold a referendum on healthcare reform by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the state of Illinois officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enacting healthcare reform in the state. The referendum must be officially announced by the Illinois Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, and must be scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must directly address the issue of healthcare reform. This question will resolve as NO if no such referendum is officially announced or conducted by the specified date. Note that merely gathering signatures for a potential referendum does not qualify for a YES resolution; the actual referendum must be scheduled or held within the specified timeframe.

para_P.title: Is a public vote on healthcare reform expected in Illinois before August 2024?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Another U.S. state adopts a Medicaid plan with a health savings account requirement by July 2024, and (b) Illinois does not hold a referendum on healthcare reform by August 2024?

The health savings account requirement must be a key component of the plan. For a positive resolution, there must be an official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The plan must be officially adopted, not merely proposed or under consideration. (b) By August 31, 2024, the state of Illinois does not officially conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enacting healthcare reform in the state. The referendum must not be officially announced by the Illinois Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, or must not be scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must not directly address the issue of healthcare reform. This question will resolve as NO if either (a) no other state adopts such a Medicaid plan by July 31, 2024, or (b) Illinois officially announces or conducts a healthcare reform referendum by August 31, 2024. question.title: Will Kamala Harris announce her running mate at a rally in Charlotte by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris publicly announces her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in Charlotte, North Carolina. The announcement must be made by Harris herself during the rally and must clearly identify the individual chosen as her running mate. The event and announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally. If Harris does not make such an announcement at a Charlotte rally by the end of August 2024, or if the announcement is made through other means or at a different location, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Minnesota holds a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024, and (2) Kamala Harris does not announce her running mate at a rally in Charlotte by August 2024?

question.title: Will Rome announce plans to restrict short-term rental units by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the city government of Rome officially announces plans or regulations aimed at restricting or limiting the availability of short-term rental units (such as those typically listed on platforms like Airbnb) within the city. The announcement must come from an official source within Rome's local government and be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. The restrictions or regulations should be specifically targeted at reducing the number of short-term rental units available to tourists or altering the way they operate. Mere discussions or proposals without a formal announcement will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If no such official announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Indiana conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:

3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Tennessee holds a referendum on healthcare funding by July 2024, and (b) Indiana does not conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?

(b) Indiana does not conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state by August 31, 2024. For this condition to be met, the following criteria must be satisfied:

question.title: Will the UK economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the UK economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the UK economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will Buenos Aires announce plans to restrict short-term rental units by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the city government of Buenos Aires officially announces plans or regulations aimed at restricting or limiting the availability of short-term rental units (such as those typically listed on platforms like Airbnb) within the city. The announcement must come from an official source within Buenos Aires's local government and be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. The restrictions or regulations should be specifically targeted at reducing the number of short-term rental units available to tourists or altering the way they operate. Mere discussions or proposals without a formal announcement will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If no such official announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Florida hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Florida officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Florida state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will the average rate on a 30-year mortgage exceed 7.0% by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, at any point during August 2024, the average rate on a 30-year fixed-rate mortgage, as reported by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, exceeds 7.0%. question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) the WHO declares the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria no longer a global emergency by August 2024, and (b) the South Korean economy enters a recession by July 2024?

2. The South Korean economy enters a recession by July 31, 2024, defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Korea. The recession must occur at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

The question resolves as NO if either or both of the conditions are not met.

question.title: Will a new AI platform be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that a new AI platform is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the new AI platform and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Indiana's near-total abortion ban be declared constitutional by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a court ruling confirms the constitutionality of Indiana's near-total abortion ban. The confirmation must come from an Indiana state court and be reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major US newspapers). If the ban is not declared constitutional by the specified date, or if a court rules it unconstitutional, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, a 'near-total abortion ban' refers to the law that was blocked and is pending assessment, as mentioned in the article dated October 1, 2023.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (1) Kamala Harris announces her running mate at a rally in San Francisco, and (2) Indiana's near-total abortion ban is declared unconstitutional?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: 

(1) Vice President Kamala Harris publicly announces her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in San Francisco, California. The announcement must be made by Harris herself during the rally and must clearly identify the individual chosen as her running mate. The event and announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally. If Harris does not make such an announcement at a San Francisco rally by the end of August 2024, or if the announcement is made through other means or at a different location, this condition will not be met.

(2) A court ruling confirms the unconstitutionality of Indiana's near-total abortion ban. The confirmation must come from an Indiana state court and be reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major US newspapers). If the ban is declared constitutional by the specified date, this condition will not be met. For the purpose of this question, a 'near-total abortion ban' refers to the law that was blocked and is pending assessment, as mentioned in the article dated October 1, 2023.

The question will resolve as NO if either or both of the conditions are not met by the specified date.

question.title: Will the Singapore Straits Times Index reach or exceed 4,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the Singapore Straits Times Index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points. The 4,000 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Singapore Exchange. If the index does not reach 4,000 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,000 points.

para_P.title: Will the Singapore Straits Times Index hit or surpass 4,000 points by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if, at any time from October 1, 2023 to August 31, 2024, the Singapore Straits Times Index hits or surpasses 4,000 points. The threshold of 4,000 points is selected as a significant marker that the index may have reached prior to a notable decline. Confirmation will rely on official index reports from credible financial market data sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Singapore Exchange. If the index fails to reach 4,000 points during this timeframe, the inquiry will resolve as NO. It is important to note that intraday peaks are considered for resolution; the index does not need to finish at or above 4,000 points.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) the WHO declares the current bird flu outbreak over and (b) the Singapore Straits Times Index fails to reach 4,000 points?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing bird flu outbreak over by August 31, 2024. This declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to is the one that prompted heightened public health responses globally. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, this condition will resolve as NO. (b) At no point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, does the Singapore Straits Times Index reach or exceed 4,000 points. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Singapore Exchange. If the index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points during this period, this condition resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,000 points. The question resolves as NO if either condition is not met.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will both of these events take place: (a) the World Health Organization announces the end of the current bird flu outbreak and (b) the Singapore Straits Times Index does not achieve 4,000 points?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if both of these criteria are fulfilled: (a) The World Health Organization (WHO) formally states that the ongoing bird flu outbreak is over by August 31, 2024. This statement must be validated through official announcements from the WHO or reports from at least three credible news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak in question is the one that led to increased public health measures worldwide. If such a declaration concluding the outbreak is not made by the resolution date, or if the WHO prolongs the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, this criterion will be answered with NO. (b) During the period from October 1, 2023, to August 31, 2024, the Singapore Straits Times Index does not reach or surpass 4,000 points at any time. Verification will rely on official index data from reputable financial market sources like Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Singapore Exchange. If the index hits or exceeds 4,000 points at any moment during this timeframe, this criterion resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs are relevant for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,000 points. The overall question resolves as NO if either of the conditions is unmet.
